column20: AI-powered grooming, made personal.
column29:
Most people struggle with skincare and grooming because the market is crowded with thousands of products, conflicting advice, and a lack of clear guidance on what works for them.

What makes it worse is that everyone‚Äôs skin is unique. A product that works wonders for one person can trigger breakouts for another. Yet, most of today‚Äôs grooming recommendations are generic, leaving people to waste money on trial and error, damaging their skin, and losing trust in the process.

On the other side, brands also face a challenge, reaching the right audience who genuinely needs their products. They spend heavily on marketing, but customers often feel misled when products don‚Äôt suit them.

This gap between consumer confusion and brand communication is the core problem GroomAI solves.

By combining AI-driven personalisation with skincare expertise, GroomAI helps individuals understand their skin type, concerns, and needs, and then recommends the right products tailored to them. No guesswork. No generic advice. Just smart, personalised guidance.

In short, GroomAI simplifies grooming decisions for people and makes product discovery more authentic, helping users look and feel their best while building trust for brands.
column30:
Skincare and grooming are overwhelming today. With endless products, contradictory advice, and generic ‚Äúone-size-fits-all‚Äù suggestions, people are left confused, frustrated, and often spending money on products that don‚Äôt work for them.

The truth is simple: every skin is different. What clears one person‚Äôs acne might trigger another‚Äôs. Yet, the industry continues to push broad recommendations instead of truly personalised solutions. This trial-and-error not only wastes time and money but can also harm skin health and confidence.

At the same time, brands struggle to connect with the right audience. Their products often miss the mark because customers don‚Äôt know what suits them, leading to mistrust and wasted marketing spend.

GroomAI bridges this gap. Using AI, we analyse an individual‚Äôs skin type, lifestyle, and concerns to provide personalised grooming recommendations, replacing guesswork with clarity. Consumers get tailored solutions, while brands reach people who genuinely benefit from their products.

In essence, GroomAI removes confusion from skincare, builds trust between people and products, and makes grooming smarter, simpler, and more personal.
column31:
GroomAI offers a personalised, AI-driven approach to skincare and grooming. Instead of relying on generic advice or endless trial-and-error, our platform analyses an individual‚Äôs skin type, concerns, and lifestyle to generate tailored product recommendations.

The uniqueness lies in our three-phase model:

Awareness & Knowledge ‚Äì We educate users with AI-powered insights about their skin and grooming needs, cutting through misinformation.

Personalised Recommendations ‚Äì Our AI matches users with the right products based on their unique profile, ensuring accuracy and trust.

E-commerce Integration ‚Äì A seamless platform, like a ‚ÄúZomato for skincare,‚Äù where users can instantly discover, compare, and shop products curated for them.

Unlike traditional beauty platforms, GroomAI doesn‚Äôt just show what‚Äôs trending, it shows what‚Äôs right for you. By combining deep learning with dermatological knowledge, we transform grooming into a science-backed, personalised experience.

This creates a win-win: users save time, money, and frustration, while brands gain trust and reach the right audience more effectively.

In short, GroomAI is not just a skincare recommender; it‚Äôs a smart companion that makes grooming simpler, smarter, and truly personal.
column32:
GroomAI serves two core audiences:

Consumers (Primary Focus)
Young adults and professionals (16-35 years) who are conscious about their skin, grooming, and appearance but are overwhelmed by too many product choices. This includes people struggling with acne, oily/dry skin, sensitivity, or simply those who want to look their best without wasting money on trial-and-error.

These users are digital-first, shop online frequently, and value personalised recommendations over generic marketing. For them, GroomAI acts as a personal skincare advisor available anytime.

Brands & Retailers (Secondary Focus)
Skincare and grooming companies that want to reach the right customers. GroomAI helps them showcase products directly to people who need them, reducing wasted marketing spend and building consumer trust.

By targeting both ends of the ecosystem, GroomAI creates a two-sided value chain: users get personalised guidance, and brands get authentic, effective product placement.

Initially, our focus will be on urban Indian consumers, college students, young professionals, and early adopters who already engage with digital wellness solutions. As we grow, GroomAI can expand into global markets and partner with D2C grooming brands, making personalised skincare accessible worldwide.
column36: We are seeking an initial investment of ‚Çπ5-10 lakhs to build our MVP, onboard early users, and validate product-market fit.
column40:
Past Project ‚Äì Skin Image Classifier (by Abhinandan)
As part of my AI learning journey, I built a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) that classifies different skin conditions from images. The model achieved over 80% accuracy on a test dataset and gave me hands-on experience in computer vision, TensorFlow, and model deployment.

This project laid the foundation for GroomAI, where we‚Äôre now extending the concept from pure classification to personalised product recommendations using AI.
column41:
Most grooming and skincare companies assume customers want more choices, new products, trends, and recommendations. The truth is, customers are drowning in choices. What they want is clarity and confidence in what works for them.

We understand that grooming isn‚Äôt about following generic beauty trends. It‚Äôs about solving deeply personal problems: acne before a big interview, dryness that kills confidence, or finding products that won‚Äôt waste money or harm skin.

Where others focus on selling more products, GroomAI focuses on helping people make the right choice. That‚Äôs the gap we see: personalisation isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúnice-to-have,‚Äù it‚Äôs the core need in modern grooming.

And unlike other platforms, we‚Äôre not just curating products, we‚Äôre combining AI + skin science + e-commerce into a single flow: learn your skin, get tailored advice, shop instantly.

That‚Äôs what we see, that others miss: grooming is not about ‚Äúbeauty marketing,‚Äù it‚Äôs about trust, personalisation, and simplicity.

column20: Solar-powered water from air, plastic-free
column29:
AcquaHT Labs addresses the critical global water crisis affecting 2.1 billion people, including 163 million Indians who lack safe drinking water. Traditional water sources face a 15,000-75,000 year replenishment cycle, while existing Atmospheric Water Generators consume 500-600 Wh/L, making them energy-intensive and unsustainable.

The plastic pollution crisis adds another dimension‚Äîbottled water contains 240,000 nanoplastics per liter, posing significant health risks. With 680 billion liters of water evaporating daily globally (equivalent to humanity's 60-day consumption), there's immense untapped atmospheric moisture available.

India faces severe water scarcity, with 600 million people experiencing high to extreme water stress. By 2030, the global water deficit will reach 40%. Cities like Chennai, Bengaluru, and Delhi are experiencing "Day Zero" scenarios. Current AWG solutions are limited by high energy consumption, dependency on grid power, and inability to work efficiently in low humidity conditions prevalent in rural India and MENA regions.

Our innovation targets this multi-faceted crisis by providing decentralized, solar-powered water generation that works in low humidity (20% RH), eliminates plastic waste, and reduces energy consumption by 40% compared to existing solutions.
column30:
AcquaHT Labs addresses the critical global water crisis affecting 2.1 billion people, including 163 million Indians who lack safe drinking water. Traditional water sources face a 15,000-75,000 year replenishment cycle, while existing Atmospheric Water Generators consume 500-600 Wh/L, making them energy-intensive and unsustainable.

The plastic pollution crisis adds another dimension‚Äîbottled water contains 240,000 nanoplastics per liter, posing significant health risks. With 680 billion liters of water evaporating daily globally (equivalent to humanity's 60-day consumption), there's immense untapped atmospheric moisture available.

India faces severe water scarcity, with 600 million people experiencing high to extreme water stress. By 2030, the global water deficit will reach 40%. Cities like Chennai, Bengaluru, and Delhi are experiencing "Day Zero" scenarios. Current AWG solutions are limited by high energy consumption, dependency on grid power, and inability to work efficiently in low humidity conditions prevalent in rural India and MENA regions.

Our innovation targets this multi-faceted crisis by providing decentralized, solar-powered water generation that works in low humidity (20% RH), eliminates plastic waste, and reduces energy consumption by 40% compared to existing solutions.
column31:
1. Ultra-Low Humidity Aerogel Technology: Our proprietary aerogel extracts water at 20% RH (industry standard: 60%+ RH), producing 5.5g water/g, making it viable in arid regions like MENA and rural India.

2. AI-Powered Solar Hybrid System: KNN and SVM machine learning models optimize energy consumption using NASA POWER data, achieving 40% energy reduction (300 Wh/L vs 500-600 Wh/L industry standard).

3. Advanced Purification: Ozone-based water treatment provides 6.0-log pathogen kill‚Äî3,741x stronger than UV‚Äîensuring WHO-compliant water quality.

4. Plastic-Free Ecosystem: Uses biodegradable sugarcane pulp bottles and stainless steel tanks, eliminating 240,000 nanoplastics/L found in bottled water.

5. Open-Source IoT Stack: Built with Python, Node-RED, ESP32 for transparency and collaborative improvement.

Our system produces 100-500L/day compared to competitors' 50-200L, costs ‚Çπ2-4/L versus ‚Çπ8-15/L market rates, and operates completely off-grid. This makes clean water accessible regardless of location‚Äî"because clean water shouldn't depend on your pin code".
column32:
Our primary target segments reflect India's diverse water challenges:

Households in Water-Stressed Areas (Primary): 35 million Indians lacking safe water access, particularly in states like Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Maharashtra experiencing severe groundwater depletion. These customers pay ‚Çπ8-15/L for bottled water and face unreliable municipal supply.

Key Insight: Rural and peri-urban households spend 10-25% of income on water procurement. Our ‚Çπ2-4/L cost and ‚Çπ1.5-2.5L unit price offers 3-year ROI, making it economically viable.

Commercial & Institutional (Secondary): Schools, hospitals, hotels, and offices in water-scarce regions. They currently depend on expensive tanker water costing ‚Çπ50-100 per 1000L, with unreliable supply disrupting operations.

Government & NGOs (Tertiary): Municipalities implementing decentralized water solutions under Jal Jeevan Mission. NGOs serving remote communities where traditional infrastructure isn't feasible.

Unique Customer Insight: Unlike competitors focusing on high-humidity coastal areas, we've identified that 68% of water-stressed regions have humidity below 40%. Our aerogel technology uniquely serves this underserved market of 400+ million people in semi-arid regions.

Our open-source approach also attracts environmentally conscious customers seeking transparent, sustainable solutions over proprietary alternatives.

column35: 400000 at 13000000 Valuation with STPI Kalapataru CoE Accelerator
column40:
1. AI-Integrated Logistics (IIT Hyderabad BUILD):
Built an AI/IoT-based supply chain solution under ISRO & Greenko leadership. Secured ‚Çπ1L seed fund; enabled AcquaHT‚Äôs smart monitoring & solar forecasting systems.

2. Water Policy Innovation (Harvard India Conference & ISB):
Designed scalable water governance models with global experts; shaped AcquaHT‚Äôs compliance & rural deployment strategies.

3. MATHack 1.0 & 2.0 (T-Hub & DST):
Among top 24 of 1,736 teams; developed AI for demand forecasting & resource optimization‚Äînow applied in AcquaHT‚Äôs KNN/SVM models.

4. Human-Carrying Quadcopter Prototype:
Engineered a personal aerial transport system; this hands-on hardware/software integration informed AcquaHT‚Äôs IoT & aerogel-based systems.

5. District Innovation Fellowship (Govt. of Telangana):
Led grassroots innovations in Siddipet; gained deep field insights that drive AcquaHT‚Äôs impact-driven approach.
column41:
The Humidity Paradox: While 95% of AWG companies target high-humidity coastal regions (60%+ RH), we discovered that 68% of water-stressed populations live in semi-arid areas with 20-40% humidity. This massive underserved market of 400+ million people has been ignored because conventional condensation technology fails below 50% RH.

Energy-Water Nexus: Traditional AWGs consume 500-600 Wh/L because they use brute-force cooling. We realized that combining aerogel adsorption with predictive AI can reduce energy by 40% while maintaining output. Our NASA POWER data integration allows predictive energy optimization that competitors lack.

Plastic-Free Economics: While others focus on water generation, we understood that the real disruption comes from eliminating the ‚Çπ60,000 crore bottled water industry through biodegradable packaging. This creates both environmental and economic moats.

Open Source Advantage: Unlike proprietary competitors, our open-source approach accelerates innovation through community contribution while building trust through transparency‚Äîcrucial for water, a basic human right.

Rural-First Design: We designed for India's challenging infrastructure‚Äîintermittent power, low technical literacy, harsh environments‚Äîmaking our solution inherently robust for global expansion.

column20: Affordable, AI-Driven HealthCare for Rural India
column29:
Accessibility and Affordability of quality healthcare services 
Staff Shortages and high burnout rate
Lack of standardisation in healthcare services
Overcrowded and lack of   timely quality services in   Government aided hospitals
High costs in private run hospitals 
 Inefficiency in workflows due to relatively slower technology adaptation 
Insufficient Infrastructure compromising patient safety
Low density and distribution of healthcare resources in rural areas
Low literacy and awareness of healthcare
column30: India‚Äôs rural health system is overburdened and unevenly staffed‚Äî61% of PHCs have only one doctor and 7% have none‚Äîforcing long travel and wait times or expensive private care. Burnout among health workers is chronic (‚âà39%), and spiked during COVID-19 (‚âà46%), worsening access and quality. Insurance coverage is thin (‚âà3.7%), so out-of-pocket costs delay care. Meanwhile, 68% of Indians live in rural areas, yet most needs (‚âà60%) are primary care‚Äîbasic consults, prevention, and diagnostics that should be close to home. Infrastructure gaps, low health literacy, and slow tech adoption compound the problem, while overcrowded public facilities and fragmented private options create inconsistent standards and safety risks. The result: preventable conditions escalate, emergencies face fatal delays, and communities lose trust in the system. We exist to standardize, simplify, and bring primary care to the doorstep‚Äîaffordably, reliably, and in local languages‚Äîso early detection and continuity become the norm, not the exception
column31: Swastha Sathi is a hybrid network of solar-powered mobile clinics and static kiosks that deliver standardized primary care, backed by AI and an offline-first stack. On-site, clinicians use an AI smart diagnostic suite (portable ECG, digital stethoscope, BP, etc.) with edge AI for instant decision support‚Äîeven without internet. A voice-assisted, multilingual interface (e.g., Hindi, Bengali) guides low-literacy users, while our app syncs records when back online. Rapid, low-cost screening includes facial scan cues for anemia/jaundice/malnutrition, plus a mini lab-on-wheels that reads strips via camera and uploads results to patient profiles. AI referral and emergency routing auto-shares structured EHRs with the nearest facility, cutting critical delays. We add an integrated pharmacy, telehealth kiosks, and a sliding-scale pricing model, then scale impact via PPP/CSR/insurance partnerships to keep prices low and standards high. It‚Äôs a last-mile platform designed specifically for rural India: standardized protocols, low power, low bandwidth, local language, and mobile footprint‚Äîbuilt to work where the need is greatest.
column32:
B2C (Rural households, Tier-2/3 towns & villages): Annual health buddy access for basic consults, screening, telehealth, and e-prescriptions; nominal per-service fees via sliding scale to protect the most vulnerable. 

B2B (Employers/SMBs, Agri/FMCG supply chains): Workforce primary-care packages; on-site camps via mobile units; prevention programs and reporting. Priced at ‚Çπ15,000 per company for 20 employees (starter tier). 

B2G/NGO/CSR: Public-private partnerships to deploy vans/kiosks under Ayushman Bharat, NHM, RSBY and similar schemes; CSR funding to sponsor routes and categories (e.g., maternal health). 

Allied partners: Insurers (commission-based onboarding, literacy drives) and pharma/health platforms (Tata 1mg-like integrations) for affordable medicines and compliance support.
column36: We are raising ‚Çπ2.5 crore (pre-seed) for an 18-month runway to execute Phase 1‚Äì2:  Capex & launch of 3 solar mobile units + 3 static kiosks (pilot in two districts)  Product & AI: finalize offline-first app, edge-AI diagnostics, referral stack (deck baseline: ‚Çπ10 lakh initial tech, plus maintenance)   Clinical ops & hiring, community programs, quality/standardization  Go-to-market: B2C activation, B2B/CSR/insurer partnerships (marketing ~30% of revenue as per model)
column40:
As an intern under Govt Of UTTAR PRADESH, PMKSY-WDC 2.0 internship in Etawah, the founder led the Vikas Sankalp initiative‚Äîdesigning a digital-first ecosystem for watershed-based rural development. The project delivered four modular tools:

Smart Krishi Calendar (AI-powered crop planning assistant)

SoochnaSeva AI (multilingual rural knowledge chatbot)

WatershedOS (real-time decentralized dashboard for fund and asset tracking)

Livelihood Stack (digital toolkit for SHGs‚Äô savings, training, and business planning)

Built with lightweight, mobile-first, and offline-compatible technologies like Streamlit, LangChain, GPT-4, and Python, these modules directly addressed gaps in awareness, recordkeeping, and scheme convergence. The project impacted farmers, SHGs, Panchayats, and local officials by enabling data-driven decisions, transparency, and inclusivity under the 3E framework‚ÄîEconomy, Ecology, Equity.

This hands-on project demonstrated the team‚Äôs ability to combine policy insight, design thinking, and technology prototyping to create scalable, convergence-ready solutions for rural India.
column41: That last-mile primary care includes trust, standardization, and logistics problem. Rural delivery must be offline-first, voice-first, multilingual, and protocol-driven, with physical presence (mobile clinics) plus AI-assisted triage to lift scarce clinicians. Sliding-scale pricing and PPP/CSR are not addons; they‚Äôre the economic engine that keeps care affordable yet viable. Finally, real-time referral with structured EHRs is what turns screening into saved lives‚Äîespecially where minutes and kilometers matter. This is why we built solar mobility + AI + standard operating playbooks specifically for rural India

column10: Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology (TIET), Patiala
column20: Axlo is an AI finance copilot for startup founders and CA firms. We plug into Tally/Zoho/QuickBooks, banks, payroll and gateways, fetch live numbers, and return deterministic, ledger-linked answers to cash questions: burn, runway, safe to spend, spikes vs last month, with every figure traceable to source. No migrations; no data stored by default. Phase 2 automates reconciliation and controlled posting with an exception inbox and full audit trail. Faster closes, cleaner books, investor-ready Now.
column29:
Early stage founders and finance teams struggle to answer basic cash questions in real time: What is burn today, how many months of runway after a new hire, why did expenses spike, what is safe to spend after tomorrow‚Äôs payroll and taxes. The numbers live across Tally or Zoho or QuickBooks, bank portals, payment gateways, payroll, and spreadsheets. Pulling them together is manual, slow, and error prone; by the time a report is ready, it is already stale.

Accounting systems are built for recording, not for instant analysis. FP&A tools require data warehouses, migrations, and dedicated analysts. Generic AI chatbots guess without an audit trail. None provide ledger level traceability that founders and auditors can trust.

The result is delayed decisions, hiring mistakes, missed cash signals, and month end closes that take weeks. Founders under or over spend, investor updates are vague, and compliance risk rises because reconciliations lag.

The core problem: there is no simple, trustworthy way to ask a plain English cash question and receive an immediate, accurate, source linked answer from the live books, along with reconciliation status. Finance teams need this clarity to run the business day to day, not just at month end.
column30:
Early stage founders and finance teams struggle to answer basic cash questions in real time: What is burn today, how many months of runway after a new hire, why did expenses spike, what is safe to spend after tomorrow‚Äôs payroll and taxes. The numbers live across Tally or Zoho or QuickBooks, bank portals, payment gateways, payroll, and spreadsheets. Pulling them together is manual, slow, and error prone; by the time a report is ready, it is already stale.

Accounting systems are built for recording, not for instant analysis. FP&A tools require data warehouses, migrations, and dedicated analysts. Generic AI chatbots guess without an audit trail. None provide ledger level traceability that founders and auditors can trust.

The result is delayed decisions, hiring mistakes, missed cash signals, and month end closes that take weeks. Founders under or over spend, investor updates are vague, and compliance risk rises because reconciliations lag.

The core problem: there is no simple, trustworthy way to ask a plain English cash question and receive an immediate, accurate, source linked answer from the live books, along with reconciliation status. Finance teams need this clarity to run the business day to day, not just at month end.
column31:
Axlo is a chat first finance copilot that answers cash questions from the live books and then keeps the books clean.

We plug into Tally, Zoho, QuickBooks, banks, payroll, and gateways and fetch numbers on demand, so there are no migrations or data warehouses. The LLM only interprets intent; a deterministic rules engine does the math for burn, runway, safe to spend, budget vs actuals, vendor analysis, and what if scenarios. Every number carries a source link down to ledger lines and statements, and users can drill into the computation. Our default privacy posture is minimal storage; we prefer real time fetch and retain only audit-ready metadata.

What is unique: ledger-traceable answers in seconds, not a dashboard that teams must maintain. India first workflows like GST and TDS and Razorpay or PhonePe settlement matching. Phase 2 closes the loop with automated reconciliation and controlled posting back into the accounting system with review, rollback, and a full audit trail, plus an exception inbox for edge cases.

Outcome: founders decide confidently, accountants close faster, and investor updates are accurate by construction.
column32:
We sell to two customers:

Founder-led startups (5‚Äì200 people) running Tally/Zoho/QuickBooks with banks, payroll, and gateways like Razorpay/PhonePe. The buyer is the founder/CEO or a finance lead. They‚Äôre non-finance heavy, ask cash questions on WhatsApp/Slack, and hate dashboards they must maintain. Triggers: fundraising, hiring decisions, expense spikes, investor updates, GST/TDS due, and month-end close.

CA firms that act as the back-office for 10‚Äì50 such clients. They live in Tally and spreadsheets, spend hours reconciling bank/gateway/payroll, and need audit-ready trails to sign off.

Our insight: in India, accounting systems won‚Äôt be replaced; they‚Äôre the system of record. Trust beats ‚ÄúAI magic.‚Äù Buyers want plain-English answers computed from the live books with a clickable path to ledger lines‚Äîno migrations, no warehouse, minimal data at rest. Founders value ‚Äúsafe to spend now‚Äù and ‚Äúrunway if we hire X‚Äù; CAs value auto-reconciliation, controlled posting, exception inboxes, and rollback. Success is measured by auto-match rate, time to close, and how quickly a founder gets a defensible answer during a meeting.

Early adopters: venture-backed startups with multiple payment rails and lean finance teams, and progressive CA firms seeking faster, cleaner closes and source-linked reporting.
column40: Fooddle was a campus food-ordering marketplace we built from scratch in our first year. Utkarsh led tech (web app, real-time order routing, vendor dashboards, payments), while Manan ran ops (vendor acquisition, SLAs, support, reconciliations). In a few months we onboarded dozens of campus vendors, served 15,000+ students, and crossed ~‚Çπ8 lakh GMV. We ran delivery windows, standardised menus and pricing, and set up dispute resolution and payout workflows so vendors were paid on time. The project was eventually shut by the college administration, and we wound it down responsibly and helped vendors transition. The big lesson was stakeholder alignment: ship fast, but secure institutional buy-in, define guardrails, and measure impact weekly. That discipline around operations, compliance, and clear metrics directly shapes how we build Axlo today.
column41:
Finance teams in India will not replace Tally, Zoho, or QuickBooks. These are the system of record, so trust comes from answers that route back to ledger lines, not from a new dashboard or a data warehouse. Founders do not want ‚Äúanalytics.‚Äù They want an immediate, defensible answer to a plain-English cash question during a meeting.

The unit of value is a source-linked answer, computed from live books with deterministic math, not an AI guess. Privacy posture matters: default to real-time fetch and store only audit-ready metadata to reduce procurement friction.

Clean books unlock everything. Analytics without reconciliation is noise, so the product must close the loop: automated reconciliation, controlled posting, rollback, and an exception inbox.

India-specific realities shape the design: GST/TDS, Razorpay or PhonePe settlement splits, T+N delays, fees, refunds, and payroll breakups create multi-way matches that generic tools miss.

We measure success by outcomes finance teams feel: auto-match rate, time-to-answer, time-to-close, exceptions under 2 percent, and zero duplicate postings. That is the bar for trust.
column42: What milestones do you expect before a follow-on check, and what is a typical check size and timing?

column29: Every parent knows the anxiety of bus transport ‚Äî waiting at the stop, wondering if the bus is late, or if their child got on safely. Today, schools rely on unreliable transport solutions and apps that offer poor UX and limited features. Standard operating procedures still depend on paper, lacking digitisation and convenience, which wastes time and reduces trust in the system, leaving parents frustrated and schools overwhelmed.
column30: Every parent knows the anxiety of bus transport ‚Äî waiting at the stop, wondering if the bus is late, or if their child got on safely. Today, schools rely on unreliable transport solutions and apps that offer poor UX and limited features. Standard operating procedures still depend on paper, lacking digitisation and convenience, which wastes time and reduces trust in the system, leaving parents frustrated and schools overwhelmed.
column31:
Our solution is StepConnect ‚Äî a unified, parent-first school transport platform. Unlike the fragmented, unreliable apps schools currently use, StepConnect brings everything into a single, trusted system.

For parents, we provide live bus tracking with intelligent alerts. Even when buses go offline, our system caches updates and delivers them once connectivity returns ‚Äî ensuring parents are never left guessing. The interface is designed to be intuitive and stress-free, giving parents clear ETAs and peace of mind.

For schools, we remove the burden of handling transport complaints by routing support directly through us. This ensures smoother operations, happier parents, and no additional tech overhead.

On the backend, StepConnect is built with scalability and reliability in mind, architected to handle thousands of buses and schools seamlessly. This gives us the foundation to become the category-defining platform for school transport in India, a ‚Çπ7,200 crore market with no established leader.

In short, we‚Äôre not just building another tracking app ‚Äî we‚Äôre creating the go-to platform that unifies school transport for parents and schools alike, making the experience reliable, simple, and stress-free.
column32:
Our primary customers are luxury schools, with parents as the ultimate beneficiaries. Schools in India face daily pressure from anxious parents about bus delays, missed pick-ups, or safety concerns. Today, they juggle multiple disconnected apps or rely on manual communication, which creates frustration, inefficiency, and constant complaints.

Our insight is that schools don‚Äôt just want ‚Äúa GPS app‚Äù ‚Äî they want a single, reliable platform that reduces parent stress and takes transport complaints easy to handle. Parents, on the other hand, want simplicity and trust. They don‚Äôt want to download three different apps or chase the transport manager for updates; they want clear, reliable alerts about their child‚Äôs bus, even when connectivity is patchy.

This dual perspective is our edge. By positioning StepConnect as a parent-first solution delivered through schools, we make adoption seamless. Schools look better to parents without additional work, while parents get a unified, dependable experience.

Our unique understanding is that the real buyer is the school, but the real user is the parent ‚Äî and unless both are satisfied, adoption fails. StepConnect bridges that gap, turning a daily pain point into a smooth, trusted experience for everyone.
column40: Our tech co-founder built a bus booking platform from scratch, showcasing both technical depth and execution ability. The platform was developed using Django, containerized with Docker, and deployed on a DigitalOcean droplet for scalability and reliability. It enabled users to search, book, and manage bus tickets seamlessly, with a clean user interface. The project demonstrated end-to-end ownership‚Äîfrom backend architecture and DevOps to deployment‚Äîproving our ability to design, build, and scale real-world transport solutions.
column41: Most companies treat school transport as a tech add-on‚Äîa GPS tracker, a parent app, or a fleet tool. What they miss is that transport is an emotional problem, not just a logistical one. Parents don‚Äôt care about raw location data; they care about peace of mind. Schools don‚Äôt want another dashboard; they want fewer complaints. Our insight is that unless both sides win‚Äîparents feeling reassured and schools feeling less burdened‚Äîadoption will fail. StepConnect is built around this balance: a parent-first experience delivered via schools, with reliability even in patchy networks, where others‚Äô apps usually break.

column20: ‚ÄúSmart IoT for Flood Safety & Climate Resilience
column23: Salgi, Outside North Campus, IIT Mandi, Kamand, Mandi, Himachal Pradesh - 175005
column29:
Floods are one of the most devastating natural disasters, causing loss of life, destruction of crops, damage to infrastructure, and economic setbacks worth billions every year. In India alone, recurring floods displace thousands of families and severely affect agricultural productivity, especially in vulnerable river valleys and hilly regions. Climate change, cloudbursts, and unpredictable rainfall patterns are making these events more frequent and intense.

The current solutions are either expensive, slow, or reactive, offering data after the disaster has already unfolded. Traditional manual monitoring or isolated warning systems cannot provide the real-time visibility and predictive intelligence required to safeguard lives and livelihoods. Farmers are unable to plan irrigation or protect their crops, local communities remain unaware of rising risks, and authorities struggle with disaster preparedness due to fragmented or delayed information.

At ClimMaTech, we aim to solve this by building an affordable, IoT-enabled, AI-driven flood monitoring and early warning system. Our solution provides real-time river flow data, predictive flood forecasts, and instant alerts, ensuring proactive disaster management. By doing so, we bridge the critical gap between raw data and actionable insights, helping communities, farmers, and governments prepare in advance and minimize flood impacts.
column30:
Floods are one of the most devastating natural disasters, causing loss of life, destruction of crops, damage to infrastructure, and economic setbacks worth billions every year. In India alone, recurring floods displace thousands of families and severely affect agricultural productivity, especially in vulnerable river valleys and hilly regions. Climate change, cloudbursts, and unpredictable rainfall patterns are making these events more frequent and intense.

The current solutions are either expensive, slow, or reactive, offering data after the disaster has already unfolded. Traditional manual monitoring or isolated warning systems cannot provide the real-time visibility and predictive intelligence required to safeguard lives and livelihoods. Farmers are unable to plan irrigation or protect their crops, local communities remain unaware of rising risks, and authorities struggle with disaster preparedness due to fragmented or delayed information.

At ClimMaTech, we aim to solve this by building an affordable, IoT-enabled, AI-driven flood monitoring and early warning system. Our solution provides real-time river flow data, predictive flood forecasts, and instant alerts, ensuring proactive disaster management. By doing so, we bridge the critical gap between raw data and actionable insights, helping communities, farmers, and governments prepare in advance and minimize flood impacts.
column31:
ClimMaTech offers an integrated IoT and AI-powered flood monitoring and forecasting solution designed for vulnerable river basins and agricultural regions. Unlike traditional systems that only record water levels, our solution combines rugged low-cost IoT devices with an AI-based predictive model to provide both real-time data and advance flood forecasts.

Our hardware includes river depth and flow monitoring sensors, rainfall and weather stations, and early warning sirens‚Äîall connected to a secure cloud-based dashboard accessible through web and mobile. The system continuously measures environmental parameters and applies deep learning models trained on hydrological and meteorological data to detect anomalies and predict flood events.

The uniqueness lies in three aspects:

Affordability and scalability ‚Äì modular devices that can be deployed even in remote terrains at a fraction of the cost of traditional systems.

Proactive intelligence ‚Äì shifting from reactive alerts to predictive, actionable insights.

Shared data ecosystem ‚Äì multiple stakeholders (farmers, resorts, disaster authorities) can access the same dashboard through a subscription model, creating a sustainable revenue stream.

By combining technology, accessibility, and predictive power, ClimMaTech delivers a ‚Äúnever-before‚Äù solution that enhances climate resilience and safeguards lives, agriculture, and infrastructure.
column32:
Our primary customers are local communities, farmers, resorts, and disaster management authorities in flood-prone regions. These stakeholders face the highest risk from sudden floods and cloudbursts but lack access to reliable, affordable, and predictive monitoring solutions.

For farmers, timely alerts about river flow and rainfall mean they can protect standing crops, optimize irrigation, and reduce losses. Resorts and tourism operators in valleys and riverbanks need real-time monitoring to ensure guest safety and minimize property damage, while government authorities and disaster management agencies require continuous data to make informed evacuation and response decisions.

Our unique insight is that most existing solutions are either too costly or fragmented, leaving smaller communities and individual businesses underserved. Current systems focus on isolated data points‚Äîsuch as rainfall or water depth‚Äîwithout combining them into predictive, actionable insights. Through our pilots, we have observed that customers value not only real-time monitoring but also predictive intelligence and shared dashboard access, which allows multiple stakeholders to benefit from the same data ecosystem at an affordable subscription.

By aligning our solution with the pain points of each customer group, we ensure higher adoption, stronger trust, and long-term recurring revenue opportunities.
column40: Our CTO, Om Maheshwari, previously led the development of an IoT-based smart environmental monitoring system that integrated low-cost sensors with cloud dashboards for real-time air quality and weather tracking. The system was successfully deployed in a pilot with academic institutions, enabling students and researchers to monitor air pollution trends and micro-climate variations. This project not only demonstrated his expertise in IoT hardware and communication protocols (RS485, Modbus, 4‚Äì20mA integration) but also laid the foundation for designing rugged, scalable sensor networks‚Äîexperience that directly contributes to ClimMaTech‚Äôs flood monitoring and forecasting solution.
column41:
At ClimMaTech, we understand that flood resilience is not just about collecting data, but about delivering actionable intelligence to the right people at the right time. Many companies focus only on building expensive monitoring hardware or isolated weather stations. The missing link is affordability, accessibility, and predictive power.

Our unique insight is that communities, farmers, resorts, and even government agencies don‚Äôt just want raw numbers about rainfall or river depth‚Äîthey want clear, predictive alerts and insights they can act upon. For example, a farmer needs to know whether his fields will flood tomorrow, not just today‚Äôs river depth. A resort owner cares about a warning system that protects guests without hiring technical staff to interpret data.

This is why our business combines low-cost IoT devices, AI-driven forecasts, and a shared subscription dashboard. By designing for scalability and inclusivity, we ensure that even small communities and businesses can afford cutting-edge climate resilience tools.

In short, while others sell equipment, we deliver an end-to-end solution that turns data into protection, insight, and trust‚Äîsomething our competitors overlook.

column20: Personal finance app for students & young professionals
column29: College students and young professionals struggle to manage their money, track expenses, and build financial discipline. Most existing finance apps are either too complex, judgmental, or designed for older working professionals. As a result, young people continue to overspend, save less, and stay unaware of their long-term financial health. This lack of accessible financial literacy creates stress and poor habits at the start of their financial journey.
column30: College students and young professionals struggle to manage their money, track expenses, and build financial discipline. Most existing finance apps are either too complex, judgmental, or designed for older working professionals. As a result, young people continue to overspend, save less, and stay unaware of their long-term financial health. This lack of accessible financial literacy creates stress and poor habits at the start of their financial journey.
column31: Vaultee is a simple, non-judgmental personal finance app designed for students and early professionals. Instead of overwhelming users with technical jargon, Vaultee focuses on small, actionable steps ‚Äî helping them track money, form better habits, and gradually build financial awareness. What makes us unique is our emphasis on relatable student experiences: chaotic spending patterns, limited income sources, and peer-influenced money habits. Vaultee uses gamification, relatable insights, and a supportive tone to make finance less scary and more fun.
column32: Our primary users are college students (18‚Äì25) and early professionals who often lack structured financial knowledge but actively use digital apps. They value simplicity, social relatability, and small wins. Unlike older demographics, they don‚Äôt want corporate-style finance tracking tools ‚Äî they want a safe space where learning money skills doesn‚Äôt feel intimidating. Our unique insight: students don‚Äôt just need budgeting; they need validation of their messy journey with encouragement to grow gradually. This builds trust, stickiness, and long-term adoption.
column40: One of our team members worked with BAIF, an NGO focused on sustainable rural development, to design a booklet that educated students on interacting with man-made systems in ways that do not harm the environment. This experience built strong skills in research, simplifying complex ideas for young audiences, and creating solutions that balance usability with long-term impact ‚Äî all of which now inform how we are shaping Vaultee.
column41: Most finance apps are built for working professionals ‚Äî they assume steady income, regular bills, and long-term investments. But students don‚Äôt live like that. Their financial reality is chaotic: pocket money, side hustles, sudden expenses, and a constant fear of going broke. We understand that students don‚Äôt just need a tracker ‚Äî they need a buddy. Vaultee stands out because it speaks their language, adapts to their lifestyle, and makes money management non-judgmental and fun ‚Äî not scary or boring.

column20: At Husoro, we build the future of ground robotics. Our Unmanned Ground Vehicles are designed to take on real-world challenges from defense to industry to humanitarian missions. Powered by AI and smart sensors, they are built for safety, strength, and adaptability. More than machines, our UGVs are partners in shaping a safer, smarter tomorrow.
column29:
The threat from hidden explosives, narcotics, and hazardous materials remains one of the most pressing global security challenges. In conflict zones, landmines and unexploded ordnance (UXOs) continue to claim thousands of lives each year, while restricting safe access to vast areas of land. At the same time, airports, seaports, and commercial establishments face growing risks from smuggling and terrorism, where concealed narcotics and improvised explosives threaten public safety and national security.

Current detection methods are slow, labor-intensive, and often unreliable. Manual clearance of landmines exposes personnel to life-threatening danger, while conventional scanners in civilian environments struggle with accuracy, throughput, and adaptability to evolving threats. Dependence on imported detection technologies further limits effectiveness in diverse terrains and operational contexts.

This gap highlights the urgent need for advanced, autonomous, and highly reliable detection systems that can operate safely, efficiently, and at scale across defense, security, and commercial domains.

column32:
Our customers span defense organizations, homeland security agencies, and high-security commercial establishments such as airports, seaports, and critical infrastructure operators. In defense, they face the persistent challenge of safely detecting and neutralizing landmines, improvised explosive devices (IEDs), and unexploded ordnance in complex terrains. In homeland security and commercial sectors, customers must protect assets and people from narcotics smuggling, explosives, and other concealed threats, all while ensuring efficiency and minimal disruption to operations.

A unique insight we bring is that these customers are not only seeking detection accuracy but also demand speed, autonomy, and adaptability. Traditional tools often force a trade-off between safety and efficiency, leaving personnel exposed or operations slowed. Additionally, most current solutions are imported, expensive, and not optimized for local terrains, climatic conditions, or evolving threat profiles.

Through direct engagement with defense forces, security professionals, and facility operators, we understand that they require scalable, modular, and indigenous solutions systems that can adapt to multiple scenarios while reducing dependence on manual labor and foreign technology. This insight drives us to build versatile UGV platforms that not only meet current demands but also anticipate future operational needs, providing safety, reliability, and efficiency in one integrated solution.
column40:
A core team member has led the development of a patented robotic painting system (Patent No. 512731, 2024) and an autonomous mobile robot (AMR) integrated with a 6-axis robotic arm for industrial automation. The AMR project involved advanced kinematic modeling, ROS-based navigation, and sensor fusion to enable precise positioning, obstacle avoidance, and real-time manipulation in dynamic environments. Simulation and validation were carried out using MoveIt and Gazebo, ensuring robust motion control and efficiency.

The patented robotic painting system demonstrated expertise in large-scale robotic gantry design, automation, and direct-to-shape painting applications, highlighting innovation in both mechanical and software domains.
column41:
Most robotics companies approach UGVs as either off-the-shelf platforms or highly domain-specific systems, which limits adaptability, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. What we uniquely understand is that our customers, whether in defense, security, or industrial sectors, don‚Äôt just need a single-purpose robot; they need a modular, multi-domain, and indigenous platform that can be customized for evolving missions without depending on foreign technology.

We recognize that the real challenge is not just in mobility, but in the fusion of autonomy, advanced sensing, and rugged hardware designed for diverse terrains and operational contexts like India‚Äôs. Our insight is that success lies in building UGVs as platforms, not products, where a single base system can integrate payloads for landmine detection, narcotics/explosive scanning, logistics, or reconnaissance.

By combining in-house radar innovation, sensor fusion expertise, and field-tested autonomy, Husoro is positioned to deliver UGVs that are not only technically advanced but also cost-effective, adaptable, and future-ready, something many companies overlook.
column42:
How are mentors selected and matched with teams? 
Will deep-tech or robotics-specific mentors be available for teams working on UGVs and advanced sensing platforms?

column20: At Amicuzz, we are building a platform tailored for Lawyers and Law firms that combines CRM, AI agents, Knowledge desk and workflow automations into one seamless experience. Our architecture is designed with legal precision: bias-aware, hallucination-resistant, and legally literate. Unlike traditional tools we ensure zero-risk data handling by keeping sensitive inputs secure and local.
column29: India has approximately 1.4 million registered advocates, with the majority operating as solo practitioners. Lawyers routinely manage incoming calls, client meetings, and case updates across disconnected systems while also drafting documents, tracking deadlines, and handling sensitive client data. This results in repetitive, time-consuming tasks that contribute to delays, increased workloads, and underperformance. This can be overcome by employing a tailored CRM, automating repetitive tasks using AI agents, and leveraging a specialized LLM trained specifically on comprehensive historical data from Indian judicial proceedings. Current solutions have failed to resolve multiple issues including: 1)Data Security 2)Inflexible Templates: Others force rigid, limited templates. We offer customizable, jurisdiction-aware CRM and automations for any legal scenario. 3)Local Law Adaptation: Existing platforms ignore local laws. Our AI is trained specifically for Indian legal needs 4)Functional Limitations: Existing tools often restrict critical operations‚Äîsuch as document generation, file processing, or deep legal research‚Äîdue to platform constraints, limited AI capabilities, or strict token/chat limits. Our solution offers a lightweight, locally-hosted system with unlimited AI chats and tokens, supporting robust document and file automation, processing, and legal queries. We are solving these pain points by providing a well-made suite of features to lawyers in one place: CRM, workflow automations using AI agents, knowledge desk, and essential utility features. Our speciality is that everything runs locally on the user's end, ensuring security, high performance, and scalability. Utility Features Included are- Shared workspace for teams to collaborate, Deadline Tracker, Case Catalogue, Analytics and Reporting tools, Compliance checklists and automated validation tools, Automatic Document Generator and more

column31: Our solutions uniquely solves this problem in the following ways: 1)Bringing CRM, AI automations, Knowledge desk (for researching, citations, updates etc)and a full-fledged file ops system in one place. 2)We employ a lightweight fine-tuned LLM that can be run locally (on android, windows and mac) at any time even without internet. This allows the user an infinite number of cumulative token inputs and ensure their data doesn't leave their device. 3)Since the competition utilizes a centralized GPT wrappers (that with around 30-40B parameters), fine-tuning them quickly based on changes in law is not feasible. Our architecture allows for rapid changes thus ensuring no down-time. 4)Having a locally hosted architectures provided the user complete data security and helps us negate infra costs thus ensuring greater per-capita margins. 5)We include communication and social media channels that help the user maintain and track client interactions. The CRM is built to be intuitive, lawyer-centric thus being the first of it's kind 6)A full-fledged FileOps system is included that negates repetitive tasks thus ensuring higher efficiency By combining legal literacy, local execution, and modular design, Amicuzz empowers Lawyers like no other tools or company before us could do.
column32: We are targeting India‚Äôs 1.4 million registered advocates, with a special focus on the underserved majority‚Äîsolo practitioners and small law firms. Unique insights: 1)This user base values autonomy, true data security, and simple workflows‚Äîneeds unmet by existing solutions. 2)Operating in a fast-changing legal landscape, lawyers require tools that can quickly adapt and deliver precise, up-to-date guidance. 3)Precision is paramount: even small errors risk derailing cases, damaging trust, and causing compliance issues‚Äîso generic solutions are insufficient. 4)Facing high client churn, fragmented workflows, and constant pressure to remain visible, lawyers need an integrated toolkit to streamline operations and boost efficiency‚Äîall in one place.
column40: Built a Satellite Conjunction Analysis and Collision Risk Prediction Model. The project analyzes satellite conjunction data (CDM) and predicts potential collision risks using Python libraries such as Skyfield, Pandas, Scikit-learn, and Plotly. Includes 1) Features Loading and processing satellite TLE (Two-Line Element) data using Skyfield 2) Analyzing Conjunction Data Messages (CDM) to identify close approaches between satellites. 3) Calculating satellite positions and distances at the Time of Closest Approach (TCA)
column41: We understand that lawyers have highly specialized needs and in this profession, anything that fails to meet even one critical parameter is simply not adopted, no matter how impressive it looks on paper. Precision, reliability, jurisdictional nuance, and data security aren‚Äôt optional they‚Äôre foundational. Most companies in this space miss that entirely. Instead of building for lawyers, they draw lazy parallels from other sectors repurposing bloated, generic LLMs with 30‚Äì40B parameters that are slow to adapt, expensive to run, and fundamentally unsuited for legal workflows. These ‚ÄúGPT wrappers‚Äù might work for casual queries, but they collapse under the weight of real legal complexity. We also understand that lawyers don‚Äôt want fragmented tools. They don‚Äôt have time to juggle five platforms for CRM, drafting, deadlines, and research. They need everything in one place streamlined, secure, and built with legal literacy at its core. Amicuzz combines CRM, AI agents, a knowledge desk, and utility modules into a single, locally hosted platform. Therefore, Amicuzz is built from the ground up from the voices of Lawyers for the realities of Indian legal practice. Others build for scale. We build for trust, adaptability, and the uncompromising standards of the legal profession.

Current plastic foams are non-biodegradable and harmful to the environment. Our agri-waste-based biodegradable packaging offers safe cushioning, reduces returns, and lowers carbon emissions
column31:
Unbubble is replacing plastic-based packaging with a sustainable, biodegradable, and home-compostable alternative made from agricultural waste. Today, brands rely on plastic foams and bubble wraps that take hundreds of years to decompose, pollute land and water, and endanger animals. At the same time, fragile products face high damage and return rates during shipping due to poor packaging quality.

Our solution‚ÄîVriksh Foam and Packaging Peanuts‚Äîis designed to address both these challenges. Made entirely from crop residues, our material is lightweight, water-soluble, and provides excellent cushioning to protect fragile products like electronics, glassware, and cosmetics. Unlike plastic, it decomposes naturally without leaving toxins behind, and is even safe if accidentally consumed by pets or marine life.

What makes us unique is our triple impact:

Environmental ‚Äì 100% biodegradable, 15√ó lower CO‚ÇÇ emissions, and 7√ó less energy use compared to plastic.

Economic ‚Äì Reduces product damage and returns, cutting hidden costs for brands.

Social ‚Äì Creates livelihood opportunities by sourcing and processing agri-waste.

With successful pilots and proven margins, Unbubble is building the future of packaging where products land safely, and so does the planet.
column32:

These companies face challenges of fragile product damage, high return rates, and rising pressure to reduce plastic usage. Our primary customers are D2C brands, SMEs, and large manufacturers looking for sustainable packaging alternatives.

ast Project ‚Äì Energinee Innovations (by Akash Singh)

The project was recognised nationally and supported under various youth entrepreneurship programs, giving Akash deep experience in building sustainable solutions from waste streams‚Äîlearning that now directly contributes to Unbubble‚Äôs work in sustainable packaging.

column40: Thermoacoustic instability poses a significant challenge in the design and operation of liquid propellant rocket engines (LPREs). These instabilities arise from a complex feedback loop between pressure oscillations and unsteady heat release within the combustion chamber, which amplifies acoustic waves and can lead to destructive self-sustaining vibrations, potentially resulting in engine damage or catastrophic failure. Therefore, accurate prediction and control of such instabilities are crucial for the development of reliable and high-performance engines for future space missions. This study conducts a numerical investigation of thermoacoustic instabilities in rocket combustion chambers using COMSOL Multiphysics. The simulation framework incorporates three key physics modules: Pressure Acoustics (Frequency Domain) to simulate sound wave propagation and identify resonant modes (eigenfrequencies and mode shapes); Heat Transfer in Solids and Fluids to model energy exchange processes that couple heat release with acoustics; and Transport of Diluted Species to simulate the diffusion and convection of reactants and products, forming the basis for combustion modeling. The interaction between pressure oscillations and unsteady heat release is represented using a modified n‚ÄìœÑ flame model, adapted for frequency-domain analysis. This model links heat release fluctuations to earlier perturbations in species concentration and pressure, accounting for convective delay (œÑ). While a simplified single-step irreversible reaction is used to represent combustion chemistry, the framework effectively captures the key nonlinear, time-lagged flame response to acoustic perturbations. This enables a reliable linear stability analysis to assess the growth or decay of acoustic modes. The initial study is conducted to find out the design parameters leveraging this integrated model, systematic parametric studies are integrated to dissect how key design parameters influence stability including Chamber Geometry, Injector Design, Flame Characteristics and Boundary Conditions. Special focus is placed on finding the prevailing instability modes (longitudinal and transverse), the system eigenfrequencies, and the comprehensive effect of boundary conditions including regenerative cooling simulation in the lower coils. This is used to model fluid structure interaction, wherein not just one rocket engine, but its interaction with the neighboring set of engines and the spark ignitors and ROFI chambers is modeled. This research enhances the understanding of the mechanisms driving instabilities in rocket engines during launch operations. It establishes a simulation-driven framework for evaluating various damping strategies, such as Helmholtz resonators and baffle inserts. The approach allows for the identification of dominant unstable modes, measurement of their growth rates, visualization of their spatial patterns (mode shapes), and determination of critical eigenfrequencies

column20: A BookMyShow for students. It is the smart platform for school & college events. Forget messy spreadsheets & manual follow-ups. We automate registrations, send instant email confirmations & handle cancellations - all in one place. A clean, simple & professional tool for students.
column29: Organizing a school or college fest should be exciting, but for the student committees in charge, it's often a stressful & chaotic process. They're stuck in a frustrating loop of juggling Google Forms, chaotic spreadsheets, and endless manual work. Organizers spend countless hours sorting through names and making the same repetitive confirmation calls, draining their energy and enthusiasm before the event even begins. Collecting payments is another major headache. They‚Äôre forced to share UPI QR codes on public forms‚Äîa method that's not only unprofessional but also a nightmare to track. Figuring out who has paid for which event becomes a massive, error-prone puzzle. Very often, crucial details for a competition arrive only a day before. This leaves talented students feeling unprepared and unable to perform their best, turning an exciting opportunity into a source of anxiety.

column31: Our unique solution is events., an all-in-one platform that replaces the chaos of event registration & management. For organizers, we swap their messy toolkit of Google Forms, spreadsheets, and manual QR codes for a single, powerful dashboard. From here, they can create events in minutes, automate registrations, process secure online payments, and send instant updates via email notifications. This eliminates countless hours of tedious manual work and repetitive confirmation calls. For students, events. serves as a central hub to discover fests and competitions. They can easily find all the information they need, register with a single profile, and receive every update directly. No more hunting for rules in scattered PDFs or missing last-minute schedule changes. Ultimately, we professionalize the entire process. We empower student organizers to run events with confidence and provide participants with a seamless, reliable experience from start to finish.

Students (Our Users): For students, events. is the go-to discovery platform. column41: What we understand is something that can only be learned from firsthand experience: The User is Two People at Once: Competitors see a "student organizer". We see a 17-year-old who is simultaneously a full-time student with exams and an untrained event manager. This means the winning solution isn't about having the most features; it's about being incredibly simple, intuitive, and saving time during peak academic pressure. Our platform is designed for a student first, and an organizer second. The Market is Campus Life, Not Just Careers: While competitors focus on high-stakes, corporate-sponsored events for talent acquisition, we see the much larger, ignored market: the everyday pulse of campus life. Our platform is built to empower students to run this entire ecosystem, from a humble debate club showdown to a large-scale sports meet or a major biannual exhibition‚Äîthe very events that define student life. The Goal Isn't Just Management; It's Empowerment: Students running events with messy spreadsheets and Google Forms feel amateur. They crave professionalism. Our platform isn't just a utility; it's an empowerment tool that elevates their work and gives them the confidence of running a professional-grade operation. This deep emotional driver is something an outside company simply wouldn't see.

column20: Redefining healthcare through intelligent data access
column23: RKIC PIEDS BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus
column29: ‚ÄúEvery time a patient walks into a new clinic, they start from zero.‚Äù  Healthcare in India remains fragmented and inefficient due to the lack of a unified digital record system. Patients frequently lose prescriptions, lab reports, and medical histories, resulting in repeated tests, inconsistent treatments, and missed opportunities for preventive care. There is no easy way for different clinics, hospitals, and diagnostic centres to share patient information securely, leaving critical data locked in silos. The absence of integrated EMR (Electronic Medical Records) and ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems at scale is a major bottleneck. The result is a healthcare system where neither the patient nor the provider has a complete picture of health history, risk factors, or preventive opportunities. We are solving this gap by enabling seamless, secure, and intelligent health data management across the ecosystem.‚ÄúIn a world where we can track a pizza in real time, we still can‚Äôt track our own health history.‚Äù
column30:
India‚Äôs pharmaceutical industry faces a silent but costly challenge: a data gap that slows innovation and inflates costs.

Lacking robust, large-scale Indian health datasets, pharma giants are forced to rely on foreign clinical data that often fails to capture the unique genetic makeup, lifestyle patterns, and disease profiles of India‚Äôs population. As a result, developing effective, India-specific medicines becomes harder.

The absence of unified, accessible patient records makes local clinical trials expensive and time-consuming. Companies spend huge sums repeating trial phases, delaying the arrival of life-saving drugs to market.

This fragmented data landscape also means missed opportunities, from identifying trial participants faster to tracking real-world treatment outcomes and tailoring therapies to Indian needs.

A connected health data vault could change everything, giving pharma secure, anonymised access to comprehensive Indian datasets, cutting R&D costs, accelerating trials, and empowering the creation of safer, more effective medicines for millions.
column31:
Our solution stands truly unparalleled and uniquely positioned as one of the only in India. Unlike existing players, who often focus on fragmented offerings or limited digital record-keeping, we are pioneering India‚Äôs first fully integrated, secure, and intelligent Health Data Vault that connects patients, doctors, hospitals, labs, and pharmaceutical companies on a single platform.

What makes us the first and only in this space is our comprehensive approach:

End-to-End Connectivity: We don‚Äôt just digitise records; we create a seamless ecosystem across the entire healthcare landscape, from individual patients to the largest pharma companies, ensuring continuous and contextualised health data flow.

Industry-Driven Innovation: Our solution is crafted from direct, high-level consultations with top executives of India‚Äôs biggest pharma and healthcare organisations, giving us unique, insider insight into industry pain points and needs that no other player has matched or addressed at this scale.

Scale and Security: We combine cutting-edge encryption and privacy controls with the ability to handle health data for over a billion Indians, delivering a system robust enough for nationwide deployment but personal enough for every patient.

Pharma-Grade Data Utility: We offer pharma companies anonymised, real-world Indian health data for the first time ever, cutting dependence on foreign datasets, slashing trial costs, and accelerating India-specific drug discovery, something no other Indian business has realised at this scale.

In essence, by uniting all stakeholders through a first-ever HEALTH DATA VAULT built with unmatched industry insight and national scale, we are not just entering a market, we are creating a new category and setting the gold standard for healthcare digitisation in India. This is why we are truly the FIRST and ONLY business delivering this transformative solution.
column32:
Our primary customers will be small and medium-sized healthcare providers, including solo practitioners, polyclinics, and hospitals, especially in Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities across India. These providers currently rely on manual, paper-based systems that slow workflows and risk errors, lacking affordable, easy-to-use digital tools tailored to their needs.

We are also planning to sell to small hospital chains and diagnostic centres seeking scalable software to streamline operations, unify patient records across locations, and improve regulatory compliance.

To expand our ecosystem, we will offer a freemium patient app that allows patients to access their prescriptions, schedule appointments, and receive reminders, building direct engagement and loyalty between providers and patients at no upfront cost.

Additionally, we will be onboarding labs and pharmacies to our platform, enabling digital referrals and seamless prescription fulfilment. This creates an integrated health network that improves patient convenience.
column40:
I(Lakshya Jain) founded Ediverse Youth Foundation with a mission to empower women and children in underserved rural and semi-urban communities through education, digital literacy, and health awareness in 2020. Starting with a small team of volunteers, we organised workshops tailored to the unique challenges these communities face, focusing on leadership and skill development. Our deep community engagement allowed us to build trust and create programs that truly made an impact. We are now an international group with volunteers from Asia, Africa and North America.

Our work attracted support from individuals, corporate partners, and donors. Through a combination of grassroots fundraising events, online campaigns, and partnerships, we successfully raised ‚Çπ80 lakhs. These funds helped us expand learning centres, reach more beneficiaries, and launch sustainable initiatives that have transformed hundreds of lives.

Recognising our impact, I was honoured to be recommended by the Prime Minister of New Zealand to represent youth at the UN ECOSOC Youth Forum 2025, amplifying voices from marginalised communities on a global platform. This recognition motivates me to continue driving social change through innovative and inclusive solutions.

This journey has not only shaped my leadership but also fueled my passion to build tech-driven healthcare solutions that reach those most in need, ensuring no one is left behind in the digital revolution.
column41:
Ever since I was a child, I‚Äôve grown up surrounded by stories from my doctor uncles about the daily struggles of running clinics, missed patient records, poor coordination with labs, and the frustration of slow, unresponsive tech support. These weren‚Äôt just isolated problems; they were systemic inefficiencies deeply embedded in India‚Äôs healthcare.

Years later, while pursuing an internship in cancer biology at Yale University, I saw the opposite end of the spectrum, highly integrated, efficient systems delivering care at scale. That contrast made the gap in Indian healthcare even starker. Most existing solutions in India cater to large urban hospitals, leaving small and mid-sized clinics, especially in Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities, underserved. And when technology is introduced, it‚Äôs often too complex, expensive, or poorly supported to truly work for them.

That‚Äôs why we built our startup differently. We designed a simple, affordable platform that connects doctors, patients, labs, and pharmacies seamlessly. Our freemium patient app and hands-on customer support make adoption smooth, while our deep understanding of grassroots challenges ensures the solution fits into real-world workflows. This isn‚Äôt just software, it‚Äôs a bridge across a healthcare gap I‚Äôve been seeing my whole life.

column20: Azeedo is a ClimateTech agritech startup empowering small and marginal farmers with Azeedo Shield, a plant-based, non-toxic crop protection using Induced Systemic Resistance (ISR) technology. Made from an invasive weed, it reduces chemical pesticide use by up to 60%, boosts yields by 12‚Äì25%, and restores ecosystems. Affordable, residue-free, and easy to adopt, Azeedo drives climate-resilient, profitable, and sustainable agriculture through innovation and farmer-focused outreach.
column29:
Azeedo is solving the critical problem of over-reliance on chemical pesticides by small and marginal farmers, which leads to high input costs, declining effectiveness due to pest resistance, health hazards, and environmental degradation.

Farmers face several interconnected challenges:

Rising costs & chemical dependency ‚Äì Expensive pesticides strain already thin profit margins.

Diminishing effectiveness ‚Äì Pests are developing resistance, forcing more frequent and heavier applications.

Health & safety risks ‚Äì Exposure to toxic residues harms farmers, consumers, and rural communities.

Environmental damage ‚Äì Soil degradation, water contamination, and biodiversity loss from chemical overuse.

Lack of viable alternatives ‚Äì Most eco-friendly solutions are either too costly or not tailored for smallholder needs.

This trap keeps millions of farmers stuck in a cycle of unsustainable farming, low productivity, and vulnerability to climate shocks.

Azeedo addresses this problem with Azeedo Shield, a safe, plant-based, non-toxic bioformulation that activates plants‚Äô own immune systems to protect against a wide range of pests and diseases. Made from a locally abundant invasive weed, it reduces chemical pesticide use by up to 60%, boosts yields by 12‚Äì25%, cuts costs, and restores ecosystem health, giving farmers an affordable, effective, and sustainable crop protection solution.
column30:

Made from a locally abundant invasive weed, it reduces chemical pesticide use by up to 60%, boosts yields by 12‚Äì25%, cuts costs, and restores ecosystem health, giving farmers an affordable, effective, and sustainable crop protection solution.
column31:
Azeedo‚Äôs unique solution is Azeedo Shield ‚Äî an affordable, plant-based, non-toxic crop protection bioformulation that uses Induced Systemic Resistance (ISR) technology to activate a plant‚Äôs own immune system, rather than killing pests with harmful chemicals.

What makes it unique:

Innovative Mode of Action: By triggering plants‚Äô natural defences, Azeedo Shield offers broad-spectrum, long-lasting protection against pests and diseases without leaving toxic residues.

Circular Economy Approach: It is made from a locally abundant invasive weed, turning an environmental problem into a valuable agricultural input, keeping production costs low and supporting ecological restoration.

Farmer-Centric Design: Affordable (‚Çπ1,500/litre), compatible with existing spraying equipment, and easy to use‚Äîideal for small and marginal farmers.

Proven Efficacy: Field results in India show 100% control of mealybugs within 24 hours, complete suppression of major fungal diseases (Fusarium oxysporum, Sclerotium rolfsii, Lasiodiplodia theobromae, Alternaria solani), and up to 19% yield enhancement in chilli, with 60% reduction in chemical pesticide use.

Safe & Sustainable: Non-toxic to humans, animals, and beneficial insects, and residue-free, protecting both health and the environment.

In short, Azeedo Shield uniquely combines advanced plant science, environmentally responsible sourcing, and affordability to break farmers‚Äô dependency on chemical pesticides while boosting productivity and resilience.
column32:
Azeedo is primarily selling to small and marginal farmers‚Äîthe backbone of India‚Äôs agriculture‚Äîwho are most affected by the high costs, health risks, and declining effectiveness of chemical pesticides.

Our target customers include:

Individual smallholder farmers seeking affordable, safe, and easy-to-use crop protection solutions.

Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) and cooperatives that procure inputs collectively for their members.

Agricultural input distributors and retailers who supply products to rural markets.

NGOs and agri-development programs working on sustainable agriculture and farmer welfare.

Agri-institutions and government programs promoting eco-friendly farming practices.

In future expansion plans‚Äîsuch as into the Australian market‚Äîwe will target:

Commercial-scale farmers facing pest and disease losses.

Organic and sustainable farming enterprises looking for residue-free crop protection.

Agri-cooperatives and distribution networks catering to large farming communities.

In short, Azeedo sells to farmers and organizations serving farmers, with a focus on those who need affordable, sustainable, and high-performance alternatives to chemical pesticides.
column40: One notable past project led by me, Koushik Bose (co-founder of Azeedo), was the successful development and large-scale field validation of Azeedo Shield in India. Starting from lab-scale bioformulation research, I spearheaded pilot programs across multiple states in collaboration with Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs), agricultural universities, and NGOs. This project involved demonstrating the product‚Äôs efficacy against major pests and diseases‚Äîachieving 100% control of mealybugs within 24 hours, complete suppression of fungal pathogens like Fusarium oxysporum, Sclerotium rolfsii, Lasiodiplodia theobromae, and Alternaria solani, and a 19% yield increase in chilli crops. Beyond technical validation, this initiative introduced sustainable crop protection to over 100 farmers, reducing chemical pesticide usage by up to 60% and lowering input costs, proving the product‚Äôs potential for large-scale adoption and deep environmental impact.
column41:
What sets our business, Azeedo, apart from other companies is our deep understanding of the unique challenges faced by small and marginal farmers in India and similar agricultural contexts, such as Australia. While many companies offer crop protection products, we recognize the critical need for solutions that are not only effective but also affordable, safe, and environmentally sustainable for resource-constrained farmers.

Unlike conventional chemical pesticides, which pose health risks, contribute to environmental degradation, and often become less effective due to pest resistance, Azeedo leverages advanced Induced Systemic Resistance (ISR) technology to activate the plant's own natural immunity. This approach provides broad-spectrum and long-lasting protection without harmful residues.

Moreover, our business model is built around a circular economy principle by utilizing a locally abundant invasive weed as the raw material for Azeedo Shield. This not only creates a sustainable supply chain but also helps restore ecosystems by turning an ecological problem into a valuable agricultural input‚Äîa nuance many competitors overlook.

We have demonstrated through extensive field trials and partnerships with farmers and institutions that Azeedo Shield can reduce chemical pesticide use by up to 60%, boost yields by 12‚Äì25%, and enhance profitability‚Äîall while being safe for farmers, consumers, and beneficial insects.

In essence, Azeedo uniquely combines cutting-edge science, ecological insight, farmer-centric design, and social impact focus. This holistic understanding of agricultural, environmental, and socioeconomic factors enables us to create solutions that truly resonate with and empower smallholder farmers‚Äîan insight that distinguishes us in the agritech landscape.
