column20: VayuNigrah is a sustainability-focused startup with the motto ‚ÄúWaste to Watts.‚Äù Driven by innovation, it transforms waste air from exhaust into clean, renewable energy. The company‚Äôs vision is to make green power accessible and affordable for all, reducing reliance on non renewable electricity. Its mission is to safeguard the environment, cut energy costs, and create impactful solutions that merge sustainability with practicality for a cleaner and brighter future.
column29:
In urban and semi-urban regions, air conditioners (ACs) are heavily used, often running for more than 8 hours a day. While providing comfort, this excessive use leads to three critical challenges:
1.	 High Energy Costs
Air conditioners are among the highest electricity-consuming appliances in homes and businesses. Prolonged daily use during summer months leads to steep electricity bills, creating a significant recurring financial burden for users.
2.	Urban Heat Island Effect
AC units release large amounts of hot exhaust into the surrounding environment. In densely populated areas, this accumulates and intensifies local outdoor temperatures ‚Äî a phenomenon known as the urban heat island effect ‚Äî which worsens overall thermal discomfort and increases cooling demand, creating a vicious cycle.
3.	Increased Carbon Footprint
80-85% of the electricity powering ACs in India comes from non-renewable coal-fired power plants. The high demand for electricity directly translates to greater coal consumption, resulting in significant greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution.

column31:
VayNigrah is an innovative device that harnesses the waste heat expelled by air conditioners and converts it into usable electricity through a turbine mechanism. This reduces environmental impact, enhances energy efficiency, and promotes sustainable urban living.

‚Ä¢	Air Capture ‚Äì A Polylactic Acid (PLA) module is attached to the AC‚Äôs exhaust outlet to channel the hot air.
‚Ä¢	Propeller Spin ‚Äì The airflow turns a PLA propeller.
‚Ä¢	Power Generation ‚Äì The spinning propeller drives a dynamo motor, producing clean electricity.
‚Ä¢	Power Use ‚Äì In Unitary Ac electricity is used to charge UPS systems or for centralized can directly be fed up to the meter reducing overall electricity bill. 
‚Ä¢	Savings & Impact ‚Äì Users save on bills, release less heat into the surroundings, and cut reliance on coal-powered electricity.

column29:
We are addressing the growing challenge of hair loss and ineffective treatment options. Today, nearly 65% of individuals receive incorrect diagnoses, and over 40% spend large sums on treatments that deliver little or no result. Professional solutions like transplants are often expensive, invasive, and unaffordable for over 90% of the population. At the same time, most over-the-counter products fail to provide personalized care, leaving 85% of people desiring solutions tailored to their unique scalp and hair conditions.

Folicle AI solves this by combining advanced AI-driven diagnostics with organic, customized treatment kits and next-generation 3D follicle bioprinting. Our platform ensures accurate assessment of scalp health, delivers affordable, chemical-free regimens, and provides a sustainable alternative for severe baldness without donor hair dependency. Beyond aesthetics, we also address the psychological and social impact of hair loss‚Äînearly 60% of individuals report its negative effect on confidence and career opportunities.

By bridging affordability, personalization, and scientific innovation, Folicle AI eliminates misdiagnosis, reduces wasted expenditure, and creates a reliable path to long-term regrowth and scalp health. Our mission is to democratize effective hair restoration while making it sustainable, inclusive, and accessible for everyone.
column30:
Hair loss is more than just a cosmetic issue‚Äîit affects confidence, self-esteem, and even career opportunities. Many people spend years trying shampoos, oils, and expensive treatments, only to be disappointed. Around 65% of people end up with the wrong diagnosis, while 40% waste money on solutions that don‚Äôt work. Professional treatments like transplants are out of reach for most, with over 90% unable to afford them.

On the other side, affordable products are mostly generic. They don‚Äôt consider individual scalp conditions, leaving 85% of people frustrated and still searching for answers. The result is not just hair loss, but also a loss of hope and trust in available options.

We are solving this by offering a personalized, science-backed path to hair health. Our AI scans understand your scalp, our organic kits provide safe and affordable care, and our 3D bioprinting technology creates a solution for those with advanced hair loss. In simple terms‚Äîwe aim to give people their confidence back, with treatments that truly work and don‚Äôt break the bank.
column31:
Our unique solution lies in building a complete ecosystem for hair restoration that bridges the gap between affordability, personalization, and scientific innovation. Unlike generic products or costly transplants, we combine three core innovations into one platform.

First, our AI-powered scalp diagnostic tool analyzes individual scalp and hair conditions with high accuracy. This ensures that users no longer rely on trial-and-error or misdiagnosed treatments. By understanding scalp health at a micro level, we can design truly personalized care.

Second, we provide customized organic treatment kits tailored to each individual. These are chemical-free, sustainable, and designed to target specific conditions such as thinning, dandruff, or early-stage baldness. The focus is on safe, effective, and affordable care that works over time.

Finally, for those with advanced hair loss, our 3D follicle bioprinting technology offers a breakthrough solution. By creating lab-grown follicles that integrate naturally into the scalp, we remove the need for donor hair and painful surgical procedures. This innovation makes long-term regrowth possible for people who otherwise have limited options.

Together, these three layers form a seamless, end-to-end solution‚Äîaccessible, personalized, and backed by science‚Äîhelping people not only restore their hair but also their confidence and quality of life.
column32:
Our primary customers are individuals experiencing hair loss, thinning, or scalp-related issues, typically between the ages of 20‚Äì45. This group includes students, young professionals, and working adults who often face the social and emotional impact of hair loss at an early stage. For them, appearance and confidence directly influence personal relationships, career growth, and self-esteem.

We also address premium customers with advanced baldness who are exploring long-term, effective alternatives to hair transplants. These individuals are willing to invest in innovation but seek less invasive, safer, and more sustainable solutions.

Our unique insight is that customers don‚Äôt just want hair growth‚Äîthey want personalization, affordability, and trust. Most feel frustrated by generic shampoos, oils, or clinics that give one-size-fits-all solutions. Surveys reveal that over 85% of people prefer treatments tailored to their unique scalp condition, yet such options are scarce and often prohibitively expensive.

By combining AI-driven diagnostics, customized organic regimens, and 3D follicle bioprinting, we meet both the emotional need for confidence and the practical demand for affordability and effectiveness. Our customer doesn‚Äôt want another product‚Äîthey want a partner who understands their hair journey and offers solutions that truly work.
column40:

Tanishq‚Äôs contribution was recognized for its depth and clarity, leading to his team‚Äôs shortlisting for the London finals of the competition.

column20: AI-driven law enforcement solutions that enhance crime prevention, strengthen public safety & boost police efficiency through intelligent surveillance & real-time data insights
column29:
Law enforcement agencies in India face severe challenges in data collection, verification, and crime prevention due to fragmented systems, manual processes, and limited technology adoption. This leads to slow investigations, delayed responses, and missed opportunities to prevent crime. Additionally, citizen safety initiatives often fail due to poor adoption, complex onboarding, and lack of trust.
Calyirex bridges this gap with AI-powered, user-friendly platforms tailored for police and defense agencies. Our solutions enable seamless property & tenant verification, crime pattern analysis, digital evidence management, and public engagement ‚Äî all while integrating with existing government workflows. We eliminate manual bottlenecks, improve operational efficiency, and empower authorities to act faster and smarter, directly impacting public safety.

We develop highly customized, AI-driven applications for police and defense agencies that blend citizen engagement with law enforcement intelligence.
Our flagship product Nazar enables property and tenant verification, worker management, and police-issued verification certificates, integrating directly with departmental systems. It gained 6,000+ users within one month of Jaipur Police deployment.
Our cybersecurity tool Crypto Space supports tracking and analysis of suspicious cryptocurrency transactions, helping law enforcement in financial crime prevention.
Unlike generic security apps, our solutions are co-created with law enforcement, ensuring real-world usability, scalability, and compliance. They work even in low-internet zones, support multilingual usage, and integrate AI-driven crime analytics.
column32:
Our primary customers are state and city police departments, law enforcement agencies, and government defense units. Secondary customers include municipal bodies and security-conscious enterprises that require background verification and surveillance solutions.
We have deep insight into their pain points ‚Äî having worked closely with officers during hackathons and pilot projects, we understand the urgency, legal compliance needs, and constraints of police technology adoption. We build tools that require minimal training, zero extra hardware, and instant deployment, which accelerates adoption.
Our success in Jaipur Police deployment and participation in national-level cybersecurity hackathons has given us a direct network into multiple state police forces. This insider understanding sets us apart from generic SaaS providers.

column20: Cutting plastic waste with banana fiber
column29: Banapack tackles two urgent challenges plaguing India‚Äôs fresh produce sector: the overwhelming use of single-use plastic packaging and substantial post-harvest losses. Today, most fruits and vegetables are shipped in non-biodegradable plastics, driving large-scale environmental pollution and filling landfills with waste that persists for centuries. At the same time, inadequate packaging and rough handling account for as much as 35% in combined spoilage and damage, eroding farmers‚Äô incomes and diminishing the shelf life of nutritious food. Our breakthrough solution replaces plastic with sustainable packaging crafted from banana fiber‚Äîa biodegradable agricultural byproduct that is typically discarded. By converting over 5 lakh tons of banana stem waste each year, Banapack not only removes a major source of landfill pollution and CO‚ÇÇ emissions, but also turns a farming liability into a revenue stream, supporting local economies. The result is packaging that delivers superior shock absorption and cushioning, dramatically reducing bruising and contamination of fresh produce during transportation. Crucially, Banapack‚Äôs solution is designed for seamless integration: it requires no major changes to current packaging infrastructure and minimal training, making the switch both accessible and cost-effective for farmers, retailers, and exporters. By enabling a circular economy through vermicompost production from fiber sap, Banapack empowers agricultural communities and advances India‚Äôs journey toward green packaging and sustainable food systems.
column30: Banapack tackles two urgent challenges plaguing India‚Äôs fresh produce sector: the overwhelming use of single-use plastic packaging and substantial post-harvest losses. Today, most fruits and vegetables are shipped in non-biodegradable plastics, driving large-scale environmental pollution and filling landfills with waste that persists for centuries. At the same time, inadequate packaging and rough handling account for as much as 35% in combined spoilage and damage, eroding farmers‚Äô incomes and diminishing the shelf life of nutritious food. Our breakthrough solution replaces plastic with sustainable packaging crafted from banana fiber‚Äîa biodegradable agricultural byproduct that is typically discarded. By converting over 5 lakh tons of banana stem waste each year, Banapack not only removes a major source of landfill pollution and CO‚ÇÇ emissions, but also turns a farming liability into a revenue stream, supporting local economies. The result is packaging that delivers superior shock absorption and cushioning, dramatically reducing bruising and contamination of fresh produce during transportation. Crucially, Banapack‚Äôs solution is designed for seamless integration: it requires no major changes to current packaging infrastructure and minimal training, making the switch both accessible and cost-effective for farmers, retailers, and exporters. By enabling a circular economy through vermicompost production from fiber sap, Banapack empowers agricultural communities and advances India‚Äôs journey toward green packaging and sustainable food systems.
column31: Banapack delivers a sustainable packaging solution for the agricultural sector by transforming banana fiber‚Äîan abundant, biodegradable agricultural byproduct‚Äîinto advanced packaging materials. Our innovation lies in hybrid cardboard options comprising 10%, 50%, and 100% banana fiber pulp, allowing us to tailor durability and cost-effectiveness to different market segments. This approach not only offers shock absorption and cushioning, significantly reducing bruising and post-harvest losses during transportation, but also replaces single-use plastics with an eco-friendly alternative. The leftover pulp generated during banana fiber extraction are processed into high-quality vermicompost, creating a zero-waste circular economy that supplies farmers with nutrient-rich organic fertilizer and an additional income stream. The packaging incorporates a banana fiber paper layer to minimize fruit abrasion, further preserving produce quality. Critically, Banapack‚Äôs solution is designed to integrate seamlessly with existing infrastructure, requiring no significant process changes or specialized training, which accelerates adoption. By upcycling nearly 60% of banana plant biomass that would otherwise be discarded and contribute to greenhouse gas emissions, Banapack reduces environmental pollution while generating economic value for farming communities. Our scalable, cost-competitive products are poised to appeal to premium retailers, grocers, and exporters, positioning Banapack as a force in India‚Äôs shift toward sustainable packaging.
column32: Banapack‚Äôs consumer base is strategically prioritized to maximize both market adoption and impact. 1. Retailers‚Äîincluding premium outlets like Reliance Fresh, Star Bazaar, and BigBasket, as well as mid-sized grocery chains‚Äîare our foremost customers. These businesses are under increasing pressure to shift to eco-friendly packaging due to evolving consumer preferences and regulatory requirements. By offering sustainable, high-quality alternatives that appeal to environmentally conscious shoppers, Banapack enables retailers to enhance their brand value while reducing plastic waste. 2. Exporters require packaging that meets strict international standards for food safety and sustainability. As they ship fresh produce to regulated global markets (such as the EU, US, and Australia), exporters seek certified, biodegradable packaging that protects products during long-distance transport and ensures compliance with foreign regulations. Banapack addresses this critical need, helping exporters access premium markets and minimize spoilage. 3. Farmers and Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) in states like Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, and Uttar Pradesh are also key users. These regions are major banana producers and export hubs, facing substantial post-harvest losses due to inadequate packaging. By adopting Banapack, farmers and FPOs benefit from cost-effective, protective solutions that reduce crop wastage and offer additional income through the sale of banana stem waste‚Äîa previously unused resource‚Äîthus supporting rural livelihoods and fostering a circular agricultural economy.
column40: Our team has actively participated in several prestigious competitions highlighting our innovative sustainable packaging solution, Banapack. 1) We secured 3rd place at Bizooka SIIB Pune. 2) We won the Akanksha competition organized by Manage Hyderabad. 3) We were honored as national finalists at Lakshay, Niam Jaipur.
column41: Banapack‚Äôs distinct competitive advantage lies in its innovative fusion of sustainability and real-world practicality for the agricultural sector, pioneering the use of banana fiber‚Äîan abundant, underutilized resource in India‚Äîfor high-performance packaging. Unlike conventional solutions that focus on textiles or general recycling, Banapack specifically targets agricultural packaging, addressing two major market challenges: post-harvest losses and plastic pollution. Our integrated zero-waste model exemplifies circular economy principles. We convert banana stem waste, typically an environmental liability, into robust, biodegradable packaging materials. Simultaneously, we repurpose the residual sap into vermicompost, further adding value for farmers and minimizing waste at every stage. This approach not only reduces the carbon footprint but also delivers tangible benefits to farming communities and the environment. Banapack‚Äôs solutions are engineered for straightforward adoption, requiring minimal operational change and no significant capital outlay. Our packaging integrates seamlessly with current supply chains, allowing for rapid scaling from smallholder to large-scale operations. By offering a tiered product portfolio (with 10%, 50%, and 100% banana fiber content), we cater to varied market needs‚Äîbalancing affordability, margin optimization, and product performance. Most importantly, Banapack empowers farmers and FPOs by unlocking new income streams from stem waste, strengthening rural economies, and fostering sustainable agricultural practices. As the first mover focused exclusively on eco-friendly packaging for fresh produce, Banapack is uniquely positioned to close a critical market gap‚Äîreducing food wastage, decreasing reliance on plastics, and supporting a resilient, future-ready supply chain.

column40: ‚ÄúPerformance Analysis of Machine Learning Algorithms for Spectrum Sensing Using Cognitive Radio‚Äù focuses on improving spectrum utilization in wireless communication. Cognitive radio allows unlicensed users (secondary users) to opportunistically access unused licensed spectrum, making spectrum sensing a critical task. Traditional methods such as energy detection often struggle in low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) conditions, leading to poor detection accuracy. To address this, the project implements and evaluates several machine learning (ML) algorithms, including Support Vector Machines (SVM), Decision Trees, Random Forest, and K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) for spectrum sensing. Features like signal energy, entropy, and statistical measures are extracted from received signals and used for training and testing. Performance is assessed using metrics such as accuracy, detection probability, false alarm rate, and computational complexity. Results show that ML algorithms significantly enhance detection performance compared to conventional techniques, highlighting their effectiveness in building robust and adaptive cognitive radio networks

column20: The Blinkit of healthcare: fast, tech-driven, and on demand
column29: India's urban healthcare landscape has a service void between overburdened primary care clinics and ERs for critical cases. This gap leaves millions grappling with uncertainty, inconvenience, and anxiety when faced with urgent but non-life-threatening medical needs. VYTAL is engineered to fill this void, introducing a new category of  "Healthcare at home". Accessing primary and urgent care in urban India is filled with friction. The typical patient journey for a non-emergency but urgent issue such as a sudden high fever, a minor injury, or an alarming symptom for a chronic condition involves a series of inconvenient and stressful steps.Patients often resort to risky self-diagnosis, endure long waiting times at crowded clinics, or face the high cost and anxiety of an unnecessary visit to a hospital emergency room. This systemic inefficiency creates a significant, unaddressed market need.
column30:
While government-run services like 108 EMRI provide a critical safety net, they are designed for high-acuity emergencies and patient transport, not for on-the-spot diagnostics and treatment of less severe issues. The average response time for the 108 service in Gujarat is 19 minutes, which, while commendable, underscores its focus on transport rather than immediate at-home care. National data suggests even longer response times in other areas, highlighting a nationwide opportunity for a faster, more specialised service layer. This leaves a vast "service void" for the majority of day-to-day medical concerns that fall between a routine check-up and a life-threatening event.
The current urban healthcare system is highly fragmented. A doctor's consultation, a diagnostic test at a lab, and a pharmacy purchase are typically disconnected events. This lack of integration prevents the creation of a longitudinal health record and inhibits the potential for a proactive care loop that could prevent future health crises. This fragmentation leads to operational inefficiencies, redundant processes, and missed opportunities for preventive medicine.
column31: We are developing a tech powered, on-demand healthcare delivery platform that dispatches paramedics to a patient's doorstep within 15 minutes. A paramedic at your home,on your demand not only provides you a sense of placebo (because of the doctors validation) and relief but also starts keeping a check on your potential health shortcomings by maintaining a database of your vitals.The on-site paramedic can act as a vital link to higher medical expertise. Using the paramedic's field app, they can facilitate an immediate and secure video consultation between the patient and a remote physician.The database will be maintained through the regular health checkups the patient can take through our services. Hence VYTAL also helps to make a preventive medicine system because it is designed to bridge this ecosystem void by integrating you test reports,doctor consultation, regular vital checks and medicine into a single, seamless platform. We also aim to seamlessly sync with a wide range of consumer-grade, home-installed health monitoring devices, such as Bluetooth-enabled blood pressure cuffs and glucometers. This continuous stream of patient-generated health data is crucial for our proactive and preventive care models, allowing for long-term health trend analysisWe are fundamentally shifting healthcare from a destination one must travel to, into a service that is available anytime, anywhere, on demand.
column32:
A typical person on our platform could be anywhere from a 80 year old to a family with a newly born.India has a large and growing elderly population. In Gujarat alone, 51.3% of senior citizens suffer from at least one chronic disease, with hypertension (24.3%) and diabetes (12.4%) being the most prevalent.Patients with these conditions require regular monitoring of vitals such as blood pressure and glucose levels. The current process is cumbersome and reactive, relying on periodic clinic visits.
This demographic faces significant mobility challenges, making frequent and often physically taxing trips to clinics for routine monitoring a major burden. This same patient has adult children who living away from their aging parents.This demographic possesses disposable income and is highly motivated to ensure the well-being of their loved ones.
And then there comes the upcoming health conscious population who have disposable income to spend on their health for Gym trainers, sleep trackers, whoop bands etc. We will cater to this audience by reducing the mess they wanna avoid by going to a hospital and booking a health checkup, maybe even lining up in queues for those tests to be conducted. Instead they could get their tests done, reported and consulted via teleconsultation via their phones itself on a weekend.

column41:
The inspiration for this project did not come from a business plan or a market trend, instead from a place of profound helplessness. I watched my grandparents, people who had given me so much, become defined by their chronic illnesses. The constant doctor visits, the confusing medications, the exhaustion of navigating a broken system was an emotional toll as much as a physical one.

This feeling hit even closer to home when I thought about my parents. The terrifying realisation that in a decade, they could be facing the same issues is what truly scared me. When you hear that you're prediabetic, there's a moment of reckoning. You realise there's no going back to the way things were. The only way forward is to take control, to act on your regular health checkups before a full-blown diagnosis is the only solution.
Our business isn't just about managing health; it's about providing a support system for their life. It's about giving them the clarity and the tools to be proactive, so they can live with confidence instead of fear. We're here to ease the emotional burden of navigating chronic illness, not just the physical one. We understand that behind every health metric is a human being with a life they want to protect. That's a perspective no other company has.Our customers aren't just patients; they are sons and daughters, fathers and mothers, all seeking to avoid that devastating feeling of helplessness. They want to know that no matter what comes, they are ready for it, not just with a plan, but with a sense of security and relief.

column29:
All brands in the world continuously need consumer data to understand their consumers emotions, needs, as well as get their genuine feedbacks and incorporate those actionable insights into their existing products.

However, there lacks a platform to connect brands directly with their consumers.
column30:
All brands in the world continuously need consumer data to understand their consumers emotions, needs, as well as get their genuine feedbacks and incorporate those actionable insights into their existing products.

However, there lacks a platform to connect brands directly with their consumers.
column31:
A global data-driven platform that provides actionable insights to brands in the form of video feedbacks directly from their consumers.
Here, Brands get the data and feedbacks they exactly want, not some random data and feedbacks that the customer is giving currently in Amazon, Flipkart, etc.

In the app, users will first pick a product category (like smartphone), then choose the brand, and after that, select the specific model they use, then they will upload:
1) A Video recording in which they will show their face, the product and answer 4 questions:
-->Why did you buy this product?
-->Why did you choose this brand?
-->What‚Äôs one thing you like most about the product?
-->What‚Äôs one thing you dislike most about the product?
2) Answer a questionnaire where they will rate the product on scale of 1 to 5 based on different parameters (like battery life)
column32:
All brands in the world across all product categories.
Our USP:
1)Access to Competitor Feedback: Brands can also view feedback from customers of their competitors.
2)Incentives for Consumers: People get paid for uploading their feedback, so they‚Äôre motivated to participate.
3)Targeted Insights: Brands receive the exact kind of feedback and data they‚Äôre looking for ‚Äî not just random or general responses.
column40:
I, Mohit, built an app called ‚ÄúBook My Space‚Äù for my school in Grade 11 to solve the problem of classroom and lab scheduling. Earlier, teachers relied on a WhatsApp group to request and book spaces, which often led to confusion and clashes. Our school has 20+ different spaces in addition to regular classrooms ‚Äî including labs, halls, and activity areas ‚Äî where teachers conduct classes and sessions.

To address this, I created a simple mobile app where teachers could check availability and reserve spaces in real time. The app is actively used by 40+ teachers on a daily basis, has streamlined scheduling conflicts, and gave me my first hands-on experience in identifying a real problem, building a tech solution, and seeing it make an impact in a live environment.
column41:
The feedbacks currently received by companies consists majorly of generic surveys and responses. We understand that feedback is far more powerful when it is authentic, emotional, and visual. A video captures tone, sentiment, and context that numbers never can.

We also recognise that brands don‚Äôt just need data; they need actionable insights and credible content they can use to improve products and marketing. Our business uniquely combines consumer psychology, video authenticity, and data intelligence to deliver both ‚Äî which is why we are not just a feedback tool, but a growth engine for brands.

column20: Jurix AI is an AI-powered legal assistant that simplifies research, drafting, and compliance making legal services faster, smarter, and affordable for lawyers, businesses, and individuals.
column29:
The legal industry is one of the most information-heavy and time-consuming professions in the world. Lawyers and legal professionals spend a significant portion of their time researching precedents, drafting documents, and reviewing case materials often manually. This leads to inefficiency, high costs for clients, and limited access to justice for individuals and businesses who cannot afford premium legal services.

Moreover, in emerging markets like India, there is a massive gap between demand and supply of affordable, high-quality legal support. Small businesses, startups, and individuals often struggle to navigate complex laws, regulations, and compliance requirements without paying exorbitant fees. Legal research tools exist, but they are either prohibitively expensive, outdated, or too technical for practical daily use.

Jurix AI solves this by building an AI-powered legal assistant that automates research, contract analysis, and document drafting reducing the time taken from hours to minutes. With a freemium model, we democratize access to intelligent legal solutions, making it affordable for solo lawyers, SMEs, and ordinary citizens while empowering larger firms with speed and precision.

In essence, Jurix AI is solving the twin problems of inefficiency in legal workflows and limited access to affordable legal services, unlocking faster, smarter, and more inclusive justice.

column40:
In my previous project, Mark AI, I developed a marketing and outreach automation system designed to streamline customer acquisition for businesses. The challenge we tackled was the heavy manual effort required in lead generation, follow-ups, and client engagement. To solve this, we built an automated pipeline that integrated multi-channel campaigns across email, LinkedIn, and CRM tools, enabling businesses to scale outreach without scaling headcount.

The system used AI-driven personalization to craft tailored messages, automate follow-ups, and deliver insights at the right time to the right audience. By tracking open rates, responses, and engagement, we optimized campaigns in real-time, improving conversion rates significantly. Lead scoring and nurturing ensured that sales teams focused only on the most promising prospects.

This project empowered organizations to reduce acquisition costs, boost efficiency, and drive predictable growth. Mark AI proved that with smart automation, businesses can achieve scale without losing personalization.
column41:
Most legal-tech companies approach the industry as a data problem‚Äîfocusing on building search engines, case law databases, or digitized libraries. While valuable, these solutions often ignore the real pain point for lawyers and clients: the gap between raw information and actionable legal insight. Lawyers don‚Äôt just need faster search results they need context, reasoning, and adaptability.

At Jurix AI, we understand that the future of legal services lies not in information retrieval, but in decision support and automation. Our platform doesn‚Äôt just fetch precedents; it interprets them, drafts context-specific contracts, and automates repetitive workflows. This turns hours of manual work into minutes of assisted reasoning.

We also recognize that access is as critical as innovation. Many global tools are priced beyond reach for solo practitioners, SMEs, or individuals. Jurix AI bridges this by combining enterprise-grade intelligence with a freemium model, democratizing legal technology for wider adoption.

What truly differentiates us is our understanding that the legal system is not just about law it‚Äôs about time, trust, and accessibility. By addressing efficiency and affordability together, Jurix AI is building not just a product, but an ecosystem where technology enables faster, smarter, and more inclusive justice.

column20: Qwantic AI is a B2B SaaS startup revolutionizing how manufacturers, logistics firms, and SMEs handle their revenue pipelines. We automate every step of the Quote-to-Cash (QTC) process via AI-powered chat interfaces integrated with Slack, WhatsApp, and ERPs, cutting delays, errors, and manual work.
column29: QTC (quote-to-cash) workflows in most organizations are fundamentally broken. teams often rely on disconnected tools like WhatsApp, spreadsheets, emails, and ERPs, which creates silos and prevents seamless collaboration. every RFQ or update requires repeated manual data entry, slowing down operations and increasing the chances of errors. According to salesforce CPQ research, nearly 20-30% of sales representatives‚Äô time is wasted on quoting tasks alone, leaving less time for actual customer engagement and closing deals. the inefficiency doesn‚Äôt stop there. Lack of follow up systems, miscommunication between teams, and missing reminders often cause serious revenue leakage. quotes get delayed, approvals are stuck in long email chains, and customer inquiries go unanswered. as a result, businesses not only lose valuable time but also miss opportunities to convert prospects into paying clients. the fragmented system leads to frustration for both sales teams and customers, weakening trust and slowing down the sales cycle. in today‚Äôs fast-paced market, where buyers expect speed, personalization, and reliability, broken qtc workflows create a competitive disadvantage. organizations urgently need connected, intelligent solutions that streamline quoting, approvals, invoicing, and follow-ups to unlock efficiency and maximize revenue potential.
column30: QTC (quote-to-cash) workflows in most organizations are fundamentally broken. teams often rely on disconnected tools like WhatsApp, spreadsheets, emails, and ERPs, which creates silos and prevents seamless collaboration. every RFQ or update requires repeated manual data entry, slowing down operations and increasing the chances of errors. column31: Qwantic ai offers a single connected platform to simplify the entire quote-to-cash journey. it starts with capturing RFQs seamlessly from channels like web forms, WhatsApp, or slack, removing the hassle of scattered communication. using ai-driven logic, it generates accurate, consistent quotes with automated pricing, discounts, and formatting. quotes are instantly converted into custom-branded pdfs, ready to be shared with clients. approvals no longer require long email threads stakeholders can approve quotes in just one click directly within slack or WhatsApp. once approved, data syncs smoothly with popular ERPs such as Zoho, Tally, or SAP, ensuring operational consistency without manual entry. invoicing is automated too, with integrations to payment systems like stripe and RazorPay, which also handle reminders to reduce payment delays. at every stage, from quote creation to final payment, the platform provides a centralized qtc dashboard that offers full visibility into the pipeline, enabling teams to track progress, measure efficiency, and reduce revenue leakage. by automating manual tasks and unifying fragmented tools, Qwantic ai saves valuable sales time, improves collaboration, and ensures a faster, more reliable revenue cycle for growing businesses.
column32:
Our target market is Indian manufacturing SMEs, logistics firms, exporters, and assembly or trading units. these businesses typically operate with lean teams and depend heavily on quick response times to win orders. they deal with multiple inquiries daily, often over WhatsApp, phone calls, and emails, but lack a streamlined system to convert these into formal quotes, approvals, and invoices. Most rely on spreadsheets or basic ERPs like tally, which require manual entry and constant coordination across sales, finance, and operations.
a unique insight we‚Äôve uncovered from speaking with over 40 such businesses is that speed and trust matter more than complex features. customers often choose suppliers who can send accurate, branded quotes within minutes, not hours. however, these smes lose opportunities because they‚Äôre stuck waiting for approvals or retyping data into different systems. Another pain point is cash flow, late payments hurt them significantly but follow-ups are inconsistent as teams are busy handling operations.

this means the real value is not in giving them another heavy dashboard but in building an invisible, chat-first system that integrates with their existing tools, automates their qtc flow, and helps them respond faster, reduce errors, and get paid on time.

column29: Globally, over 1.3 billion people live with disabilities, and in India alone there are 26.8 million disabled individuals and over 100 million elderly citizens. Yet, adaptive clothing and footwear remain either unaffordable imports (‚Çπ15,000‚Äì20,000), poorly designed medical-looking products, or completely absent from mainstream retail. Our surveys with 80+ users show that 90% struggle with conventional clothing/footwear, 78% demand adaptive fasteners, and 85% are unaware of existing brands. This results in loss of independence, discomfort, stigma, and exclusion from everyday fashion. Aavaran addresses this by delivering affordable, dignified, and fashion-forward adaptive apparel and footwear tailored to Indian needs.

column31:
Aavaran is building India‚Äôs first inclusive fashion brand focused on making adaptive apparel and footwear both stylish and affordable. Our mission is to redefine adaptive fashion not as a medical necessity or luxury, but as a dignified, everyday choice accessible to millions. What sets us apart is our unique blend of localized manufacturing‚Äîreducing costs by 60‚Äì70% compared to imports‚Äîand human-centered design. We co-create every product with input from people with disabilities, caregivers, physiotherapists, and rehabilitation experts to ensure real-world functionality without compromising on style.
We are starting with adaptive footwear‚Äîan underserved yet highly standardized segment. Our designs feature thoughtful innovations such as wide openings with zip closures, breathable materials, removable insoles to accommodate orthotics, and antimicrobial linings for hygiene and comfort. These features address common challenges faced by people with mobility impairments, prosthetic users, and elderly individuals with conditions like arthritis and Parkinson‚Äôs.
In the long term, we will expand into adaptive knitwear and apparel to become a one-stop solution for inclusive fashion in India. By combining affordability, cultural relevance, and aesthetic appeal, Aavaran delivers more than just clothing‚Äîwe offer independence, confidence, and self-expression through fashion that includes everyone.
column32:
Our primary customers are individuals with mobility impairments and prosthetic users, particularly those wearing Ankle-Foot Orthoses (AFOs), who face daily challenges with conventional footwear and clothing. These products are often difficult to wear independently, uncomfortable over assistive devices, or simply not designed with their needs in mind. Our secondary audience includes India‚Äôs rapidly growing elderly population‚Äîmany of whom experience age-related conditions such as arthritis or Parkinson‚Äôs‚Äîthat make dressing and footwear a daily struggle.

Through extensive community engagement, we've discovered a consistent desire across these groups: the need for products that support independence, comfort, and dignity‚Äîwithout compromising on aesthetics or affordability. In addition, we serve convenience-seeking consumers who appreciate adaptive design for its ease of use, regardless of ability.
On the institutional side, we work with rehabilitation centers, hospitals, orthotists, and NGOs who often serve as first points of contact for patients needing adaptive solutions. This dual B2C and B2B approach allows us to create deep, direct impact while also scaling reach through trusted healthcare and social channels.
Our unique insight lies in recognizing that adaptive fashion must be functional and aspirational‚Äîaddressing physical needs while empowering self-expression across diverse Indian contexts.
column40: One of our team members previously worked on Project Leher, an award-winning social enterprise by Enactus SRCC that tackled the global menace of cigarette butt waste. The venture established a nationwide collection and recycling system, detoxifying and upcycling cigarette butts into eco-friendly products like ceramics, bricks, paper packaging, and planter pots. Leher created employment for over 120 people, recycled 33+ million cigarette butts, and protected 16.9 billion liters of ocean water. The project was recognized globally. This experience equipped our team with proven expertise in problem identification, waste-to-value innovation, impact scaling, and stakeholder engagement skills we now bring to building Aavaran.
column41: Most companies view adaptive apparel as either a niche medical aid or a luxury fashion add-on. At Aavaran, we believe it‚Äôs about more than just function it‚Äôs about dignity, affordability, and cultural relevance. Through in-depth research with over 80 disabled individuals and caregivers, we've learned that people value independence and self-expression just as much as comfort. While global brands often design for Western bodies and climates, and many Indian NGOs sacrifice design and scalability, we focus on creating standardized, stylish, and India-specific solutions that can reach millions across Tier II and III cities. What sets Aavaran apart is our belief that true adaptive fashion must combine inclusivity with accessibility at scale. Some of our founders have lived these challenges themselves, bringing firsthand experience and deeply personal insight to everything we create.

column40:
AgriSim was a project developed by team AuraX under 24 hours at the Hack4Change at ISB Hyderabad on 23rd & 24th August. The hackathon was organised in collaboration between Google & T-Hub for which the top 40 teams were invited for the final 24 hour hack where our team managed to clinch the top 6 spot.

Problem: 85% farmers in India are small & marginal with less then 2 hectares of land. The only way to improve their lifestyle is either improving yield efficiency or crop diversification into high value crops for which they lack the following knowledge about their farm which makes them risk averse:

1. Quality & type of soil?
2. Fertiliser types for maximum yield?
3. High value crop yields?

Solution: We built an android application that employs a realistic virtual simulation of the farmer's land. Through an intuitive interface and augmented reality (AR) technology, farmers navigate their actual farm boundaries, allowing the app to pinpoint precise coordinates. Leveraging APIs, real-time satellite imagery, weather data, and climate information, the app generates a comprehensive virtual representation of the farmer's land, including soil type and other pertinent details.

This virtual simulation is seamlessly integrated with an advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning model. This model analyzes the gathered data to optimise fertiliser selection and enhance yield efficiency. Moreover, it offers tailored recommendations for crop diversification, suggesting high-value crops that align with the specific conditions of the farmer's land.

Result: 

1. Improve yield efficiency
2. Crop diversification
3. Increase profitability

Note: This received project got recognition from SDE mentors at Google & Agriculture mentors from T-Hub at the Hack4Change at ISB Hyderabad.

column20: QuickCure is a healthtech platform that gives every patient a secure QR-based digital identity, unifying records across hospitals, clinics, labs, and telemedicine. With offline-first EHR, multilingual AI, and predictive analytics, it empowers doctors with instant insights and delivers faster, smarter, and equitable healthcare for all.
column29:
Healthcare systems struggle with fragmented patient records, poor interoperability, and decision delays. Patients often visit multiple hospitals, labs, or telemedicine providers, but their medical history remains scattered across paper slips or siloed systems. This forces doctors to rely on incomplete data, leading to repeated tests, misdiagnosis, treatment delays, and higher costs.

Existing digital solutions are either too complex, network-dependent, or not patient-friendly. Low bandwidth, multilingual barriers, and lack of offline access further limit adoption, especially in resource-constrained settings. As a result, both clinicians and patients face inefficiencies and frustration.

QuickCure addresses this by giving every patient a portable QR-based digital health identity that unifies their medical records across platforms. The system is offline-first, works seamlessly in low-connectivity environments, and integrates multilingual AI support with predictive analytics to flag health risks early. This ensures doctors get instant, accurate data while patients enjoy secure, frictionless healthcare access.

column31:
QuickCure provides a unified, offline-first digital health platform that ensures every patient has a secure, portable QR-based health identity. By scanning a QR code, clinicians can instantly access the patient‚Äôs complete medical history‚Äîlab reports, prescriptions, chronic conditions, and past visits‚Äîwithout delays or dependency on high-speed internet. The platform integrates multilingual AI assistants that break literacy and language barriers, while predictive analytics highlight potential risks and automate follow-up reminders. This empowers doctors to make faster, data-driven decisions and improves continuity of care.
Unlike existing systems that are siloed or network-heavy, QuickCure is designed to be interoperable with ABDM/ABHA standards, privacy-preserving, and cost-effective, making it deployable in hospitals, clinics, labs, pharmacies, and telemedicine platforms alike. Our solution directly reduces decision latency, avoids redundant tests, strengthens chronic care management, and enhances patient experience. With simple QR workflows, secure edge-ready architecture, and predictive insights, QuickCure makes healthcare fast, equitable, and scalable for all stakeholders‚Äîclinicians, patients, caregivers, and public health programs.
column32:

column40:
ResQ was a smart emergency vehicle preemption system built to reduce ambulance delays in congested cities. It combined GPS tracking, encrypted 5G communication, and microcontroller-based traffic light integration to automatically clear routes for ambulances. Unlike conventional solutions, ResQ required no large infrastructure overhaul, making it cost-effective and deployable at scale. By addressing the critical ‚Äútime-to-care‚Äù gap in emergencies, ResQ highlighted how technology can directly save lives.

This experience directly connects to QuickCure, as both projects tackle delays in healthcare delivery caused by system inefficiencies. While ResQ solved the problem of physical delays in reaching hospitals, QuickCure focuses on reducing decision delays inside healthcare systems by unifying patient records, enabling offline-first QR access, and providing AI-driven insights. Together, they reflect our mission to make healthcare faster, smarter, and more equitable through innovative, real-world solutions.
column41: We understand that the true bottleneck in healthcare is not just digitization, but latency in decision-making caused by fragmented, inaccessible, and non-interoperable data. Most solutions focus on digitizing records, but overlook real-world constraints like low bandwidth, offline availability, multilingual diversity, and patient usability. QuickCure is built with these realities at its core-offline-first, QR-based, AI-supported, and ABDM/ABHA-ready-which makes us uniquely positioned to succeed where others struggle.

column29:
We are addressing the critical safety and livelihood crisis faced by Tamil Nadu fishermen in the Palk Strait. Due to depleted fish stocks and a lack of affordable navigation tools, these fishermen often unintentionally cross the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) into Sri Lankan waters.
This results in devastating consequences:
 * Frequent Arrests & Seizures: Over 2,831 fishermen have been arrested and 671 boats seized between 2015 and mid-2025.
 * Loss of Life: Encounters with Sri Lankan authorities have led to numerous deaths, with over 245 Indian fishermen documented as killed over the decades.
 * Economic Hardship: The loss of boats, gear, and income cripples the fishing communities, creating immense emotional and financial distress.
The problem is persistent and unpredictable, leaving fishermen vulnerable with outdated navigation methods that cannot reliably prevent accidental border crossings.
column30:
We are addressing the critical safety and livelihood crisis faced by Tamil Nadu fishermen in the Palk Strait. Due to depleted fish stocks and a lack of affordable navigation tools, these fishermen often unintentionally cross the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) into Sri Lankan waters.
This results in devastating consequences:
 * Frequent Arrests & Seizures: Over 2,831 fishermen have been arrested and 671 boats seized between 2015 and mid-2025.
 * Loss of Life: Encounters with Sri Lankan authorities have led to numerous deaths, with over 245 Indian fishermen documented as killed over the decades.
 * Economic Hardship: The loss of boats, gear, and income cripples the fishing communities, creating immense emotional and financial distress.
The problem is persistent and unpredictable, leaving fishermen vulnerable with outdated navigation methods that cannot reliably prevent accidental border crossings.
column31:
Our solution is MarinePilot, an affordable GPS-based autopilot and geofencing system designed specifically for small and medium-scale fishing boats.
Its unique features include:
 * Precise NavIC-Based Tracking: We use India's own satellite navigation system (NavIC) for highly accurate, real-time vessel positioning.
 * Proactive Geofencing Alerts: The system creates a virtual fence along the maritime boundary and automatically triggers warnings via buzzer and SMS when the boat is 100 meters from the border.
 * Automated Course Correction: Our key innovation is the autopilot-enabled firmware. Unlike simple warning systems, MarinePilot automatically diverts the vessel back into the safe zone when it nears the maritime limit, preventing the crossing without requiring manual intervention.
We are positioned as a low-cost, high-automation alternative to expensive competitors like Garmin and Raymarine, making advanced safety technology accessible to the fishermen who need it most.
column32:
Our primary customers are the small and medium-scale fishing communities in Tamil Nadu, who operate a fleet of over 39,000 boats. We also target cooperative fishing associations for bulk sales and B2B partnerships with boat builders.
Our unique insight is that these fishermen are not willfully crossing borders; they are driven by economic necessity and hampered by a technology gap. A simple GPS is not enough. Due to rough seas, poor visibility, and the stress of their work, they need a solution that is proactive and automated, not just a passive warning.
Furthermore, we understand that their income is seasonal, with high peaks and low periods due to fishing bans and monsoons. Therefore, our go-to-market strategy includes flexible financing options like seasonal payments and lease-to-own plans, making the technology financially accessible.
column40: Worked on a project that aims to develop a real-time communication system that bridges the gap between deaf/mute individuals and people who don‚Äôt know sign language. The system will capture spoken language, text, and gestures and translate them into sign language animations and multilingual text/speech output.
column41:
We understand that solving the fishermen's border-crossing issue is not just a hardware problem; it's an accessibility and automation problem.
Competitors like Garmin and Raymarine offer high-cost, general-purpose marine electronics. They don't grasp that for our specific customer, a passive warning system is insufficient. In a moment of distraction or poor weather, a crossing can still happen. Our business is built on the insight that the solution must be proactive and automated it must physically prevent the boat from crossing the line.
Furthermore, we know the business model must align with the community's economic reality. A one-size-fits-all sales approach won't work. Our strategy is built around deep community integration through partnerships with cooperatives, leveraging government subsidies, and offering flexible, seasonal financing that matches the fishermen's cash flow. This holistic approach combining affordable, automated technology with a community-centric business model is what others miss.

column20: AI platform to screen and rank venture deals
column29: Larger VC funds receive hundreds of applications on a monthly basis. They hire full-time analysts to go through pitch decks and figure out which ones are worth time and money. Analyst OS plans to help triage at the earliest stage, so that analysts spend their time only reviewing the top 20% of applicants. We rank the pitches based on a thesis fit and viability scale, to give you the best of the best companies.
column30: Larger VC funds receive hundreds of applications on a monthly basis. They hire full-time analysts to go through pitch decks and figure out which ones are worth time and money. Analyst OS plans to help triage at the earliest stage, so that analysts spend their time only reviewing the top 20% of applicants. We rank the pitches based on a thesis fit and viability scale, to give you the best of the best companies.
column31: Our unique solution is two fold: On one hand, a lot of companies that apply to VC funds do not match the criteria and thesis that the fund has. Using parameters like sectors in focus, average ticket size, geographies etc. we identify if the applicant company is a fit for the fund‚Äôs thesis or not. On the other hand, understanding the viability of the business model is also crucial. Our platform uses a weighted classification of parameters like target market size, current revenue, team etc. to assess the viability of the business. Using these 2 scores, we filter out the top 20% of applicants every week and share it with the analysts.
column32: Our target market currently is VC funds and family offices which get over 100-150 applications/pitch decks a month. Going forward, as more funds join our network, we will become more of a startup and VC connection platform, given that multiple funds with varied theses will be on the same network.

column20: Rebelive is a new-age wellness startup creating clean, functional food and beverage products for Gen Z and Millennials. We tackle daily health issues like low energy, stress, poor nutrition, and gut problems through enjoyable, science-backed solutions like energy drinks, vitamin gummies, and infused chocolates. With honest ingredients, bold branding, and a rebellious spirit, Rebelive is building a movement toward a healthier, more conscious lifestyle ‚Äî one product at a time.
column29: In today's fast-paced world, especially among Gen Z and Millennials, most people struggle with daily fatigue, poor nutrition, stress, gut issues, and overall low immunity. Despite this, the market is flooded with sugary, chemical-loaded products disguised as "healthy" or "natural." There is a massive gap between what people think they‚Äôre consuming and what they‚Äôre actually putting into their bodies. Rebelive exists to close this gap with real, clean, functional nutrition ‚Äî made fun, honest, and easy to adopt.

column20: CLEAR is a home services platform where users request a service and receive real-time bids from local providers, choosing based on price, ratings, and ETA.
column29:
If you‚Äôve ever tried to book a plumber or an electrician in India, you know how insufferable it is, and it‚Äôs even worse in smaller cities.
Home services in India are unreliable, and unorganized.
Customers don‚Äôt know who to trust or what price to pay.
Service providers struggle with unpredictable demand, poor income, and a non-existent digital presence.
column30:
If you‚Äôve ever tried to book a plumber or an electrician in India, you know how insufferable it is, and it‚Äôs even worse in smaller cities.
Home services in India are unreliable, and unorganized.
Customers don‚Äôt know who to trust or what price to pay.
Service providers struggle with unpredictable demand, poor income, and a non-existent digital presence.
column31:
Our Solution?
CLEAR is an all-in-one platform where users request a service and receive real-time bids from verified local providers. They choose based on price, rating, and ETA giving them control, trust, and convenience.
How does it work?
When a user submits a service request, nearby verified providers receive a notification. They respond with a price and ETA, which is shown live to the user. The user selects the best fit and confirms booking.
CLEAR is built around unique principles:
A bidding system that promotes price transparency and faster bookings
A mutual review system to build trust for both users and providers
A platform that caters to all categories from pest control and appliance repair to cooking and cleaning.
And a hyperlocal approach, designed to scale beyond Tier 1 cities, where 70% of the market still operates offline
column32:
There are over 289 million households in India, with over $75 billion addressable, and largely untapped outside metros.
Our primary customers are middle-class families and working professionals who value trust, transparency, and convenience but are underserved by existing platforms.
column40: Abhishek, the technical co-founder developed an AI model which validated startup ideas. The shortcomings, how it could be improved and what the strategy should be.
column41:
CLEAR is built from the ground up for flexibility, price transparency, and provider independence hard to copy without rewriting their core operations.
CLEAR is designed for the rest of India where:
Informality dominates (freelance workers, small vendors)
Price sensitivity is real
And trust is earned locally, not by branding
Our bidding system fits how Indians already make decisions they compare, negotiate, then book.
We're not forcing users into fixed prices or locking providers into a rigid structure. We're building a real marketplace, not a service company.
Also, we‚Äôre launching with a leaner, tech-enabled ops model not a heavy supply chain so we scale faster and cheaper into Tier 2/3.
Where Urban Company tried to control everything, we‚Äôre enabling everyone.
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôll win where they can‚Äôt grow.

Our unique solution lies in bringing high-end AI assistance to underserved communities through compact, affordable, and user-friendly devices‚Äîbridging the gap between innovation and accessibility.

column20: At Baylink we are building India's first platform to transform in-store workers into sales and data engines for FMCG Brnads
column29:
For FMCG and consumer brands, the biggest challenge in offline retail is not getting into stores but moving off the shelf. Once products are stocked, they often sit idle because brand visibility, consumer engagement, and last-mile sales push are missing.

Currently, brands cope through:

Merchandisers who are expensive, limited in coverage, and hard to scale.

Distributor-led sales beats that focus on order-taking, not sell-through.

Trade schemes & discounts that burn margin without ensuring product movement or data visibility.

This results in low shelf velocity, failed product launches, and lack of real-time insights.
column30:

column31:
Baylink Saarthi transforms in-store workers (the most underutilized retail asset) into a scalable, on-demand sales and data network. Unlike traditional merchandising or discount-led trade schemes, our solution is human-first, tech-enabled, and performance-driven.

Micro-Missions at Scale
Through our Saarthi app, in-store workers run bite-sized missions‚Äîpushing new SKUs, improving shelf visibility, driving trials, or capturing consumer insights.

Pay-for-Performance Model
Brands only pay when missions are successfully completed, validated by stock movement and cross-checks through our Vault platform, ensuring accountability and transparency.

Data-Driven Execution
Every mission generates structured, store-level data, offering real-time insights on product performance, trials, and consumer feedback‚Äîsomething brands don‚Äôt get from distributors or trade schemes.

Affordable & Scalable
Compared to traditional merchandising, Saarthi is cheaper, faster, and more scalable, allowing even challenger brands to access high-quality in-store execution across thousands of stores.
column32:
Target Customers:

Challenger & emerging brands (‚Çπ5‚Äì100 Cr ARR) needing visibility, trials, and faster GTM.

Mid/large FMCG brands launching SKUs or seeking in-store activation & feedback.

Why They Buy:

Struggle with sell-through despite distribution.

Need ROI-linked, performance-driven in-store execution.

Lack reliable real-time retail data.
column40:
Sakshat
- Project: In high school , I built a smart city energy system that interconverted multiple energy sources to maximise efficiency and conservation.

Innovation: Installed a stepper motor in car gearboxes to generate energy from movement, piezoelectric sensors in footpaths to harness energy from pedestrians, and integrated it all with solar and wind power to create a self-sustaining ecosystem.

Impact: This project won the national science exhibition, making my school the only private institution to achieve this that year.

column41:
What we deeply understand about our business‚Äîsomething most others miss‚Äîis the real power of the in-store worker. Traditional players see distribution and shelf space as the endgame, while we know the real battle is at the point of sale‚Äîthe moment when a shopper decides whether to pick up a product or not.

Most companies rely on merchandisers or sales beats, which are costly, inconsistent, and lack accountability. We‚Äôve learned that by activating the store‚Äôs own workforce (Saarthis), giving them tech, incentives, and micro-missions, we can unlock a trusted, scalable, and performance-linked salesforce that no outsider can replicate.

This understanding‚Äîthat the ‚ÄúChhotu‚Äù behind the counter is the most powerful distribution lever‚Äîis our moat. Others see him as unskilled labor; we see him as the Google Ads of offline retail: a human interface, present where it matters most, delivering brand impact in real time.

column20: We build sustainable and scalable bio-based products by utilizing advanced biotechnology and genetic engineering.  Our mission is to drive sustainable transformation across these sectors by delivering bio-based solutions that are both economically viable
column29:
The flavors and fragrance industry faces a significant challenge in meeting the rising demand for natural vanillin, a demand driven by consumer preference for healthier, sustainably sourced ingredients with minimal environmental impact. Despite vanilla being the most widely used flavor globally, natural vanillin production from vanilla beans accounts for only 1% of global demand. The remaining 99% is fulfilled by synthetic vanillin, with approximately 85% derived from petrochemical precursors like catechol. 
This heavy reliance on petrochemical sources not only conflicts with consumer and industry sustainability goals but also increases the carbon footprint associated with vanillin production. Consequently, there is an urgent need to develop scalable, eco-friendly methods for producing natural vanillin. Closing this production gap offers a significant opportunity to reduce petrochemical dependence, meet shifting consumer preferences, and advance sustainability in the flavors and fragrance industry.
column30:
The flavors and fragrance industry faces a significant challenge in meeting the rising demand for natural vanillin, a demand driven by consumer preference for healthier, sustainably sourced ingredients with minimal environmental impact. Despite vanilla being the most widely used flavor globally, natural vanillin production from vanilla beans accounts for only 1% of global demand. The remaining 99% is fulfilled by synthetic vanillin, with approximately 85% derived from petrochemical precursors like catechol. 
This heavy reliance on petrochemical sources not only conflicts with consumer and industry sustainability goals but also increases the carbon footprint associated with vanillin production. Consequently, there is an urgent need to develop scalable, eco-friendly methods for producing natural vanillin. Closing this production gap offers a significant opportunity to reduce petrochemical dependence, meet shifting consumer preferences, and advance sustainability in the flavors and fragrance industry.
column31: Our innovative solution at Biofound focuses on providing a sustainable and cost-effective alternative for natural vanillin production, addressing the growing demand for eco-friendly and high-quality vanilla flavors in industries like food, beverage, and cosmetics. We achieve this by bioconverting agricultural waste like rice straw and wheat straw into natural vanillin through engineered microbes. These microbes are specifically evolved for enhanced resistance to stressors encountered during fermentation, ensuring high performance under industrial-scale conditions.
column32: Our primary target customers include industries that require natural flavoring agents, specifically the food, beverage, and cosmetics sectors, which are increasingly seeking sustainable and natural alternatives to synthetic vanillin and traditional vanilla. Additionally, we are targeting companies looking for eco-friendly solutions, including synthetic vanilla manufacturers seeking natural alternatives to enhance their product offerings.
column40: Conjugation Mediated Bacterial Genome Mixing (CoMBacGeMi) is a technique developed to enable the exchange of genetic material between bacterial strains, in a manner that simulates the process occurring in the wild. CoMBacGeMi aims to elucidate the molecular basis of functional diversity observed in medically significant bacterial species, such as Escherichia coli. The method employs a library of strains, each harboring a conjugative plasmid integrated at a random position in the genome. In this study, we employed CoMBacGeMi to investigate the effect of a mutant matP recipient on the bias in recombination frequency observed at the terminus. Analysis of the pools revealed that MatP does not significantly regulate the recombination pattern. To go beyond a single locus and to investigate the recombination pattern across the entire genome, we utilized the Hfr library and the recipient tse2 library. Our results revealed that the recombination frequencies across the genome were non-uniform, with regions such as the Ter macrodomain exhibiting low recombination frequencies. Additionally, we observed that the conjugation efficiencies of recipient clones were related to the position of the loci of selection in the genome. Lastly, we tested the ability of CoMBacGeMi to identify specific targets of selection. Analysis of the pools enabled us to identify, with precision, the three distinct insertion positions of tse2 in the three tested clones. Our results demonstrate that CoMBacGeMi is a simple, precise, and accurate method with the potential to identify key genetic loci and provide insight into the complexities of genetic traits in diverse bacterial populations.
column41: We focus on using abundant Indian agricultural residues as feedstocks to produce natural vanillin through a novel bioprocess. Our approach combines sustainability with industrial scalability, offering an eco-friendly alternative to synthetic, petrochemical-derived vanillin that other companies have yet to develop locally.

column20: Urban Harvest transforms unused rooftops into green sanctuaries. We create calming corporate gardens, aesthetic home kits, and empower Tier-3 housewives with free kits and buy-back programs, building a greener and more inclusive future.
column29:
Three major problems in cities are stressful jobs, expensive organic food, and a lack of job opportunities for women in smaller towns.

 Companies have a hard time meeting their sustainability goals and giving their employees healthier, greener spaces.  Employees work in concrete offices that are bad for their mental health and the air quality.

 Middle-class families in cities want their homes to have affordable organic food and nice green spaces, but the rooftop gardens that are available now are too expensive, too hard to care for, or not reliable.

 At the same time, millions of housewives in Tier-3 cities are stuck at home with no steady jobs, even though they have rooftops and time on their hands.

 Urban Harvest fixes all three problems in one place.  We build rooftop gardens for businesses to improve the health and appearance of their employees.  We sell families DIY smart kits that help them make beautiful gardens that don't need much care.  And most importantly, we give housewives free kits, training, and a guarantee that we will buy back their produce. This turns rooftops into farms that make money.

 This way, we can address wellness, sustainability, and women's empowerment all at once with one solution.
column30:

We sell families DIY smart kits that help them make beautiful gardens that don't need much care.  And most importantly, we give housewives free kits, training, and a guarantee that we will buy back their produce. This turns rooftops into farms that make money.

 This way, we can address wellness, sustainability, and women's empowerment all at once with one solution.
column31:
Urban Harvest is a rooftop farming ecosystem that combines beauty, health, and empowerment in three ways.  We build and care for rooftop gardens for businesses that turn conference rooms and cafeterias into green havens. This improves air quality, calms employees, and fits with sustainability goals.  We offer DIY smart kits that make it easy for families to set up beautiful, low-maintenance rooftop or balcony gardens that can be used as both a source of fresh produce and home decor.

 But the main part of our solution is giving Tier-3 housewives more power.  We give them free garden kits, easy training, and most importantly, we promise to buy back what they grow.  This turns empty rooftops into small farms and stay-at-home moms into people who make money.

 Urban Harvest makes a circular ecosystem by putting these three layers together. This makes spaces greener and healthier for businesses and families, and it gives women jobs and respect.
column32:
Our main clients are businesses that want to make their workplaces more environmentally friendly in order to improve employee health and reach their ESG goals.  As part of their efforts to be more environmentally friendly and healthy, they put money into rooftop gardens.

 We also sell to middle-class families in Tier-1 and Tier-2 cities who want to bring nature into their homes in a cheap, easy way while enjoying fresh herbs and vegetables.

 Our ecosystem helps housewives in Tier-3 cities in an indirect way.  They aren't direct buyers, but they become important partners when we give them kits through corporate sponsorships and set up a steady supply chain for produce.

 This model with many sides makes sure that there is always demand: companies buy for health, families buy for lifestyle, and housewives make money by supplying.  They work together to create a marketplace for green living that can grow and support itself.
column40:
ResQ: A Smart Ambulance Preemption System
 ResQ is an Internet of Things (IoT) solution that helps ambulances get through traffic signals faster.  There is a GPS tracker in the ambulance that talks to a central server over a secure private 5G line.  The server checks the ambulance's location within a set geofence as it gets closer to a traffic light. It then automatically sends instructions to the smart microcontroller that is built into the traffic light controller.  This makes sure that the signal turns green for the ambulance route, which speeds up emergency response.  The system also lets drivers confirm their actions through encrypted messaging, which makes it both safe and reliable. It also works with traffic lights that are already in place without needing expensive upgrades to the infrastructure.
column41:
Most companies that do rooftop gardening see it as either a product business (selling kits) or a service business (installing gardens for businesses).  What they don't get is that green spaces aren't just about plants; they're also about health, beauty, and giving people power.

 We see things differently when we say that rooftops can become a triple-impact ecosystem:

 For businesses, it's not about making food; it's about health, oxygen, and making workspaces that make people feel good.

 For families, it's not about farming; it's about having a pretty, low-maintenance green space that makes homegrown food look good and makes people trust it.

 For housewives, it's not just a hobby; it's a way to make money, and buy-back means they don't have to worry about markets or logistics.

 No other company has put together a single scalable model that combines wellness, beauty, and women's empowerment in this way.  That's what sets us apart.

Key Features

Stops digital payment frauds

column29:
1) Over 2 Billion people globally are micronutrient deficient. In India itself, 61%, 54%, 53% and 37% people are deficient in Vitamin D, Iron, Vitamin B12 and Folic Acid. There's no single district in India which is unaffected by anemia.
2) A shift in Indian dietary patterns, driven by urbanization, processed food consumption, and lifestyle changes, is leading to an increase in micronutrient deficiencies and other nutritional imbalances.
3) The urban population in India exhibits higher prevalence of micronutrient deficiencies compared to rural populations, especially in Iron and Vitamin B12.
4) ‚ÄòHealthy‚Äô Snacks Often Lack True Nutrition.
      Today's "healthy" snack bar market often misleads health-conscious consumers. It tends to focus on isolated proteins rather than holistic nutrition, frequently masking poor ingredient quality with artificial additives, which ultimately offers little benefit to gut health or overall well-being.
5) The market is saturated with high protein products, with no brand focusing on the micronutrients crisis in the Indian population, and there is lack of innovation and deep-tech inclusion in the ready-to-eat products in the market.
