column31:
We have developed India's first Pre+Probiotics enriched Nutri Bar rich in Vitamin B12, Vitamin D, Iron, Folic acid, dietary fiber and protein.
We use latest Bio-fermentation technology to infuse a proprietary vegan probiotic bacteria (a rich source of Vitamin B12 and promotes gut health) in our product.
Our unique formulation methodology also supports sustainability and circular economy as our raw materials include seeds, nuts and up-cycled edible by-products. 
Apart from micronutrients, our 1 bar of 35gm offers 8g of protein with complete amino acid profile and high PDCAAS score of 1/1 according to our lab scale tests.
Our 2nd offering is Aroma√© Minis, a bite-sized chocolate rich in dietary fiber, supporting gut microbiome. Made with vegan ingredients, its a new generation of chocolate with exceptional health benefits and an great taste. It is also infused with upcycled edible by-products, supporting sustainability. 
Aroma√©‚Äôs main focus is to identify and cater the critical nutritional gaps specifically in the Indian Population. Being students of NIFTEM, we are a perfect Founder-Market-Fit and have molecular level expertise in Food science and technology. Our vision is to revolutionize snacking in India. We are currently at TRL: Level 7 and BRL: Level 5.
Watch our video: https://youtu.be/OlfVGgnEgJ4
column32:
Health and wellness is a part of everyone's life. Hence, Aroma√©'s products are made for everyone. However, we believe that targeting specific consumers and getting feedback from them to constantly improve our products and understand the market is a more viable path for us to walk upon. Henceforth, we have divided our targeted consumer segment into three:
1) Fitness & Wellness enthusiasts (Aged between 18-35).
2) Health Conscious young professionals (Aged between 18-35 years).
3) Parents, especially Mothers (Aged between 28-45 years).
Once we get enough traction in these segments, we will move forward to more channels such as Malls, Pharmacies and Corporates, increasing our consumer base.
column40: Our CPO, Nitish Kumar worked on fruit based functional gummies fortified with vitamin A and D2. The vitamins were extracted by mushrooms for fortification, as a sustainable source. The extraction was done using advanced processing method followed by High Precision HPLC purification. We obtained a clean and sustainable source of Vitamin D2, suitable for food fortification. Further, we replaced refined sugar with FOS (a natural prebiotic fiber) and Monkfruit extract, creating a product with low calories and gut friendly benefits.
column41:
We are second year students from the National Institute of Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management, Kundli (NIFTEM-K), which is India's premiere institute for food processing technology. This not only makes us a Founder-Market Fit but also sets us apart from other founders in the same domain. We study Food and Nutrition at its molecular level and apply our knowledge practically in the cutting-edge infrastructure available in our campus. This has helped us to identify critical gaps in nutrition in the Indian population and develop formulations and conduct NPD. 
Let me be very truthful, new technologies are developed in our campus every now and then but either it is acquired by giant companies via technology transfer, or kept in dusty files forever. We are the first changemakers to develop our own technology driven product and bring it to the market to cater the masses. We have shown several POCs as our idea was selected in the TOP 100 out of 15000+ teams at College Youth Ideathon 2025 organized at IIT Delhi. We were also selected as the youngest group of exhibitors and pitchers at SUFALAM 2025 organized by MoFPI. Now we are set to showcase our innovative products at WFI 2025.

column20: AI inventory system for textile accessories
column29: Textile traders rely on chart papers and physical files for inventory tracking, leading to frequent data inconsistencies and loss of interest in maintaining accurate stock levels. Products like lace and buttons lack specific naming structures or branding, making them impossible to manage with traditional ERP systems. Traders spend hours searching for specific products or similar alternatives, reducing productivity and missing sales opportunities. Poor inventory management leads to stockouts, overstocking, and inability to fulfill customer requirements efficiently.

column31:
AI-Powered Visual Search
Revolutionary image-based search technology that identifies products instantly, eliminating naming convention dependencies.

Complete Digital Transformation
Replace paper-based systems with an intuitive digital platform that automatically updates inventory and maintains engagement.

Find exact requirements or similar options from manufacturers in seconds, not hours, dramatically improving efficiency.

column32:
Target Customer: Small to medium textile accessories traders in India managing buttons, lace, zippers, and trims with 5-50 employees and ‚Çπ1L+ monthly revenue.

Unique Insight: These traders are trapped using outdated paper-based systems because traditional ERPs can't handle their unstructured, visual-dependent inventory. Unlike branded products, textile accessories lack standardized naming conventions - a button is identified by color, size, design, not SKU codes. They need visual search, not text-based systems.

column41: Textile accessories are fundamentally visual products, not data products. While other companies try to force-fit traditional ERP logic with SKUs and categories. The industry's resistance to digital adoption isn't about being "traditional", it's because no existing system matches their mental model. They need to search by visual similarity, not rigid hierarchies. This insight led us to build AI-powered visual search first, making digitization feel natural rather than forced.

column29: The problem which we are trying to solve is the absence of a device to diagnose the presence of Micro plastics in Women at an early stage, among the people. Thus, it requires rapid diagnosis and treatment to save infant‚Äôs health and maintain nutrition efficiently.
column30:
As per recent survey, 67,385 babies are born in India. Over 0.3 million children are dying each year below the age of 5 due to complications in baby‚Äôs development. One of the major reasons for the above problem is Micro plastic particles. Micro plastic particles are formed on both sides of the human placenta (maternal and fetal). Baby‚Äôs development is affected before due to the presence of Micro plastics in placenta and after birth due to the presence of Micro plastics in breast milk. Micro plastics get accumulated in kidneys, liver and gut which induces disturbance of energy, lipid metabolism and oxidative stress and cancer in babies.
The reasons for the above problem are:
ÔÅ∂	Lack of awareness about the onset of symptoms of such health complications due to Micro plastics
ÔÅ∂	Lack of awareness about the Grade of plastics used everyday
ÔÅ∂	Lack of diagnostic practices and appropriate treatment
The problem statement is ‚Äúthe absence of a device to diagnose the presence of Micro plastics in Women at an early stage‚Äù.

column20: Einya Technologies is a deep-tech startup developing Disha AI, a wearable AI voice companion for the visually impaired. By combining computer vision, sensor fusion, and natural language processing, it offers 360¬∞ environmental awareness, real-time guidance, and social interaction support, empowering independence, safety, and inclusion for millions worldwide.

column29:
Visually impaired individuals face daily struggles in navigating safely, identifying objects, and engaging in social interactions, which significantly reduces their independence and quality of life. Mobility challenges often lead to accidents, reliance on others, and restricted access to education, employment, and public spaces. Current assistive technologies, such as smart canes, vision glasses, or mobile apps, provide only fragmented solutions‚Äîoffering limited obstacle detection, partial navigation support, or basic object recognition. These tools lack comprehensive environmental awareness, personalization, and contextual guidance, leaving critical gaps in safety, usability, and inclusivity.

Our startup addresses this problem by developing Disha AI, a holistic wearable solution that integrates 360¬∞ environmental sensing, AI-powered object and facial recognition, real-time navigation, and conversational voice interaction. Unlike existing devices, Disha AI learns user habits, adapts to individual needs, and provides proactive assistance. By bridging these gaps, we aim to significantly enhance independence, safety, and confidence for visually impaired individuals, enabling them to live fuller, more connected lives.
column30:
Visually impaired individuals face immense challenges in their daily lives, primarily in safe navigation, obstacle detection, and social interaction. These difficulties often result in reduced independence, safety risks, and reliance on others for basic mobility. For example, navigating crowded streets, identifying familiar faces, or detecting potential hazards can become overwhelming and dangerous. This not only affects personal freedom but also restricts access to education, employment, and social participation, leading to exclusion from mainstream society.

Existing assistive tools like smart canes, vision glasses, or mobile apps provide only fragmented solutions, offering limited obstacle sensing, basic navigation, or object recognition. They often lack personalization, contextual awareness, and comprehensive support, making them insufficient for addressing the real needs of visually impaired individuals. Moreover, many of these solutions are expensive, bulky, or reliant on constant internet connectivity, further limiting accessibility.

Our startup aims to solve this by developing Disha AI, a wearable companion that integrates 360¬∞ multi-camera coverage, AI-powered recognition, and conversational voice interaction to provide holistic support. By offering real-time navigation, personalized guidance, and social interaction support in an affordable and user-friendly design, we strive to bridge the critical gap in assistive technology and empower visually impaired individuals with safety, independence, and confidence.
column31:
Our unique solution, Disha AI, is a wearable AI-powered companion that empowers visually impaired individuals with independence, safety, and social inclusion. Unlike existing fragmented tools such as smart canes or vision glasses, Disha AI provides a comprehensive solution by combining multiple technologies into a single device.

It uses 360¬∞ multi-camera coverage, depth sensors, and AI-driven computer vision to capture and interpret the environment in real time. The system identifies objects, obstacles, and faces, while also mapping spatial relationships to enhance environmental awareness. This is communicated to the user through a friendly, conversational voice interface, offering real-time and context-aware guidance rather than simple alerts.

A key differentiator is Disha‚Äôs ability to learn user habits and preferences, providing personalized support that evolves over time. Designed to work both online and offline, Disha AI ensures reliability, affordability, and ease of use, making it a holistic innovation for the visually impaired.
column32:
We are selling to both end users (visually impaired individuals) and institutional partners who support them. Our primary customers are visually impaired individuals seeking greater independence, safety, and confidence in their daily lives. According to the WHO, over 2.2 billion people globally live with some form of vision impairment, with around 550 million in India alone, making this a large and growing market.

In addition to individual users, we will target NGOs, rehabilitation centers, government welfare programs, and educational institutions that support accessibility initiatives for the visually impaired. These organizations can act as key distribution channels, helping us reach beneficiaries more effectively. We also plan to collaborate with corporate CSR programs that invest in assistive technologies for social impact.

By addressing both direct consumers and institutional buyers, we ensure scalable adoption, while keeping affordability at the core, making Disha AI accessible to a wide segment of the market.
column40: One of our team members successfully developed a Plant Disease Detection System using AI, Machine Learning, and Computer Vision. The project focused on identifying plant leaf diseases through image recognition, helping farmers detect issues early and reduce crop losses. By training deep learning models on large datasets of leaf images, the system could accurately classify diseases and recommend possible treatments. This solution showcased the application of AI for solving real-world agricultural problems, improving productivity and sustainability. The experience gained in building end-to-end AI solutions, from dataset creation to model deployment, now contributes directly to developing Disha AI with advanced computer vision and real-time detection capabilities.
column41:
What we understand about our business that others often overlook is that visually impaired individuals need more than just obstacle detection‚Äîthey need a holistic, human-like companion. Most existing solutions focus narrowly on navigation or basic object recognition, offering fragmented support.

We recognize that the real challenge is not only mobility but also social inclusion, independence, and contextual understanding. Disha AI goes beyond being a tool; it acts as a friendly, adaptive companion that learns user habits, recognizes familiar faces, and proactively guides them through daily tasks.

We also deeply understand the importance of affordability, offline functionality, and comfort in design‚Äîfactors often neglected by competitors. By keeping accessibility and user experience at the core, we are building a solution that truly integrates into the lives of the visually impaired, rather than just assisting them in isolated tasks.

column20: Our project idea solves the problem of the absence of a device to diagnose heart disease at an early stage. PACDOC CARDIO TROPHY is a portable diagnostic device to detect the major biomarkers of heart ailments via. Urine & Blood sample analysis, ie., a Non-Invasive method & Invasive method.
column29:
Globally, nearly 17.90 million people died of cardiovascular disease in 2019, which reflects a 17.1% increase over the past decade. One in 4 deaths in India are because of CVDs with ischemic heart disease and stroke. Heart attacks and cardiac arrest are the major causes for increased death rates without rapid and adequate treatment in an emergency. 
The problem which we are trying to solve is the absence of a device to diagnose heart disease at an early stage, among the people with risk of heart attack and other heart problems. Acute Myocardial Infarction (AMI) is strongly related to heart attacks and cardiac arrest, whose death rate increases without rapid and adequate treatment in an emergency. Thus, AMI requires rapid diagnosis and treatment to save a patient‚Äôs life efficiently.
PAIN POINT THAT WE ADDRESS:
The rapidly increasing death rate due to heart attacks without adequate and rapid treatment at the right time, as the symptoms are being unnoticed is the pain point that we are addressing.
column30:

The problem which we are trying to solve is the absence of a device to diagnose heart disease at an early stage, among the people with risk of heart attack and other heart problems. column31:
Our product PAC DOC CARDIO TROPHY is a Point of Care diagnostic device to detect the level of proteins and other components which are biomarkers of cardiovascular diseases through urine analysis and blood analysis.
Our product PAC DOC CARDIO TROPHY offers a Quantitative analysis of the biomarker which is being analysed. It also offers a unique value proposition by showing the presence & level of the biomarker (Troponin I) via. Parameters of Low, Medium and High. We also give directions of the steps to do next based on the levels shown in the diagnostic device via. our instruction kit, to ensure timely treatment and to make them precautious about their heart health.
column32:
The target customers of our product are:
ÔÉº	Diabetes (High risk of getting heart attack)
ÔÉº	 Lipid Disorder (High Cholesterol)
ÔÉº	 Genetic disorders
ÔÉº	 Symptoms of : Pain in the left side of the body, Chest pain, Abnormal swelling of legs
ÔÉº	 All people in common (Drivers, Loco pilots, BP patients)

The abovesaid category of people would be the beneficiary of this innovation as the people would be precautious about their health conditions to avoid adverse conditions and death due to heart ailments.

The existing technologies in the market are Imaging technologies, ECG and usage of blood samples for in labs and diagnostic centres. Other kits available in the market are My Test Tropnin I, OnSite Rapid Test Kit and Recombigen Troponin-I Test Card which offers a qualitative analysis of the biomarker which is being analysed.

Quantitative Analysis using Urine sample & blood sample

Patients report can be taken via. Mobile app

column20: Batteryless wireless IoT sensors with energy harvesting
column29:
Most IoT solutions today depend on either batteries or wiring. At small scale this is manageable, but at industrial or infrastructure scale, battery replacement and wiring costs become a nightmare. Batteries fail within months or a few years, leading to high maintenance overheads, downtime, and waste. Wiring retrofits are expensive, disruptive, and often impractical in large facilities, warehouses, or remote environments.

Jouleless is solving this by building batteryless, wireless IoT sensors powered by ambient energy sources like indoor solar and RF. Our sensors harvest energy continuously from the environment, eliminating the need for battery replacement or complex wiring. This makes them maintenance-free, scalable, and sustainable.

The problem we are addressing is two-fold:

Scalability bottleneck ‚Äì current IoT deployments cannot scale affordably due to maintenance and service overheads.

Sustainability gap ‚Äì billions of IoT batteries end up as e-waste every year.

By removing batteries and wiring from the equation, Jouleless enables businesses to deploy IoT at scale for applications like HVAC efficiency, cold chain monitoring, industrial safety, and smart infrastructure. This solves a major cost, reliability, and sustainability challenge in IoT adoption.

Our sensors harvest energy continuously from the environment, eliminating the need for battery replacement or complex wiring. This makes them maintenance-free, scalable, and sustainable.

The problem we are addressing is two-fold:

Scalability bottleneck ‚Äì current IoT deployments cannot scale affordably due to maintenance and service overheads.

Sustainability gap ‚Äì billions of IoT batteries end up as e-waste every year.

By removing batteries and wiring from the equation, Jouleless enables businesses to deploy IoT at scale for applications like HVAC efficiency, cold chain monitoring, industrial safety, and smart infrastructure. This solves a major cost, reliability, and sustainability challenge in IoT adoption.
column31:
Our unique solution is a new class of batteryless, wireless IoT sensors that run entirely on ambient energy harvesting by using indoor solar, RF, and other sources. Unlike conventional IoT devices that rely on disposable batteries or costly wiring, our sensors are designed to be self-powered, maintenance-free, and scalable.

At the hardware level, we integrate indoor photovoltaic panels, energy-harvesting PMICs, and supercapacitor storage with ultra-low-power microcontrollers. These nodes collect environmental data (temperature, humidity, air quality, CO‚ÇÇ) and transmit wirelessly over BLE to a gateway, which pushes data to the cloud. For reliability, we also offer optional fallback modules such as GSM for remote sites.

This design removes the need for periodic servicing, dramatically reduces total cost of ownership, and eliminates battery e-waste. It enables deployments in locations where power and maintenance access are limited, making IoT practical for industrial, commercial, and infrastructure-scale applications.

The uniqueness lies in our system-level co-design of power, communication, and sensing, optimized specifically for energy-harvested operation, which existing battery-powered solutions cannot replicate.
column32:
We are selling to enterprises and operators in sectors where large-scale sensing is critical but maintenance is a bottleneck. Our primary target customers include:

HVAC and building management companies that need real-time temperature and humidity monitoring for energy-efficient operations without costly wiring or battery replacements.

Cold chain logistics providers in pharma and food, who require continuous temperature traceability in warehouses, trucks, and storage rooms where servicing sensors is impractical.

Industrial facilities such as chemical plants, where gas and environmental monitoring is essential for safety but traditional sensors are difficult to maintain.

In the longer term, we see significant opportunity in retail and CPG, where billions of items and shelves can be instrumented using ambient IoT, unlocking data-driven insights across supply chains.

Our customers value low total cost of ownership, reliability, and sustainability. By eliminating batteries and wiring, we enable them to scale IoT deployments that were previously infeasible.

column40: Naman designed and optimized printed circuit boards (PCBs) for drone components using Altium Designer, with a focus on improving signal integrity and reducing the inertial measurement unit (IMU) surface area by 15%. As part of this work, he developed a 4-layer flight management unit (FMU) PCB and engineered flexible PCB connections to integrate the IMU and FMU, resulting in a more compact design and enhanced overall system performance.
column41:
Most IoT companies see sensors as disposable hardware, either wired or battery-powered, and treat maintenance as an unavoidable cost. We believe this is the wrong starting point. The real barrier to IoT at scale isn‚Äôt connectivity or sensor accuracy, it‚Äôs the hidden O&M costs of replacing millions of batteries and maintaining complex wiring.

What we understand is that true scalability in IoT is only possible if sensors are maintenance-free. By designing our systems to run entirely on ambient energy from the ground up, we‚Äôre addressing this bottleneck directly rather than layering software or analytics on top of fragile hardware.

This perspective also changes how we design: our hardware, firmware, and communication protocols are co-optimized for energy harvesting. Competing solutions typically retrofit existing devices with ‚Äúlow-power modes‚Äù or bigger batteries, which only delays the maintenance problem.

We see batteryless operation not as a niche but as the foundation for the next wave of IoT, especially in sectors like HVAC, cold chain, and retail where data is valuable but deployment costs have blocked adoption. That conviction sets us apart from companies treating sustainability as an afterthought rather than a design principle.

column29:
In today‚Äôs fast-moving world most wellness tools are siloed and one-dimensional: apps tend to focus narrowly on either fitness, nutrition, or meditation and deliver generic plans that don‚Äôt adapt to each user‚Äôs life. The result is fragmented experiences, high friction for users (too many apps, too much manual input), and limited long-term impact because recommendations aren‚Äôt personalized, contextual, or coordinated across domains.

Wearables collect rich health data, but that data often lives in separate silos and produces surface-level insights‚Äîstep counts, heart-rate trends, or sleep summaries‚Äîwithout clear, actionable guidance. Notifications are generic, coaching is reactive rather than proactively tailored, and the ecosystem lacks a unified brain that translates signals into practical, day-by-day routines.

column31:
Aiyuh (platform)
Aiyuh is a holistic wellness platform that blends fitness, mindfulness, and nutrition into a single, personalized experience managed by an intelligent AI Agent. The system learns from your habits, preferences, wearable data, and daily check-ins to deliver adaptive workout plans, short mindfulness sessions, and meal suggestions that fit your schedule and goals. Instead of siloed apps, Aiyuh provides coordinated, context-aware routines and timely recommendations to make healthy living simple, practical, and sustainable.

Aiyuh One (wearable)
Aiyuh One is an AI-powered smartwatch that combines advanced sensors with on-device intelligence to provide real-time, personalized guidance. Unlike generic wearables that only report metrics, Aiyuh One actively adapts recommendations based on your individual physiology, daily rhythms, and emotional state‚Äîusing heart-rate variability, sleep, activity, and breath signals to suggest the right exercise, recovery, or mindfulness practice at the right moment.

column19: Altiora Innovations ‚Äî Driving Innovation, Ensuring Safety.
column20: Altiora Innovations is a forward-thinking technology startup focused on building AI-driven solutions for smarter, safer cities. Our flagship product transforms everyday dashcam footage into actionable traffic violation reports, empowering citizens, supporting authorities, and enhancing road safety. With a privacy-first, gamified, and scalable approach, we aim to create impactful innovations for today and the future.
column29:
We are tackling the problem of unsafe roads caused by rampant traffic violations, which are a major cause of accidents and fatalities in India. Current enforcement methods, such as speed cameras and government monitoring, are expensive to install and maintain, have limited coverage, and are often bypassed by violators. These systems rarely extend to rural or semi-urban areas, leaving large segments of the population without proper traffic oversight.
At the same time, millions of vehicles already have dashcams installed, capturing continuous footage of the road. However, this data is underutilized and does not contribute effectively to traffic law enforcement. Our solution addresses this gap by empowering citizens to safely and anonymously report traffic violations using their dashcam recordings.
By leveraging dashcam footage, we create a crowdsourced enforcement system that significantly expands coverage beyond traditional cameras. The system ensures privacy and safety by blurring driver faces and allowing only verified uploads with GPS and timestamp metadata. This approach increases accountability, helps authorities take action on violations, and ultimately contributes to safer roads for everyone. By turning everyday drivers into active participants in road safety, we aim to reduce accidents, save lives, and build a culture of responsible driving across India.
column30:

By turning everyday drivers into active participants in road safety, we aim to reduce accidents, save lives, and build a culture of responsible driving across India.
column31:
We are addressing the problem of unsafe roads caused by widespread traffic violations, which are a major contributor to accidents in India. Existing enforcement methods, such as speed cameras and government surveillance, are expensive, have limited coverage, and often fail to reach rural or semi-urban areas. Meanwhile, millions of vehicles already have dashcams installed, but this valuable footage remains largely untapped for reporting violations.
Our solution leverages this existing infrastructure by empowering citizens to safely and anonymously report traffic violations using dashcam recordings. The platform is designed to support both cloud-enabled dashcams and mobile app-paired devices, allowing automatic or user-assisted uploads with GPS and timestamp metadata to ensure authenticity. AI-powered algorithms detect violations such as over-speeding, signal jumping, and helmet non-compliance, filtering false positives before human verification by authorities.
What makes our solution unique is the combination of safety, legality, and engagement: users never need to record while driving, privacy is preserved through face-blurring, and gamification elements such as points, badges, and leaderboards encourage participation. By crowdsourcing enforcement, we create wider coverage, enhance accountability, and provide law enforcement with verified evidence, ultimately contributing to safer roads for everyone.
column32:
We are primarily selling our solution to dashcam manufacturers and automotive companies, providing them with integrated software that enables citizen-driven traffic violation reporting. With millions of vehicles increasingly expected to come equipped with dashcams, manufacturers can differentiate their products by offering AI-powered, privacy-first, and gamified enforcement features pre-installed in vehicles or bundled with dashcam devices.
By partnering with automotive OEMs and car dealers, we can ensure our solution reaches end users indirectly; drivers benefit from enhanced road safety features while manufacturers gain a marketable, socially impactful product. Our platform supports both cloud-enabled and mobile app-paired dashcams, making it adaptable to a variety of hardware.
Gamification and rewards for verified reporting not only engage drivers but also increase adoption, creating a virtuous cycle of user participation and data collection. For authorities, the platform provides verified evidence and dashboards for enforcement, which adds credibility and regulatory compliance.
Ultimately, we are enabling a B2B2C model: we provide dashcam and automotive partners with the software tools to enhance their offerings, while drivers, cities, and law enforcement indirectly benefit from safer roads and wider coverage.
column36: We are seeking an initial investment of ‚Çπ2‚Äì5 lakhs to develop a working prototype, integrate AI-powered violation detection, and set up a pilot deployment with select dashcams. The funding will also support basic legal compliance, gamification features, and initial testing in select cities to validate the platform and demonstrate feasibility for future scaling.
column40:
Project Name: Alumni Attendance Predictor ‚Äì Workforce Optimization Tool
Description:
Our team collectively developed a Node.js + Express-based system to predict attendance for alumni events and optimize workforce planning. Using RSVP data, past attendance, and distance metrics, the platform recommended the required catering and seating staff, along with resources like chairs, meals, and parking, minimizing over- or under-staffing. A simple HTML frontend allowed easy alumni search by USN and visualization of predictions.
Outcome & Skills Demonstrated:
This project showcased our team‚Äôs ability to integrate data analysis, predictive modeling, and web development to solve real-world operational challenges. We collaboratively handled backend development, algorithm design, data processing, and frontend integration, demonstrating strong teamwork and technical skills. The experience reinforced our capacity to build scalable, data-driven solutions; skills we are now applying to our traffic violation reporting platform.
column41:
We understand that road safety enforcement in India cannot rely solely on traditional infrastructure like speed cameras, which are expensive, limited in coverage, and easily bypassed. Unlike other companies that focus on hardware or general dashcam apps, we see the untapped potential of existing dashcams as a crowdsourced enforcement tool. We recognize the importance of legality, privacy, and user engagement; ensuring drivers never record while driving, automatically blurring faces, and using gamification to sustain participation.
We also foresee a future where dashcams become standard in vehicles, making B2B partnerships with manufacturers and car dealers the key to scalable impact, rather than targeting end users directly. Most companies overlook this strategic approach, focusing either on consumer apps or surveillance hardware. By combining AI-powered violation detection, privacy-first design, gamified engagement, and B2B integration, we can create a platform that is practical, scalable, and culturally adapted for India, giving us an edge in both adoption and effectiveness.

column20: Upcycling Agro-Waste to Tree Free Specialty Papers
column29:
As per Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), India generates about 350 million tonnes of agricultural waste annually. 92 million tons of this waste is burned annually, contributing to air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions. Also, nearly 4 billion trees worldwide are cut down each year for paper.

Being an agrarian country, we generate numerous amounts of post harvest agricultural waste. In some cases farmers have to incur some cost to clean up the land before the next plantation, and they often end up burning it as well causing further environmental problems.
column30:
Conventional rigid boxes are made from virgin wood pulp or plastic laminates, both of which have high environmental impact. With e-commerce, luxury packaging, and FMCG sectors demanding eco-friendly alternatives, there exists a strong need for sustainable rigid packaging materials.

The global sustainable packaging market was valued around USD 329 billion in 2023, with a forecast to reach USD 518 billion by 2030 at a CAGR of 6.7%. While India's rigid packaging market was valued at USD 14.28 billion in 2025, with a forecast to reach USD 19.40 billion by 2030.
column31:
We are upcycling post harvest agricultural waste and making sustainable products like, rigid material & boxes for packaging and 100% tree free & chemical free papers for writing & printing. Our papers are suitable for all kinds of writing tools and inks, and do not bloat. Each ton of our paper save up to 24 trees from deforestation. Generating extra income to farmers for their agro-waste and preventing air pollution from burning.

We are making use of different varieties of agricultural waste and upcycling those through processes, evolved from our inhouse R&D.

We are submitting 5 patent applications in couple of weeks.

column20: Eco-paper from agro-waste, zero deforestation impact.
column29:
India's paper industry faces a critical sustainability crisis. Traditional paper production consumes over 20 million tonnes annually, heavily dependent on wood pulp causing severe deforestation and biodiversity loss. Paper mills are extremely water and energy-intensive, creating significant pollution and resource depletion.

Simultaneously, farmers burn agricultural waste after harvesting, contributing to severe air pollution that affects millions. This creates a dual environmental disaster - trees being cut for paper while valuable agricultural waste is burned, releasing harmful emissions.

MSMEs struggle to access affordable, sustainable raw materials, limiting their ability to innovate and adopt green practices. The current system creates a vicious cycle: environmental degradation, wasted agricultural resources, farmer income loss, and limited sustainable options for businesses seeking eco-friendly alternatives.
column30:
India's paper industry faces a critical sustainability crisis. Traditional paper production consumes over 20 million tonnes annually, heavily dependent on wood pulp causing severe deforestation and biodiversity loss. Paper mills are extremely water and energy-intensive, creating significant pollution and resource depletion.

Simultaneously, farmers burn agricultural waste after harvesting, contributing to severe air pollution that affects millions. This creates a dual environmental disaster - trees being cut for paper while valuable agricultural waste is burned, releasing harmful emissions.

MSMEs struggle to access affordable, sustainable raw materials, limiting their ability to innovate and adopt green practices. The current system creates a vicious cycle: environmental degradation, wasted agricultural resources, farmer income loss, and limited sustainable options for businesses seeking eco-friendly alternatives.
column31:
ReLeaf Innovations transforms agricultural waste into high-quality paper through decentralized micro-units. We use rice straw and fast-growing grasses (Napier, bamboo) as raw materials instead of trees, completely eliminating deforestation.

Our eco-friendly pulping process uses 40% less water and energy than traditional mills, employing enzyme-based methods rather than harmful chemicals. The entire process is zero-plastic, producing fully compostable, chemical-free paper.

Key differentiators include: decentralized manufacturing that empowers rural entrepreneurs, converting waste that would be burned into valuable income for farmers, and rapid production cycles since grasses regrow in 3-6 months versus 8-20 years for trees.

Our solution addresses multiple problems simultaneously - reduces air pollution by eliminating stubble burning, creates rural employment through micro paper units, provides MSMEs with affordable sustainable materials, and delivers eco-conscious brands the green packaging they need. This creates a circular economy model that benefits farmers, entrepreneurs, environment, and end customers.
column32:
Our primary customers are eco-conscious brands and startups seeking sustainable packaging materials, representing a growing market segment demanding green alternatives. These companies understand that consumers increasingly prefer environmentally responsible products and are willing to pay premium prices for sustainable packaging.

MSMEs and small printers in rural and urban areas form our second major segment. They need affordable, high-quality raw materials but often lack access to sustainable options. Our unique insight is that these businesses want to go green but need cost-effective solutions - our agro-waste paper costs less than traditional alternatives while being environmentally superior.

Government agencies and NGOs promoting sustainability represent our third segment, often requiring large volumes for educational materials and awareness campaigns. Educational institutions seeking to reduce their ecological footprint also present significant opportunities.

Our key insight is that customers don't just want eco-friendly products - they want solutions that don't compromise on quality or cost-effectiveness. Traditional "green" alternatives often come with trade-offs. Our customers appreciate that we eliminate these trade-offs by offering superior environmental benefits, competitive pricing, and comparable quality. They also value the social impact story - supporting rural farmers and reducing air pollution resonates strongly with their stakeholders and brand values.
column40: Light Travel Project ‚Äì One of our team members previously worked on an innovative concept called Light Travel, which explored the possibility of using the photoelectric effect and particle acceleration to enable futuristic transportation. The project proposed converting the body‚Äôs electrons into particles accelerated in a vacuum tube, powered by sunlight, to achieve ultra-fast, eco-friendly travel. It also explored applications such as interplanetary transport, instant object relocation, and sustainable delivery systems.
column41:
The paper industry's biggest blind spot is viewing agricultural waste as a disposal problem rather than a valuable resource. While competitors focus on recycling or marginal efficiency improvements, we recognized that India generates 600+ million tonnes of agricultural residue annually - enough to replace 60% of wood-based paper production.

Most companies don't understand the rural economic dynamics. Farmers lose ‚Çπ8,000-12,000 per acre disposing of crop residue, while paper mills pay ‚Çπ4,000-6,000 per tonne for wood pulp. We realized this creates a massive arbitrage opportunity - we can pay farmers ‚Çπ2,000 per tonne for waste, still undercutting wood pulp costs.

The decentralization insight is crucial. Traditional paper mills require massive capital and centralized operations. We discovered that micro-units near farms reduce transportation costs by 70%, create local employment, and make economics viable even at smaller scales. This distributed model also reduces environmental impact and creates resilient supply chains.

Finally, the timing advantage: government regulations increasingly favor sustainable alternatives, carbon credits are becoming valuable, and consumer preferences are shifting rapidly. Companies entering this space in 2-3 years will face higher raw material costs and established competition.

column20: Vegras is a trusted supplier of fresh raw fruits and vegetables directly to hotels and restaurants. We ensure quality, timely delivery, and farm-fresh produce that helps businesses maintain high standards. With Vegras, hotels get reliable supply chains and chefs get the best ingredients for their customers.
column29:
At Vegras, we are addressing multiple critical problems in the food supply chain for hotels and restaurants. One major issue is the inconsistency in raw material supply chefs and hotel owners often face delays, poor quality, or last-minute shortages that directly affect their service quality and customer satisfaction. We solve this by creating a reliable and transparent supply chain that delivers fresh produce on time, every time.
Another key problem is quality control. Hotels often struggle with vendors who provide mixed-grade vegetables and fruits, leading to wastage and customer complaints. Vegras solves this by sourcing directly from farmers, ensuring farm-fresh, hygienic, and high-quality produce that meets hospitality standards.
column30:
We also address the challenge of fluctuating prices. Seasonal variations and middlemen often increase costs, hurting hotels‚Äô budgets. With our streamlined model, Vegras eliminates unnecessary intermediaries, providing competitive and stable pricing.
Lastly, we are solving the problem of farmers not getting fair value. By connecting them directly to bulk buyers like hotels, we create a win-win situation where farmers earn more, and hotels get fresh produce at better rates. Vegras stands for trust, freshness, and efficiency in the supply ecosystem.
column31:
The uniqueness lies in our integrated model: we combine technology with logistics. Hotels can place bulk orders through our simple app/portal, track deliveries in real-time, and get assured quality checks before dispatch. Farmers, on the other side, are onboarded through our sourcing network, where we provide them with a guaranteed market and stable pricing.
By focusing on consistency, we solve the hotel industry‚Äôs biggest pain pointunpredictable supply and fluctuating prices. We also integrate AI-driven demand forecasting, which helps reduce wastage and ensures that farmers grow what the market needs most.
column32:
We are selling fresh, high-quality raw produce mainly vegetables, fruits, grains, and other essential kitchen supplies directly to hotels, restaurants, and catering services (HORECA industry). Our value proposition is not just the raw products but also the assurance of consistency, air pricing, and reliable delivery.
Our primary customers are hotels and restaurants that face daily challenges with raw material procurement. They need a dependable supplier who can guarantee quality, timely delivery, and stable prices. We cater to different segments of the hospitality industry, from budget hotels and small restaurants to premium hotels and large catering services.
column36: We are seeking an investment of 80 lakhs in exchange for equity, to scale Vegras into a leading raw supply platform for the hospitality sector.  The funds will be allocated as follows:  20% ‚Äì Technology Development (building and upgrading our platform/app for hotels & farmers, real-time tracking, and multilingual support).  30% ‚Äì Operations & Logistics (setting up storage, delivery fleet, strengthening supply chain efficiency and remaning 50 percent for marketing and hiring skilled personals.
column40: AgroVest is a digital platform that connects farmers directly with investors in a transparent, profit-sharing model. The concept works like a ‚Äústock market for agriculture‚Äù where investors fund farmers‚Äô crops, and at harvest, profits are shared 20% to the investor and 80% to the farmer.
column41:
What we understand about our business that others don‚Äôt is the deep pain points of both sides of the chain hotels and farmers. Most companies look at this market only as a logistics or trading opportunity, but Vegras understands that hotels don‚Äôt just need supplies, they need quality product with consistency, trust, and predictability. On the other side, farmers don‚Äôt just need buyers, they need fair pricing and a guaranteed market.
We know that hospitality businesses run on reputation if one delivery is late or one batch is poor in quality, the customer experience suffers. That‚Äôs why our solution is not just about moving produce, but about building reliability into the entire system. Similarly, we understand the farmer‚Äôs struggle of losing margins to middlemen and dealing with price fluctuations. By combining both insights, we designed Vegras as an ecosystem that benefits both parties equally.
Other companies may focus only on margins, but we focus on relationships, trust, and sustainability this is the unique depth of understanding that gives Vegras an edge.
column42:
‚ÄúBeyond capital, in what ways can you support Vegras‚Äîsuch as industry connections, strategic partnerships, or mentorship?‚Äù

‚ÄúBased on your experience, what challenges do you see for us in scaling a farm-to-hotel supply chain model?‚Äù

column20: Affordable prosthetics restoring mobility & hope
column29: We‚Äôre solving the problem of expensive prosthetics that are inaccessible to most people with limb loss, especially in low-income regions, by creating an affordable, functional myoelectric prosthesis.
column30: We‚Äôre solving the problem of expensive prosthetics that are inaccessible to most people with limb loss, especially in low-income regions, by creating an affordable, functional myoelectric prosthesis.
column31: We‚Äôre creating an affordable myoelectric prosthesis that uses EMG sensors and an ESP32 to turn muscle signals into natural hand movements, giving people with limb loss the ability to perform everyday tasks with ease. Built from lightweight, durable materials and designed to be modular for easy repairs or upgrades, it delivers the functionality of expensive prosthetics at a fraction of the cost. Our goal is simple ‚Äî to restore mobility, confidence, and independence to those who‚Äôve been left behind by high prices, and make advanced prosthetics accessible to everyone who needs them.
column32: We‚Äôre selling to people whose lives have been turned upside down by limb loss ‚Äî accident survivors, veterans, diabetic patients, children born with limb differences, and anyone who has lost a limb and can‚Äôt afford expensive prosthetics. These are individuals who want to work, play, and live independently but are held back by the high cost of existing solutions. We‚Äôre also reaching out to hospitals, rehabilitation centers, NGOs, and government programs that support amputees, especially in low-income and developing regions where access to advanced prosthetics is almost nonexistent. Our prosthesis gives them a chance to offer patients not just a tool, but a renewed sense of confidence and dignity. By keeping our design affordable, durable, and easy to maintain, we‚Äôre making it possible for families, healthcare providers, and aid organizations to give more people the freedom to move, work, and live life on their own terms. Ultimately, we‚Äôre not just selling a prosthetic ‚Äî we‚Äôre delivering hope and independence to those who‚Äôve been told that advanced mobility is beyond their reach.
column40: In my previous project, I developed a Search and Rescue Robot designed to operate in disaster-hit areas where it‚Äôs too dangerous for humans to go. It‚Äôs a small autonomous ground robot equipped with sensors, cameras, and AI-based obstacle avoidance to navigate debris and hazardous zones. It can detect survivors, send real-time information to rescue teams, and help them act faster while reducing risk to human life. The goal was to support organizations like the NDRF, defense forces, and NGOs in making rescue operations quicker and more efficient.
column41: I understand that in prosthetics, affordability without losing core functionality is the real game-changer. Many companies focus on adding more advanced features, which drives up costs and limits accessibility, especially in low-income regions. Our approach is different ‚Äî we prioritize essential functionality, modularity, and local production so that users can not only afford the prosthesis but also easily repair, upgrade, and keep using it for years. We‚Äôre not just selling a medical device; we‚Äôre building a sustainable, scalable solution that fits the realities of the people who need it most.

column20: DealPulse is an AI-driven venture intelligence platform that scores startups, maps founder networks, and flags risks in real time. VCs and LPs get transparent ratings, cohort benchmarks, and automated IC memos. Consolidating fragmented data into decisive insights, DealPulse accelerates diligence, improves hit rates, and standardizes portfolio monitoring across stages globally.
column29: VC teams face high volume but low signal. Critical inputs‚Äîfilings, hiring velocity, product/app reviews, traffic, news and social‚Äîsit in silos, forcing analysts to reconcile identifiers and clean data in spreadsheets. This slows initial screening and due-diligence, produces inconsistent IC write-ups, and misses warning signs (burn multiple spikes, stalled recruiting, governance flags). India/SEA adds complexity: multiple IDs per company, uneven data quality, and limited audit trails. Funds need a single, trusted layer that assembles reliable company records, highlights risks early, and standardizes how opportunities are graded‚Äîfast enough for top-of-funnel triage, rigorous enough for IC, and traceable for LPs.

This slows initial screening and due-diligence, produces inconsistent IC write-ups, and misses warning signs (burn multiple spikes, stalled recruiting, governance flags). India/SEA adds complexity: multiple IDs per company, uneven data quality, and limited audit trails. Funds need a single, trusted layer that assembles reliable company records, highlights risks early, and standardizes how opportunities are graded‚Äîfast enough for top-of-funnel triage, rigorous enough for IC, and traceable for LPs.
column31:
DealPulse unifies trusted sources into a clean company record, then supports both screening and DD. The platform:

1. Scores each company (0‚Äì100 / letter grade) with the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the score.
2. Surfaces red/amber/green risk flags and benchmark comps.
3. Auto-drafts IC notes with citations.
4. Provides an Investor Dashboard for watchlists, alerts, and portfolio health.
5. Offers integrations (Salesforce/HubSpot/Notion/Slack/API) for real workflow use.
6. Today, grades are explainable and auditable; next, we add a predictive model that estimates survival/scale and shows which actions move the score. 
Result: faster triage, tighter DD, and consistent, defensible decisions‚Äîwithout adding headcount.
column32: Primary customers: VC funds (seed‚ÄìSeries B) in India/SEA; also CVCs, family offices, and venture-debt teams. Users: partners (thesis fit, IC), associates/analysts (triage, DD), and ops/IR (monitoring, LP reporting). We land with a short pilot on a fund‚Äôs historical deals to prove time-to-IC and quality gains, then expand to seats and optional API access. Pricing: annual fund subscription with seat tiers and add-ons (API, premium data). Success is measured by faster screens, stronger IC memos, earlier risk detection, and consistent final grading across partners.
column40: I co-founded Bold Care and operated it from 2019‚Äì2024, building India‚Äôs leading men‚Äôs health brand. By FY25 we reached ‚Çπ100 Cr revenue and a ‚Çπ475 Cr valuation. I scaled supply-chain and CX to 98% on-time delivery across 150+ cities and 20,000+ PIN codes, cut COGS by ~25%, reduced RTO from ~35% to ~6%, and handled 5 lakh+ orders per month while launching 50+ SKUs. We raised ‚Çπ115 Cr+ from marquee investors and created a culture/brand flywheel‚Äîe.g., a viral campaign with co-founder Ranveer Singh and leading creators that won multiple marketing awards. I led a 100+ cross-functional team, secured #2 category ranks on quick-commerce, and was recognised in Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia for building the business.
column41: VCs don‚Äôt need another database‚Äîthey need a single, defensible decision layer. Our insight: usefulness equals (clean, linked data) √ó (transparent, back-tested scoring) √ó (seamless workflow fit). So we focus on (1) a reliable ETL spine that reconciles MCA, hiring, product, traction and news into one entity graph; (2) ratings that are explainable (why a score moved), benchmarked, and back-tested on known outcomes; (3) adoption that starts at screening, then expands to due-diligence, IC memos and portfolio/LP reporting; and (4) trust‚Äîpermissions, audit trails, DPDP/GDPR compliance, and human-in-the-loop overrides. Most tools stop at search or pretty dashboards; we‚Äôre purpose-built to compress weeks of manual work into hours while standardising judgment, so funds can review more deals, say ‚Äúno‚Äù faster, and build higher-conviction ‚Äúyeses.‚Äù

column29:
In modern cities, residents face two persistent challenges: limited space and the high cost of premium appliances. Products such as Dyson vacuums, PlayStations, or projectors are expensive to buy, occupy valuable space in compact homes, and are often underutilized when purchased. For many households, owning them does not make financial or practical sense.

Existing rental options fail to solve the issue effectively. Traditional rentals require deposits, involve delivery delays, and often provide poor-quality or poorly maintained items. This makes the process inconvenient, unreliable, and unsuitable for everyday needs.

UrbanNest solves this problem by creating shared access hubs inside residential communities. Through IoT-enabled smart fixtures, residents can instantly book, pay, and unlock premium appliances using a mobile app, with secure digital locks ensuring trust and accountability. Instead of bearing the burden of ownership, residents gain on-demand access to high-quality products whenever needed.

This approach removes the barriers of cost, storage, and inconvenience, while also promoting sustainability through shared consumption. UrbanNest transforms access to premium appliances into a seamless, affordable, and eco-friendly experience, tailored for today‚Äôs urban lifestyle.

UrbanNest solves this problem by creating shared access hubs inside residential communities. Through IoT-enabled smart fixtures, residents can instantly book, pay, and unlock premium appliances using a mobile app, with secure digital locks ensuring trust and accountability. Instead of bearing the burden of ownership, residents gain on-demand access to high-quality products whenever needed.

This approach removes the barriers of cost, storage, and inconvenience, while also promoting sustainability through shared consumption. UrbanNest transforms access to premium appliances into a seamless, affordable, and eco-friendly experience, tailored for today‚Äôs urban lifestyle.
column31:
UrbanNest offers a unique, tech-enabled rental solution that integrates directly into residential communities. Instead of relying on traditional rental models that involve deliveries, deposits, and delays, we install IoT-enabled smart fixtures within societies that securely house premium appliances such as Dyson vacuums, gaming consoles, and projectors.

Through the UrbanNest mobile app, residents can view availability, book instantly, pay seamlessly, and unlock devices with a tap. Each fixture is equipped with a smart lock system, ensuring only authorized users can access the appliance, and it automatically re-locks after use. This creates a frictionless, trustworthy experience with no dependency on third-party logistics.

Our solution is unique because it merges the convenience of subscription culture with the trust and proximity of community access. By embedding shared premium appliances within societies, we eliminate delivery hassles, reduce costs, and maximize usage efficiency.

Additionally, UrbanNest contributes to sustainability by promoting shared consumption, reducing electronic waste, and making high-end technology accessible without the burden of ownership.

In short, our unique solution is to transform luxury appliances into a shared, on-demand amenity within urban communities‚Äîconvenient, affordable, and eco-friendly.
column32:
UrbanNest is selling to residential communities and their residents. Our primary customers are gated societies, apartment complexes, and co-living spaces, where we install IoT-enabled fixtures that provide shared access to premium appliances. This B2B2C model ensures that once a society is onboarded, every resident becomes a potential user.

The end-users are urban young professionals, students, and small families in the 20‚Äì40 age group. They are tech-savvy, convenience-driven, and financially conscious. These customers aspire to use high-end products like Dyson vacuums, PlayStations, or projectors but face two barriers‚Äîhigh upfront costs and limited living space. Even when they purchase such items, they remain underutilized.

Our unique insight is that this customer segment does not necessarily want to ‚Äúown‚Äù appliances‚Äîthey simply want easy, reliable access when needed. They are already comfortable with subscription and sharing models (Uber, Netflix, Airbnb) and see value in extending this mindset to household and entertainment devices.

By focusing on community-based access points, UrbanNest eliminates delivery hassles and creates a seamless, trust-based ecosystem inside their own society. This makes our solution both practical and deeply aligned with the lifestyle of modern urban residents.

column40:
In my first year at BITS Pilani, Dubai Campus (2022), I led my team in the Hackathon jointly organized by ACM and CIIED (the E-Cell of the campus). Our project was a text-to-video generation tool, built much before global companies like OpenAI brought such solutions into the spotlight.

As team lead, I guided both the technical development and the business strategy. We created a prototype that could generate short videos from text prompts, alongside a pitch deck that demonstrated its market potential and scalability.

The innovation and practicality of our idea earned us the first prize at the hackathon. We were also granted incubator access by CIIED, which gave us early exposure to the startup ecosystem and valuable mentorship.

This project was a defining early experience, helping me develop leadership, product-building, and pitching skills‚Äîcapabilities I continue to apply in building UrbanNest.
column41:
One of our direct competitors in the U.S. is Tulu, but our deep understanding of the customer experience sets us apart. Unlike them, we prioritize app usability and transparency. In their app, pricing is hidden and only visible after multiple clicks, which frustrates users. At UrbanNest, we design our app to be clear, upfront, and frictionless, showing availability and pricing instantly.

Another gap is customer mobility. Tulu fixes the user to one building after sign-up, making it difficult when they move. UrbanNest allows flexible access across partner communities, recognizing that urban residents often change apartments and cities.

We also take a different approach to damages and accountability. Tulu absorbs all costs, which increases overhead and eventually impacts pricing. UrbanNest follows a shared-responsibility model, ensuring sustainability, fairness, and reduced misuse.

Most importantly, our insight is that this business is not just about providing appliances‚Äîit is about creating a trusted community amenity. By embedding smart, secure access inside societies and focusing on affordable convenience + sustainability, we make UrbanNest both scalable and aligned with the real lifestyle of urban residents.

column4: M V S S L N Mukund
column20: SolvReal is a mission driven tech startup dedicated to solving real-world problems with bold, scalable solutions. Our first flagship product, PregnoSense, is an AI-powered maternal health monitoring system that uses a smart wearable patch and mobile app to track vital signs and pregnancy health in real time. Through PregnoSense, we are proving our vision of building impactful technologies that improve lives, starting with maternal wellness and expanding into broader healthcare and beyond.
column29: Pregnant women, especially in low-resource or remote settings, face serious risks due to lack of continuous maternal health monitoring. Conditions like preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, and fetal distress often go undetected between doctor visits, leading to preventable complications for both mother and baby. Current monitoring methods are hospital-based, infrequent, and inconvenient, leaving a critical gap in early detection and timely intervention. PregnoSense addresses this problem by enabling real-time, at-home monitoring of maternal vitals, reducing risks and improving outcomes.
column30: Every year, millions of mothers and newborns face life-threatening complications that could have been prevented with better monitoring. In India alone, maternal mortality remains a pressing challenge, with many cases linked to late detection of vital sign abnormalities. The gap isn‚Äôt just medical it‚Äôs also about accessibility and affordability. Rural and semi-urban families often struggle to get regular check-ups, while hospitals lack the capacity for continuous oversight. This makes an easy-to-use, reliable, and affordable home-based monitoring solution not just important, but essential.
column31: Our flagship product, PregnoSense, is a smart, AI-powered maternal health monitoring system that combines a comfortable wearable patch with diagnostic strips and a mobile app. The patch continuously tracks key maternal vitals such as heart rate, blood pressure, oxygen levels, and fetal activity while the easy-to-use strips allow at-home testing for critical biomarkers like proteinuria, which is an early indicator of preeclampsia and other complications. AI algorithms analyze both continuous data from the patch and periodic results from the strips to detect early warning signs and provide actionable insights. The app then connects mothers, caregivers, and doctors with real-time information, enabling timely intervention. Unlike traditional hospital-based monitoring, PregnoSense offers a holistic, affordable, and accessible solution that empowers women to take control of their pregnancy health.
column32: PregnoSense is primarily designed for expectant mothers who want continuous, at-home monitoring of their pregnancy health. Our early focus is on urban and semi-urban women who have access to smartphones and are proactive about maternal wellness. Additionally, we are targeting healthcare providers, clinics, and hospitals that can use PregnoSense to remotely monitor high-risk pregnancies and reduce patient complications. Over time, the product can expand to rural areas, NGOs, and telemedicine platforms, creating broader access to maternal health monitoring for underserved populations.
column40: Zenmindful - A digital wellness initiative designed to reduce stress and overthinking through guided mindfulness practices. The project combined a chatbot and voice assistant to provide real-time emotional support, motivational guidance, and personalized relaxation techniques, helping users achieve mental peace and improve daily focus. The app provided personalized mindfulness exercises, stress check-ins, and emotional insights. The goal was to make mental wellness accessible, scalable, and user-friendly for individuals facing everyday stress. Zenmindful is currently in talks to be integrated into the BITS Pilani ecosystem to help students manage mental well-being and improve focus.
column41: While many companies focus either on hospital-based maternal monitoring or generic wearable devices, we understand that the real gap is continuous, at-home, clinically actionable monitoring that combines vitals tracking with biomarker testing. Most solutions either lack medical accuracy, accessibility, or integration into everyday life. We see that expectant mothers need a holistic, easy-to-use system that empowers them with insights in real time while connecting seamlessly with doctors. This combination of AI, wearable sensors, and diagnostic strips to deliver a proactive, home-based solution is a perspective that other companies haven‚Äôt fully realized or executed.

column20: We are an AI-native M&A matchmaking platform helping Indian MSME founders navigate succession and stake sales. We detect promoter intent signals, discreetly engage via WhatsApp, and build deal-ready data rooms. Our edge is India-first distribution‚ÄîCA networks, supplier webs, and alumni ties‚Äîcombined with trust-building workflows. We reduce failed deals by routing only qualified, prepared sellers to the right buyers. The deal sourcing, model build, valuation and buyer outreach is AI-native..
column29: India‚Äôs MSMEs (especially first‚Äëgen founders in pharma/manufacturing clusters like Hyderabad) face a growing succession and liquidity gap. Discovery is fragmented, broker quality varies, and trust is low. Sellers want discretion, speed, and fair value; buyers want verified supply, clean diligence, and sector fit. Today‚Äôs process is offline, opaque, and slow: months lost chasing mismatched counterparties, inconsistent financials, and weak documentation; founders are uncomfortable with ‚Äúcold‚Äù platforms; boutique advisors lack scalable sourcing; and smaller tickets (<‚Çπ50‚Äì100 cr EV) are underserved. The result: value leakage, failed deals, and stalled legacy transitions, risking jobs and community wealth. There‚Äôs no India‚Äënative, data‚Äëassisted way to systematically surface succession signals, qualify sellers, and route them to the right buyers/advisors with low friction. We‚Äôre fixing that.

column31:
We are an AI‚Äënative deal‚Äëmatchmaking and prep stack for MSME succession.

Signal engine: OSINT + filings + trade/export breadcrumbs + local intel to flag likely sellers (ageing promoters, management gaps, capex stalls, governance stress).

Fit scoring graph: maps buyer theses to sellers (sector, compliance posture, capacity, geo, channel), prioritising intent + feasibility not just keywords.

WhatsApp‚Äëfirst workflows: vernacular micro‚Äëforms, trust‚Äëbuilding nudges, and discreet outreach that match how promoters actually communicate.

Light prep rails: checklists for MCA/GST/doc sanity, red‚Äëflag extraction, clean data room starter.

Partner mode: routes deals to vetted boutique IBs/lawyers/TS providers; we stay infra, not a broker.

India‚Äëfirst UX: low‚Äëfriction identity, privacy controls, and family‚Äësensitive handholding.
Moat = supply (proprietary seller pipeline + scored intent), distribution (hyperlocal nodes + WA), and workflow depth (prep rails reduce failure rates).
column32:
Primary: MSME promoters (45‚Äì75) in pharma, chemicals, precision manufacturing across Hyderabad‚ÄìAurangabad‚ÄìVapi‚ÄìBaddi belts who are succession‚Äëcurious but privacy‚Äësensitive and time‚Äëpoor. They prefer WA/phone over email, value discretion + trust, and want clean, no‚Äënonsense buyers.
Secondary: Buyers (Indian strategics, roll‚Äëups, diaspora operators, small funds) with tight theses needing verified seller flow; boutique IBs/advisors seeking scalable sourcing + prep rails.
Insight: Sellers don‚Äôt want another listing site; they want a trusted concierge + prep rails that make them ‚Äúdeal‚Äëready‚Äù and introduce fewer but better counterparties. Buyers don‚Äôt want noise; they want shortlists that pass first‚Äëhour diligence. We win by combining succession signal discovery with WhatsApp‚Äëfirst engagement and checklist‚Äëdriven prep, then routing to the right buyer/advisor. Distribution is community‚Äëled: CA networks, industry associations, cluster walks, supplier ecosystems, and alumni ties.
column36: 1000000   Build: data pipes, matching graph, WA workflows, VDR-lite  Pilot markets: Hyderabad pharma + adjacent manufacturing  Compliance & partnerships: CA networks, boutique IBs, legal diligence  Hiring: 1 data eng, 1 full‚Äëstack, 1 BD (cluster ops)
column40: Led FP&A/modeling for a 1.2 GW renewable bid (LT2) and supported M&A/financing: built integrated models, coordinated with plant ops, and packaged diligence for lenders‚Äîtight timelines, multi‚Äëparty stakeholders, zero‚Äëdefect delivery.
column41:
For MSME succession in India, platforms don‚Äôt convert‚Äîprep + trust + distribution does. Sellers need a discreet, WA‚Äëfirst concierge and deal‚Äëreadiness rails more than a public listing. Supply (verified, intent‚Äëscored sellers) is the only moat; everything else is a feature. The buyer wants 5 right intros, not 50 leads. Hyperlocal distribution (CA circles, supplier webs, alumni) beats ad spend. We‚Äôre infra + routing, not a broker.

We will build the platform around Trust + AI + Disruption. A Similar business Model has been already validated by an American Company, at $15M Valuation.

column20: Root-cause solutions for water & waste systems.
column22: Start - Oct 2023 | Incorporation - 1 April 2025  (we always had a product first approach and we are not a enterprize we are a initiative.
column23: Shop No. 2, Fundi Niwas, Kapad Bazar, Kopargaon ‚Äì 423601, Maharashtra
column29: India‚Äôs sewer and river systems are failing because waste is not stopped at its root. Most towns release untreated sewage directly into natural water bodies, as sewage treatment plants are too costly to install at scale, and even existing ones underperform. Current cleaning methods like suction machines or desilting excavators only maintain flow, leaving sludge, plastics, and biological waste inside sewers. Over time this causes blockages, flooding, and severe pollution of rivers and lakes. More than half the waste bypasses floating barriers and river nets, as it is non-floatable and sinks into layers, turning rivers into open sewers. Plastics break down into microplastics, now found in salt and sugar consumed daily. Manual scavenging, though banned, still continues because existing machines are inefficient and inaccessible to tier-3 cities, leading to over 600 deaths annually. Authorities end up spending on fragmented, temporary fixes instead of addressing the root cause. This results in polluted rivers, unsafe sanitation work, public health hazards, and wasted budgets. The core issue is that there is no system that intercepts, segregates, and treats waste directly in sewers before it enters water bodies, while also providing rapid, safe cleaning without risking human lives.
column30: The current sewer infrastructure was never designed for the rapid urban growth of recent decades. Today, 70‚Äì80% of sewers are still cleaned through manual scavenging despite the ban, and most of the remaining are maintained with suction machines, robotic arms, or drones that only restore flow rather than remove waste. Untreated sewage and plastics continue to enter rivers, lakes, and seas, making natural water bodies extensions of man-made sewers. Skimmers and river barriers fail because more than half of the waste is non-floatable and sinks beneath the surface, forming layers that choke ecosystems. Installing sewage treatment plants across thousands of smaller towns is financially unfeasible, as a single plant can cost nine figures‚Äîhigher than the annual budget of many municipalities. Even in larger cities, plants are unable to process the full volume of sewage, leaving huge quantities untreated. As a result, downstream cleaning projects repeatedly fail, while microplastics steadily infiltrate food chains. On the human side, sanitation workers are forced into unsafe, inhuman work environments, risking their lives daily. The underlying problem is systemic: we lack affordable, scalable solutions that intercept waste before it reaches natural water sources, while also eliminating the need for humans to enter hazardous sewers.
column31:
Our approach combines two integrated technologies that tackle the problem at its root. Chakravyuh is a modular chamber-like interception system installed directly on sewer lines before they merge into rivers or treatment plants. It traps 100% of solid waste, filters wastewater across multiple parameters, and ensures continuous flow even if compartments are full. It comes in two versions‚Äîone designed for sewers ending at STPs, and another for those discharging into natural water bodies. The design is scalable, cost-efficient, and prepared for IoT integration with sensors and cameras for real-time monitoring.
Abhimanyu is a robotic scavenger designed to clean the Chakravyuh units as well as existing manholes and nullahs. Mounted on a vehicle, it uses a hydraulic arm with conveyor systems to lift sludge and waste safely, separating heavy sludge and recyclables into different compartments. It eliminates the need for manual entry, speeds up cleaning, and can be adapted for multiple municipal functions, from unclogging drains to serving as a crane or fire-extinguishing arm.
Together, Chakravyuh and Abhimanyu replace fragmented, expensive equipment with a complete cycle: interception, segregation, and dignified cleaning. This not only reduces pollution and improves STP efficiency but also restores safety and dignity to sanitation workforces while delivering measurable environmental impact.
column32:
Our primary customers are municipal corporations, city councils, and state sanitation departments that are directly responsible for sewer networks, rivers, and waste management. These authorities struggle with limited budgets, rising pollution, and unsafe manual scavenging practices, yet need affordable, scalable systems that deliver visible and measurable results. For them, Chakravyuh provides interception and filtration before waste reaches water bodies, while Abhimanyu replaces multiple desilting machines with one multipurpose robotic arm capable of rapid, safe sewer cleaning. Both solutions align with government mandates for Swachh Bharat, pollution control, and manual scavenging eradication.
Secondary customers include industrial estates, institutional campuses, and private firms that operate their own STPs or ETPs but face high costs and inefficiencies. Chakravyuh Advanced can be integrated at the machine level to improve output, while Abhimanyu supports periodic maintenance. NGOs and international agencies working on environmental and public health projects are also potential partners for deployment, as our system directly addresses SDGs related to water, sanitation, and decent work.
Our unique insight is that customers no longer want fragmented tools; they want end-to-end solutions that reduce costs, remove risk, and provide auditable data for compliance. By offering a system that intercepts, processes, and reports, we fit this gap precisely.
column34: ‚Çπ5 lakh non-dilutive grant from AIC‚ÄìIIITH Foundation (Not in bank yet). Currently in patent filing process with 3 process patents, 3 utility patents, and 6 industrial designs under preparation. No priced equity round raised, so valuation not applicable.
