column40:
Our team members have pioneered projects across sanitation and sustainable nutrition, both of which earned national recognition.
Rail Trolley 360 was developed to improve hygiene and waste management in Indian Railways. It integrates segregated bins, a bottle crusher, a plate roller crusher, sealed food compartments, and a QR/barcode system for passenger feedback. The project was awarded under the Viksit Bharat initiative and received a Letter of Intent and study approval from Bhusaval Railway Division (Central Railway, Govt. of India), monitored by zonal and district authorities.
In parallel, we created the world‚Äôs first millet-based soya chaap, a ready-to-eat and ready-to-cook product that can be stored in brine without preservatives. This innovation addresses sustainable protein needs and aligns with Zero Hunger goals. It was awarded at the Amrut National Competition on Millet Innovation by AICTE, affirming its impact and scalability.
These experiences reflect our strength in converting systemic challenges into scalable, validated solutions‚Äîwhether in food security or waste management‚Äîwhile securing institutional backing and national recognition.
column41:
Most companies in sanitation and water management look at the problem in fragments‚Äîeither river cleaning, sewer flow restoration, or treatment plants. We understand that unless waste is intercepted at its root, every downstream effort will fail, no matter how advanced the machinery. Our insight is that the real challenge is not only technical but systemic: fragmented equipment, high costs, and unsafe practices have created a cycle where pollution and manual scavenging persist together.
PREserwe was built on the belief that solving this needs a continuous, auditable system‚Äîfrom interception of waste, to dignified cleaning, to measurable reporting. That is why Chakravyuh is designed to trap and treat waste before it reaches rivers, and Abhimanyu is designed to eliminate manual entry by replacing multiple machines with one robotic system. We also recognise that municipalities and industries want outcomes, not just machines‚Äîclean drains, compliance-ready reports, and lower operational costs.
Unlike others, we combine root-cause interception, IoT-enabled monitoring, and worker dignity into one framework, aligning with both SDG goals and procurement realities of Indian towns. This holistic, systems-level view‚Äîtreating water, waste, and human safety as inseparable‚Äîis what sets us apart and drives long-term adoption.
column42:
We are not just building a startup ‚Äî we are building a movement grounded in five pillars: Observe, Change, Innovate, Policy, and Philosophy. PREserwe was born from observing the realities of pollution and manual scavenging, translating those insights into innovation, and aligning them with both community needs and national policy. Our philosophy is that solutions must address root causes, not symptoms.
This vision has already been recognised ‚Äî from representing India at global forums to being ranked and awarded by AICTE, GSEA, Dyson, and other prestigious institutions. Even in my academic journey, from US admissions to being featured in AICTE‚Äôs ‚ÄúInspiring Story,‚Äù the consistent theme has been to turn ideas into impact with credibility and scale.
Our long-term goal is to evolve PREserwe into a PSU-level entity, because India‚Äôs water and sanitation crisis demands national infrastructure solutions, not isolated pilots. Right now, we are focused on execution with ready consumers, but we see this as a foundation for building the world‚Äôs first systemic sanitation model out of India.
So our only question to IGNITE is: How can your platform support ventures like ours, which are not chasing investment alone, but striving to transform into national-scale public infrastructure providers?

column31:
Anugat AI is breaking language and productivity barriers in education with an integrated multilingual AI platform. Our flagship product, Matrabhasha, enables students to learn from AI teachers in all 22 scheduled Indian languages. From university courses to language learning, prerequisites of complex topics, or even ‚Äúlearn anything you want,‚Äù Matrabhasha makes knowledge universally accessible. With built-in live translation, classrooms become truly inclusive where teachers and students can interact seamlessly, regardless of language.

For educators, our second product, Samayak, is an AI-powered assistant that automates class scheduling and administrative tasks at the university level, saving professors hours of effort.

Unlike generic edtech solutions, Anugat AI creates a holistic ecosystem of AI teachers, real-time translators, and productivity tools designed for both students and educators. Our mission is simple yet powerful: make education inclusive, personalized, and effortless, ensuring no learner is left behind because of language or complexity.
column32:
We are selling to universities, colleges, and schools that serve large, linguistically diverse student populations . Collaborating with tem on subscription basis. These institutions face two major pain points:

Language barriers, which limit student engagement and access to quality education.

Complex, unfriendly digital systems, which overwhelm faculty and administrators, most of whom are 40‚Äì50 years old and not highly tech-savvy.

Our unique insight is that while many edtech tools focus only on content or analytics, they ignore the usability needs of institutional decision-makers and faculty. Existing systems are feature-heavy but cumbersome, making adoption difficult.

Anugat AI stands out by offering simple, intuitive, and user-first solutions. With Matrabhasha, institutes can enable multilingual AI teachers and live translation for students, while Samayak automates scheduling and admin tasks with an interface designed for effortless use. This dual approach ensures that both learners and educators benefit, while students get inclusive access, teachers save time, and management finally gets a system they can actually use with ease.
column40:

column41:
We understand that educational technology only works when it is truly designed for the people using it inside institutions. Most existing systems are overly complex and hard for faculty and administrators to adopt, especially those in the 40‚Äì50 age group who are not highly tech-savvy. Our focus is on making tools that are simple, intuitive, and user-first.

We also recognize that India‚Äôs education system is multilingual, and inclusivity is impossible without addressing language barriers. While many companies build English-first solutions, we are enabling AI teachers and live translation in all 22 scheduled Indian languages to make learning accessible to everyone.

Equally important is adoption. Institutions do not want higher management costs; they prefer models where technology is integrated into student fees. By aligning with this behavior, Anugat AI ensures easier adoption. Our edge lies in combining ease of use, inclusivity, and institute-friendly adoption models

column20: Neura Interview is an AI-powered interview preparation platform that helps candidates practice coding, system design, and behavioral interviews through interactive mock sessions. It offers instant feedback, adaptive question difficulty, and personalized learning plans, making preparation more efficient. Our mission is to democratize access to high-quality interview practice and improve hiring outcomes for both candidates and companies.
column29:
Current mock interview options are either expensive or ineffective. Hiring an industry expert or enrolling in training institutes comes at a high cost, making them inaccessible to many students and job seekers. Peer mock interviews, while cheaper, lack the necessary expertise and fail to provide meaningful guidance.

Existing online tools also fall short. Most provide only static practice questions or text-based input, which doesn‚Äôt replicate the experience of a real interview. Even when feedback is provided, it‚Äôs often limited to technical correctness, with no structured analysis of soft skills such as communication, clarity, or confidence. This leaves candidates underprepared for the holistic demands of real interviews.

As a result, candidates waste time, money, and effort without achieving true readiness. They often enter interviews unconfident, misaligned with industry expectations, and unable to identify their weaknesses early.

Neura Interview addresses this gap by offering an affordable, AI-powered platform that delivers realistic, audio-based mock interviews with instant and post-session feedback on both technical and soft skills. This creates a scalable, accessible, and effective way to prepare for interviews something current solutions fail to achieve.

column31:
Neura Interview introduces a two-phase AI-powered mock interview platform designed to replicate the realism and depth of actual interviews while remaining affordable and accessible.

Practice Mode with Instant Feedback ‚Äì Candidates attempt coding, system design, or behavioral questions and receive real-time, audio-based feedback. They can immediately refine their answers and practice iteratively, making the learning process fast and interactive. Unlike text-based tools, our system engages through voice, creating a true interview-like experience.

Assessment Mode with Detailed Analysis ‚Äì Once prepared, candidates enter a full-length mock interview where the AI acts as an interviewer without interruption. At the end, candidates receive comprehensive feedback not only on technical accuracy but also on soft skills like communication, tone, clarity, and confidence‚Äîan area ignored by most existing platforms.

This dual approach uniquely balances practice and testing, ensuring candidates can learn, improve, and then validate their readiness. By combining affordable access, audio-driven realism, and feedback across both technical and behavioral dimensions, Neura Interview provides a holistic solution to a long-standing gap in interview preparation.
column32:
Our primary customers are students, fresh graduates, and early-career professionals preparing for technical roles in software engineering, data science, and related fields. These candidates often lack access to affordable mentorship and structured mock interviews but are actively preparing for competitive placements, internships, or job interviews.

We are also targeting working professionals who are seeking career transitions into top tech companies and need structured, interview-like practice to boost confidence.

In the long term, we aim to partner with colleges, training institutes, and career service centers, offering Neura Interview as a scalable preparation tool for their students. Additionally, recruiters and companies can benefit by accessing a pool of interview-ready candidates, reducing hiring inefficiencies.

By focusing first on individual B2C learners and then expanding to institutions and B2B partnerships, we ensure both immediate adoption and sustainable growth.
column36: We are seeking up to ‚Çπ5 lakh to support R&D, model training, integration of external APIs, and go-to-market activities. This funding will help us refine our AI-driven mock interview platform, enhance the accuracy of both technical and soft-skill feedback, and initiate targeted outreach to students and early professionals, enabling us to validate product-market fit and build early traction.
column40:
An AI-powered study partner that allows users to share their screen and learn alongside AI in real time. If a user encounters a concept they don‚Äôt understand, the AI instantly explains it through voice interaction, making learning more interactive and personalized. This project demonstrated expertise in building real-time AI agents, voice-based assistance, and context-aware explanations, skills that directly translate into our current venture.

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/prithviraj-tagadinamani-934709196_ai-agenticai-voiceassistant-activity-7344367575679606785-Wkv-/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAC4F9fgB4IG1ItV-DK97wcIZEqZm7esIyQw
column41:
Most interview-prep platforms focus either on static question banks or costly 1:1 expert sessions. They miss two critical insights:

Feedback must be both instant and holistic candidates need immediate corrections while practicing, and then detailed evaluation at the end of a full session.

Soft skills matter as much as technical accuracy tone, clarity, and confidence often decide interview outcomes, yet current tools ignore them or rely only on text input, which feels nothing like a real interview.

We understand that true readiness comes from replicating the real interview environment audio-based, adaptive, and affordable and combining it with AI-driven feedback loops that make preparation iterative and measurable. This insight allows us to design a platform that‚Äôs not just practice, but a complete readiness solution, something existing companies fail to deliver.

column20: Runverve is a deep-tech sports startup from IIT Madras. We build Intelligent Technical Textiles (ITTs) and SmartHeal, a wearable e-textile massager, designed for athletes. Our ITTs include smart T-shirts, shorts, socks, and blankets that track hydration, stress, posture, fatigue, and recovery. SmartHeal delivers hands-free heat, vibration, and electrotherapy to accelerate recovery. Together, they empower athletes to train smarter, recover faster, and perform at their peak.
column29:
Athletes face constant strain from intensive training, delayed recovery, and increased risk of injuries. Muscle soreness, fatigue, dehydration, and poor posture not only affect performance but also shorten careers. Over 1.5 billion people globally suffer from chronic pain, and athletes are among the most affected due to repeated stress and overuse.

Existing recovery tools are fragmented. Massage guns are bulky, heating pads are stationary, and TENS devices require sticky gel pads. None integrate seamlessly into an athlete‚Äôs lifestyle or training environment. Similarly, standard sports apparel offers comfort but does not actively support recovery or prevent injury.

The result is that athletes train hard but recover inefficiently, leaving them vulnerable to fatigue, injuries, and performance plateaus.

Runverve addresses this gap by embedding recovery, monitoring, and climate adaptation directly into wearable textiles, making recovery continuous, personalized, and effortless.

column31:
Runverve combines advanced materials, sensors, and AI into athlete-first solutions.

SmartHeal ‚Äì A washable, lightweight, hands-free wearable massager that integrates heat therapy, vibration, and electrotherapy (TENS/EMS). Athletes can use it anytime, before, during, or after training without interruptions. Unlike massage guns or heating pads, it is continuous, portable, and athlete-friendly.

Intelligent Technical Textiles (ITTs) ‚Äì Smart garments including T-shirts, shorts, socks, and blankets that merge bioceramics, nanotech fabrics, and precision sensors. They track hydration, stress, posture, and muscle fatigue while regulating thermal comfort. Data is synced to our AI-powered Digital Twin, offering real-time insights and predictive coaching.

Differentiators for athletes:

Integrated recovery and performance wear

Continuous monitoring and predictive injury prevention

Hands-free, multi-therapy wearable recovery with SmartHeal

Climate-adaptive fabrics that enhance comfort during training and competition

Runverve is building the next generation of performance textiles that double as recovery tools.
column32:
We are selling to athletes across all levels.

Elite Athletes: Professional runners, cyclists, and sports teams who require rapid recovery, hydration monitoring, and injury prevention to sustain performance.

Competitive Amateurs: Semi-professional and collegiate athletes who are highly motivated but lack access to expensive physiotherapy solutions.

Recreational Athletes and Fitness Enthusiasts: Runners, gym-goers, and endurance sport communities who invest in performance wear and value measurable improvements.

Unique Insight: Athletes already wear sports apparel daily and invest heavily in gear for marginal gains. However, recovery tools remain external add-ons. Our insight is that recovery and performance monitoring should be embedded into the apparel itself, what they already use every day.

This makes adoption frictionless. Instead of carrying bulky devices or visiting recovery centers, athletes recover and monitor their bodies passively as they train, sleep, or compete. Runverve turns clothing into a performance lab and recovery clinic, offering athletes a natural, scalable solution for peak performance.
column34: We are currently at prototype stage, supported by IIT Madras Nirmaan/OIE incubation, Google for Startups, and AWS for Startups. We have piloted early prototypes with runners and endurance athletes and received strong validation at national sports tech conclaves.

column36: We are seeking $1.5M seed funding to accelerate R&D, athlete trials, certifications, and pilot manufacturing of SmartHeal and ITTs. Funds will drive hardware design, textile innovation, and early market entry into elite sports and endurance training communities.
column40: Founder Anil Kumar Talari, an ultramarathoner, built SmartHeal‚Äôs early prototypes using graphene heating, textile sensors, and IoT boards. Tested during endurance training, the prototype proved hands-free, multi-therapy recovery, demonstrating strong utility for athletes.
column41: We understand that athletes do not just need data, they need recovery built into their routine. Competitors build either recovery devices or performance trackers, but athletes juggle both separately. Our insight is that the future lies in merging performance monitoring, recovery therapies, and climate comfort into a single, seamless garment ecosystem. With Runverve, athletes no longer add recovery, they wear it.

column20: A biotechnology startup focused on developing a novel therapeutic potential in a host-targeted therapy-based approach for drug-resistant pathogens. Also, our startup is working on the development of bio-diagnostic sensors for the detection of bacterial and viral infections. Along with the research-oriented sections, our startup also provides services in computational and biotechnology solutions.
column29:
Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) has emerged as one of the most serious global health threats of the 21st century. According to WHO and CDC reports, multidrug-resistant (MDR) bacteria are responsible for millions of infections annually, with a growing burden of treatment failure, prolonged hospitalization, and increased mortality. Despite the urgent need, the pipeline for new antibiotics remains extremely limited, and conventional systemic antibiotic therapies are increasingly ineffective.
One of the most critical challenges in infectious disease management is the treatment of biofilm-associated and intracellular bacterial infections.
‚Ä¢	Biofilm infections: In osteomyelitis, prosthetic joint infections, chronic wounds, and catheter-related infections, bacteria form biofilms that protect them from antibiotics and immune clearance. Biofilm bacteria can be up to 10√ó more resistant to antibiotics compared to planktonic cells.
‚Ä¢	Intracellular infections: Pathogens like Staphylococcus aureus can survive within macrophages, osteocytes, and other host cells, creating persistent reservoirs that evade conventional antibiotic therapies.
Current standard of care relies heavily on high-dose systemic antibiotic administration, often for weeks to months. 
1.	Poor penetration into biofilms and intracellular niches, leaving bacterial reservoirs intact.
2.	Toxicity and side effects due to prolonged systemic dosing.
3.	Frequent recurrence and chronicity, requiring repeated hospitalizations and surgical interventions.
4.	Rising antibiotic resistance, as single-agent therapies exert selective pressure.
5.	High treatment costs, including long hospital stays, revision surgeries (especially in bone and implant infections)
column30:

According to WHO and CDC reports, multidrug-resistant (MDR) bacteria are responsible for millions of infections annually, with a growing burden of treatment failure, prolonged hospitalization, and increased mortality. Despite the urgent need, the pipeline for new antibiotics remains extremely limited, and conventional systemic antibiotic therapies are increasingly ineffective.
One of the most critical challenges in infectious disease management is the treatment of biofilm-associated and intracellular bacterial infections.
‚Ä¢	Biofilm infections: In osteomyelitis, prosthetic joint infections, chronic wounds, and catheter-related infections, bacteria form biofilms that protect them from antibiotics and immune clearance. Biofilm bacteria can be up to 10√ó more resistant to antibiotics compared to planktonic cells.
‚Ä¢	Intracellular infections: Pathogens like Staphylococcus aureus can survive within macrophages, osteocytes, and other host cells, creating persistent reservoirs that evade conventional antibiotic therapies.
Current standard of care relies heavily on high-dose systemic antibiotic administration, often for weeks to months. 
1.	Poor penetration into biofilms and intracellular niches, leaving bacterial reservoirs intact.

column31: To address the critical challenge of antimicrobial resistance, biofilm persistence, and intracellular bacterial survival, we propose the development of an innovative injectable and topical hydrogel platform based on a polymeric matrix. This hydrogel will serve as a biodegradable, sustained-release drug delivery system designed to deliver a synergistic combination of antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) and broad-spectrum antibiotics directly to the site of infection.
column32:
Target Customers:
Our primary customers include hospitals, wound-care centers, dermatology clinics, burn units, and surgical departments handling chronic and drug-resistant infections. 
Market Size & Opportunity:
‚Ä¢	The global wound care market is valued at over ‚Çπ35,000 crore (USD 4+ billion) with a steady CAGR of 6‚Äì7%.
‚Ä¢	In India alone, ~10 million patients suffer from chronic wounds annually, representing a potential market of ‚Çπ3,500‚Äì4,000 crore.
‚Ä¢	With the rise of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) and limited effectiveness of existing antibiotics, there is a significant opportunity for innovative antimicrobial peptide‚Äìantibiotic hydrogel formulations that provide sustained release and faster healing.
Entry Barriers:
‚Ä¢	Existing dominance of multinational wound-care companies.
‚Ä¢	Need for regulatory approvals (CDSCO, DCGI, CE/FDA for export markets).
‚Ä¢	Initial investment required for clinical validation and manufacturing scale-up.
‚Ä¢	However, our unique formulation (AMP‚Äìantibiotic conjugate hydrogel), intellectual property strategy, and strong differentiation in tackling AMR provide a clear competitive edge.
Societal Impact:
‚Ä¢	Reduces the burden of antibiotic-resistant infections, improving patient survival and quality of life.
‚Ä¢	Offers affordable and effective treatment for chronic wounds in low-resource settings.
‚Ä¢	Minimizes hospitalization time, reduces healthcare costs, and improves productivity of patients.
‚Ä¢	Aligns with national and global health priorities (e.g., WHO‚Äôs AMR Action Plan).
‚Ä¢	Environmentally safer: reduced misuse of antibiotics and resistance spread.
column40: We are a new startup, and we registered only three months ago. But we are a group of professionals who are well-skilled and have good experience in various research fields, and are currently pursuing a Ph.D. in different biotechnology fields.
column41:
Most companies focus either on systemic antibiotics or single-agent topical treatments, often overlooking the synergy of combining antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) with antibiotics in a hydrogel delivery system. We understand that the real unmet need is localized, sustained, and multi-mechanistic therapy that not only kills bacteria but also prevents resistance development and accelerates wound healing.
Where others see hydrogels as mere carriers, but for us, it is a therapeutic platform capable of targeted, layered drug release, reducing systemic side effects, hospital burden, and environmental antibiotic load. This insight allows us to create a solution that directly bridges the gap between conventional antibiotics and advanced wound-care biomaterials.

column29:
The problem Crea8 is solving lies in the complexity and confusion of skincare. The personal care market is crowded with countless brands, each claiming to be the best, leaving consumers uncertain about what will actually work for their skin. Today, buying skincare feels like trial and error.
Customers cope by spending hours researching ingredients, reviews, and comparisons, but most don't understand what these ingredients mean, and end up unsure and frustrated. Their biggest question remains: ‚ÄúWill this even work for me?‚Äù.  What people simply want is skincare that actually works. 

We simplify this process of finding personal care by recommending products from top brands that work for your individual needs.

column40:
A year ago, I had nothing but an ambitious dream: a marketplace for custom everything‚Äîcosmetics, furniture, apparel. But dreams have a way of evolving when they meet reality. After countless conversations and feedback sessions, my grand vision narrowed to customized cosmetics, only to hit another wall. The concept was too early, too foreign. People weren't ready.

Everything changed in March 2025 when I actually sat down and listened to what people were saying. They didn't want to create their own skincare from scratch‚Äîthey just wanted help choosing better products from what's already out there. This insight changed everything.

Here's the crazy part: I knew absolutely nothing about tech or skincare when I started. But six months later, I've somehow managed to build what I believe is a simple, loveable, and complete MVP set to launch this September. How? By treating every customer conversation as my personal mentorship session and assembling a weird but amazing team of AI agents, each a specialist in their domain, ready to tackle technical challenges whenever I hit a roadblock.

The journey transformed me from a dreamer into something I never expected: a part-time entrepreneur and full-time product manager. very day was full of tough calls‚Äîwhat features actually matter for the MVP? How do you make something people will love without making it impossible to build? Six months ago, I thought I'd need some amazing tech team and tons of money to make this happen.
Now when I look back at all those daily efforts and the consistent work over six months, I just feel excited. Really excited. September can't get here fast enou
column41: We understand that skincare in India isn‚Äôt just about buying products‚Äîit‚Äôs about trust, clarity, and guidance. Most marketplaces/brands  in India are focused on the "selling" part, or choose from their own product lines, but we focus on helping users discover what actually works for them across all brands, with dermatologist-backed, unbiased recommendations and long-term support like routines, progress tracking, and lifestyle insights.

column20: Nutritious, customizable lunches for busy professionals
column29:
In today‚Äôs fast-paced corporate lifestyle, working professionals struggle to find nutritious, balanced, and convenient lunch options during their busy workdays. Most rely on canteens, fast food, or skipping meals altogether leading to unhealthy eating habits, lack of energy, and long-term health concerns.

Traditional lunch options are either unhealthy, repetitive, or lack customization to individual dietary needs like protein, fiber, and carbs balance. Professionals want wholesome meals that fuel productivity without the hassle of cooking or depending on limited office food choices
column30: Busy working professionals struggle to access healthy, balanced, and customizable lunches during their workday. Existing options are either unhealthy, monotonous, or lack nutrition, leading to poor eating habits and reduced productivity
column31: Eat on Desk delivers nutritious, freshly cooked, and customizable lunch bowls designed specifically for working professionals. Each meal is thoughtfully packed with the right balance of fiber, protein, and carbs, offering both health and convenience. Unlike generic tiffin or food delivery services, we focus on personalization, consistency, and wellness, ensuring professionals can eat healthy without compromising on taste or time.
column32:
We are selling to urban working professionals - employees in IT companies, startups, corporates, and co-working spaces who struggle to find healthy, reliable, and timely lunch options during their busy workdays.
 Our primary customers are health-conscious millennials and Gen Z professionals who value convenience, nutrition, and the ability to customize their meals.
column33: We are currently in the pre-revenue stage, focusing on product development, prototyping, and early user testing. Our next milestone is to launch a pilot program with working professionals and small corporate offices within the next 3 months, which will help us establish our first revenue streams.
column34: We have not raised any external funding so far. The venture has been self-initiated and bootstrapped, which has allowed us to build the foundation with complete ownership and clarity of vision. Validation has come through early user surveys, feedback from working professionals, and interest shown by corporate offices, highlighting the strong demand for healthy, customizable lunch options.

Strengthen branding, customer acquisition & corporate partnerships.  Support operations for the next 12‚Äì15 months, covering key pilot launches in major IT hubs.  The goal is to achieve product-market fit, early traction.

I designed engagement strategies, nurtured leads, and built strong client relationships that directly contributed to long-term contracts. This experience gave me a deep understanding of customer behavior, retention, and scalable engagement models, skills I now applies to building Eat on Desk‚Äôs customer acquisition and retention strategy.
column41:
What we understand about our business that others don‚Äôt is that healthy eating for working professionals is not just about providing food , it‚Äôs about providing consistency, customization, and convenience together. Many companies focus only on taste, or only on nutrition, or only on delivery speed. But professionals want all three without compromise.

At Eat on Desk, we‚Äôve realized from real conversations with users that:

They don‚Äôt want generic ‚Äúdiet meals‚Äù  they want balanced bowls they can customize daily.

They value trust and predictability knowing their lunch will be healthy and on time, every time.

They see lunch as an energy boost for productivity, not just a meal.

This understanding  that food is fuel for professional performance  is what sets us apart and shapes everything from our product design to our delivery model.

column20: Reinventing Energy Storage with Iron-Air
column29:
1. India wastes 20% of renewable electricity daily due to inadequate storage.

2. Existing energy storage solutions are too expensive for widespread adoption.

3. Current technologies are often toxic or environmentally unsustainable.

4. Grids, EVs, and telecom infrastructure face power reliability issues.
column30:
1. India wastes 20% of renewable electricity daily due to inadequate storage.

2. Existing energy storage solutions are too expensive for widespread adoption.

3. Current technologies are often toxic or environmentally unsustainable.

4. Grids, EVs, and telecom infrastructure face power reliability issues.
column31:
Low-cost iron-air chemistry: Uses abundant, non-toxic, and recyclable materials.

1. Hybrid supercapacitor stack: Ensures fast response and high power delivery.

2. Intelligent power management system (BMS): Optimises performance and lifetime.

3. Complete energy ecosystem: Integrates batteries, power electronics, and digital monitoring for grids, EVs, and telecoms.

4. Sustainable and scalable: Designed for affordability, circularity, and large-scale adoption.
column32:
B2G (Business-to-Government):

Grid operators for renewable energy storage and grid stabilization.

Public infrastructure projects needing reliable, sustainable power.

B2B (Business-to-Business):

1. Telecom companies for uninterrupted tower power.

2. Data centers for backup and load management.

3. EV infrastructure providers for charging stations and fleet storage.

4. Industrial and commercial users requiring scalable, low-cost, and safe energy storage.
column34: Grant of 8 Lakhs from DST NIDHI PRAYAS
column35: Grant of 8 Lakhs from DST NIDHI PRAYAS
column40: One of our team members led the development of a dual-rotor axial flux motor, built completely in-house. The project included designing a segmented stator with concentrated windings, fabricating custom soft magnetic composites, and integrating a flat-wire winding approach for higher slot fill and reduced copper losses. A proprietary self-starting, sensor-less control system was also implemented to overcome the common challenge of axial flux motors needing manual kick-start. The design achieved high torque density, compact size, and improved thermal management, making it highly suitable for electric two-wheelers and compact EV platforms. This project demonstrated our ability to combine mechanical design, materials engineering, and advanced power electronics into a fully functional prototype‚Äîshowcasing the team‚Äôs end-to-end product development capability
column41:
Storage is more than chemistry: Most focus on energy density; we understand real impact comes from affordability, scalability, and reliability.

1. Hybrid integration is essential: Iron-air alone is slow, combining it with supercapacitors and smart BMS gives instant responsiveness.

2. Local materials matter: Using abundant, recyclable, and non-toxic materials makes large-scale deployment feasible in India.

3. Ecosystem approach: We see the battery as part of a complete energy ecosystem, including digital monitoring, grid integration, and EV/telecom applications.

4. Sustainability is a differentiator: Designing for circularity from day one gives us an edge competitors often overlook.

4. Based on your experience, what would be the key areas we should focus on to accelerate FeRON‚Äôs adoption and impact?

column20: AI-powered soil-to-market advisory for farmers
column29:
India has a total of 146 million farmers, of which more than 80% are smallholders (<2 ha). Indian agriculture contributes 18% of GDP, but farmer profitability remains low. Some fundamental realities face farmers in India. Firstly, 30% of arable land has been proved to be degraded. Secondly, fertilizer use is considered non-optimal (e.g., not following soil health), which farmers are unaware of. Thirdly, they depend on monsoons for 50% of all rainfall in India. Fourthly, farmers do not plan their crops based on market demand. Because of these issues, average yields are 30-50% below the global average, with farmers spending 35-40% of their income on inputs, and netting around ‚Çπ 10,000-12,000/month. 

Krishi Mantra is launching to address these issues with a soil-to-market ecosystem. Krishi Labs deliver hyper local soil-testing at ‚Çπ 70-100/sample (vs. ‚Çπ 500+ research labs) while developing predictive intelligence. Krishi Mitra, our AI advisory application, provides farmers advice about what to grow, when to grow, how to replenish soil, and which markets are relevant. Early pilots demonstrated yield uplifts of 20-25%, farm-gate prices 15-20% better, and harvest realizations 10-12% higher. 

Operating in a $400B agro-ecosystem, we have identified a $200B found market segment in digital agriculture technology (SAT) (less than 5% penetration) and will target at 10,000 farmers in Karnataka as a first milestone unlocking $50B value of latent value for Indian agri-value chain.
column30:
India has a total of 146 million farmers, of which more than 80% are smallholders (<2 ha). Indian agriculture contributes 18% of GDP, but farmer profitability remains low. Some fundamental realities face farmers in India. Firstly, 30% of arable land has been proved to be degraded. Secondly, fertilizer use is considered non-optimal (e.g., not following soil health), which farmers are unaware of. Thirdly, they depend on monsoons for 50% of all rainfall in India. Fourthly, farmers do not plan their crops based on market demand. Because of these issues, average yields are 30-50% below the global average, with farmers spending 35-40% of their income on inputs, and netting around ‚Çπ 10,000-12,000/month. 

Krishi Mantra is launching to address these issues with a soil-to-market ecosystem.  Krishi Labs deliver hyper local soil-testing at ‚Çπ 70-100/sample (vs. ‚Çπ 500+ research labs) while developing predictive intelligence. Krishi Mitra, our AI advisory application, provides farmers advice about what to grow, when to grow, how to replenish soil, and which markets are relevant. Early pilots demonstrated yield uplifts of 20-25%, farm-gate prices 15-20% better, and harvest realisation's 10-12% higher. 

Operating in a $400B agro-ecosystem, we have identified a $200B found market segment in digital agriculture technology (SAT) (less than 5% penetration) and will target at 10,000 farmers in Karnataka as a first milestone unlocking $50B value of latent value for Indian agri-value chain.
column31:
Krishi Mantra's core uniqueness is its "soil to market" integrated approach that bundles hyperlocal soil intelligence, AI-driven advisory and market linkage into one seamless ecosystem. We start, unlike agricultural extension services or input marketplaces, with the root problem of soil health. We provide a low-cost pathway to testing at ‚Çπ70 to 100 per test vs. > 500 paid in labs, allowing us to scale to over 150 million smallholder farmers. We make it possible to create a proprietary soil health database that enables predictive models for yield, price and pest risk in the range of 80 to 85 percent accuracy.

Our Krishi Mitra advisory engine uses this database to help farmers operationalise this into what to grow, when to grow it, how to enrich the soil, and where to go to sell. Pilot results already show 20 to 25 percent yield improvements, 15 to 20 percent higher farm gate prices and 10 to 12 percent higher harvest realisation. By integrating low cost farmer onboarding with scalable technology, and market-aware advice, Krishi Mantra can unlock fifty billion dollars of agricultural value while enabling sustainable transformation in farmer economics.
column32:
The primary customer for our offerings are India's 146 million farmers; 80 percent+ of which are small and marginal farmers, who farm less than two hectares. Small and marginal farmers contribute a significant share of the national food production and ultimately GDP, but are mostly underserved in technology, credit and advisory. The average small and marginal farmer takes home ‚Çπ10,000 to 12,000 per month, approximately 40% goes to purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. They are highly price-sensitive and reluctant to try digital solutions; but thanks partly to the rapid adoption of smart phones in recent years, 500 million rural users have moved online. 

The distinctive insight of this customer segment is that they are dual constrained by scarcity of resources and uncertainty of decision making. Farmers want to reduce costs, and improve yields. But they lack soil and market intelligence. By providing hyperlocal, low cost, vernacular solutions, Krishi Mantra is not just a service provider. It now has become a partner on their journey from soil to market.

column41:
Krishi Mantra is different. We've learned from experience that the way to a prosperous farming community is built on the foundation of soil. Most competitors are merely interested in the logistics of input distribution, the efficiencies of the supply chain, or the convenience of output marketplaces. They forget that the upstream issue from which all agriculture starts means paying attention to soil health. Without precision soil intelligence, advisory consultations and marketplace activity are useless, reactive and incomplete. By using affordable hyperlocal soil testing as the model we are (unlike any player in market at scale) creating a living database of soil health profiles across geographies.
The soil-first model makes integration of an AI-driven predictive intelligence layer on yields, pest risks, and market price, with 80‚Äì85 percent accuracy combined, possible. This allows farmers to plan instead of react. We have identified that although marketplaces do offer transformation to agriculture, it's not from a marketplace, it's empowering farmers with ownership of data and actionable insights. Our competitors sell inputs; we sell knowledge, plus a better chance at profitability.

column20: Full Stack AI Enabled Consultancy For Gaming
column29:
Modern game development is broken by misalignment between what stakeholders build and what players actually want. Studios ship updates that backfire causing PR disasters, player churn, wasted budgets, and failed monetization. Internal QA ‚Äúlabs‚Äù are rare, so features are launched blind. Teams interpret noisy community feedback poorly, leading to rushed hotfixes, delayed roadmaps, and eroding trust.
This results in:
PR risk: negative reviews and social backlash.
Financial leakage: millions lost to failed patches, rework, and missed revenue.
UX decline: poor design decisions destroy retention and LTV.
SmartSolutions fixes this holistically. Our ROHIT Framework ingests community chatter, game telemetry, and live-ops signals, then converts them into clear, actionable release plans that keep players happy, stakeholders aligned, and teams efficient. By reducing the human hours needed to interpret complex data and aligning every decision across UX, PR, and Finance, we prevent costly mistakes before they reach production.

column31:
We‚Äôve built ROHIT Framework, a full-stack, AI-assisted product intelligence and design system for game studios. Unlike isolated analytics dashboards, our framework bridges the gap between studios and players, ensuring that every release is data-driven, human-verified, and player-first.

Key differentiators:

Human-in-the-loop AI: Ensures accuracy, context, and avoids the ‚Äúblack box‚Äù problem which is why 95% of AI tools fail.

Layered cognition: Our proprietary Semantic Sentinel, PersonaSim, and InsightLoop modules de-noise feedback, simulate player behavior, and translate insights into spec-ready tickets.

Tri-metric scoring: Every decision is rated for UX impact, PR safety, and financial ROI, keeping leadership aligned.

Holistic methodology: Instead of being a single plugin, our system improves backlog refinement, live-ops cadence, monetization tuning, and community trust ‚Äî all at once.

Validated by Heather Chandler (Helldivers 2 producer), this framework reduces iteration waste, saves millions in development cost, and helps studios build games that both players love and publishers profit from.
column32:
Our customers are game studios worldwide primarily mid-tier/AA studios and ambitious indies, with future expansion into AAA publishers. These teams are under pressure to:

Deliver faster without ballooning QA costs.

Improve player retention and monetization ethically.

Avoid PR disasters caused by unpopular updates.

Industry insight:

Global gaming market: $250B+ TAM with rising live-service models.

AI penetration in product management is near zero, meaning almost no competition.

Studios currently rely on intuition or fragmented analytics tools that fail to explain why players churn.

We start with low-risk, high-value pilots: a 6‚Äì8 week Backlog Refinement Sprint or Community QA Decode. This proves ROI by showing reduced rework and improved patch reception. Once trust is established, we expand into full design iteration and live-ops co-piloting.

By working modularly, we give studios an entry point that scales into a complete operating system for smarter game development ‚Äî one that keeps stakeholders aligned, reduces costs, and ensures every update lands successfully with its community.

column29: Urban flooding is a serious problem in cities, especially in crowded and low-lying areas. When water rises suddenly, it quickly blocks roads, damages infrastructure, and slows down rescue efforts. Current systems can warn about floods, but they don‚Äôt give people a safe place to go immediately. Because of this, many vulnerable people are left without protection, which increases the chances of injuries and loss of life. There is an urgent need for simple, street-level solutions that can keep people safe until help arrives
column30: We are solving the problem of people being left without immediate protection during sudden urban floods. Current flood systems focus on alerts and monitoring but do not provide a safe, on-the-spot shelter. Our Flood-Rescue Smart Pod addresses this gap by offering an autonomous, street-level refuge that keeps people safe above rising waters until rescue teams arrive
column31: Our unique solution is an autonomous, sensor-driven Smart Pod that not only detects flood hazards but also actively protects people by lifting itself above rising waters using inflatable airbags, securing its position with anchors, and signaling distress for rescue. Unlike traditional flood systems that only monitor or warn, our pod provides an immediate, street-level life-saving shelter.
column32: Our Flood-Rescue Smart Pod can be implemented in flood-prone cities by installing units at vulnerable street-level locations such as residential areas, schools, hospitals, and transport hubs. It can be sold to government bodies, municipal corporations, disaster management agencies, NGOs, and private housing developers, all of whom require practical, on-site flood resilience solutions to protect people during emergencies

column29:
Emotional intelligence (EI) coaching for kids is essential in today‚Äôs fast-paced, high-pressure world. Developing EI at a young age equips children with the ability to understand and manage their emotions, communicate effectively, and handle interpersonal relationships with empathy and resilience. These skills lay the foundation for solving problems calmly, making thoughtful decisions, and staying mentally strong when life presents challenges.

Adolescence is a particularly vulnerable period. According to the World Health Organization, depression is one of the leading causes of illness and disability among adolescents. Suicide is the fourth leading cause of death among 15‚Äì19-year-olds globally. These alarming statistics reflect a growing mental health crisis that often stems from unaddressed emotional struggles.

Through EI coaching, children learn to recognize and articulate their emotions, cope with stress in healthy ways, and build confidence. Over time, these skills contribute to greater academic performance, stronger relationships, and a reduced risk of mental health issues. In the long run, emotionally intelligent individuals are better equipped to navigate life‚Äôs ups and downs without feeling overwhelmed or defeated. Empowering kids with EI is not just preventive care‚Äîit‚Äôs an investment in a future generation that is self-aware, resilient, and emotionally strong.

column31:
Emotional intelligence (EI) coaching offers transformative benefits across all stages of life, from childhood through adulthood. For kids, EI coaching builds the foundation for self-awareness, emotional regulation, and empathy. These skills are essential for managing peer relationships, coping with academic pressures, and developing resilience. As they grow, emotionally intelligent children become better problem-solvers, effective communicators, and more adaptable to change.

In adolescence and young adulthood, EI coaching becomes a powerful tool for navigating identity, relationships, and increased responsibilities. It helps individuals make thoughtful decisions, manage stress, and avoid impulsive behavior. It also plays a critical role in mental health, reducing the risk of anxiety, depression, and burnout.

For adults, EI enhances leadership, workplace collaboration, and personal relationships. It fosters better conflict resolution, greater emotional stability, and improved decision-making under pressure. In professional environments, emotionally intelligent individuals are often more successful, as they inspire trust, manage teams effectively, and handle feedback constructively.

Across all ages, EI coaching nurtures emotional resilience, empowering individuals to face life‚Äôs challenges with confidence and composure. Whether in school, work, or relationships, the ability to understand and manage emotions is a lifelong asset that directly contributes to personal well-being, success, and fulfillment.
column32:
Emotional intelligence (EI) training for kids is increasingly essential in today's complex and fast-paced world. Children are exposed to various emotional and social challenges from a young age, and without the tools to navigate these experiences, they can struggle with stress, anxiety, and conflict. EI training helps children recognize, understand, and manage their emotions, while also teaching empathy, communication, and healthy social interaction.

The necessity of EI lies in its long-term impact. Children with strong emotional intelligence are better equipped to handle peer pressure, resolve conflicts peacefully, and make responsible decisions. These skills directly influence academic performance, mental well-being, and the ability to form strong, supportive relationships. As they grow, emotionally intelligent children become more resilient adults, capable of coping with life‚Äôs setbacks and adapting to change.

Insights from EI training reveal that when children learn to express emotions constructively, they build self-confidence and reduce behavioral issues. They also become more aware of others‚Äô feelings, fostering compassion and teamwork. In a world where emotional challenges are a leading cause of adolescent distress, equipping kids with emotional intelligence is not just beneficial‚Äîit is crucial for their overall development, mental health, and future success in both personal and professional spheres.
column40: My Team and I as a Team Lead were selected in a National top team for the theme Sustainability and mobility in 2030. We proposed a solution on how to use fuel using nature and inject it into electric cars so there is complete anti-pollution era in the near future.
column41:
What sets our Emotional Intelligence (EI) coaching business apart is a strategic and research-driven understanding of EI as a critical component of long-term personal and professional success‚Äînot merely a behavioral tool. While many companies approach EI as a supplementary or ‚Äúsoft skill‚Äù program, we treat it as a core developmental framework rooted in psychology, neuroscience, and educational best practices.

We understand that emotional intelligence is not a one-time lesson or a generic curriculum‚Äîit‚Äôs a dynamic process that must be personalized, measurable, and embedded into everyday experiences. Our coaching model is structured to align with key developmental milestones, ensuring age-appropriate skill-building that evolves with the child. This developmental insight is often overlooked by others who offer uniform programs across age groups.

Professionally, we prioritize sustainability and real-world application. We don‚Äôt just teach emotional vocabulary or coping mechanisms‚Äîwe train children to apply EI in decision-making, problem-solving, leadership, and interpersonal interactions. We also emphasize collaboration with parents and educators to reinforce skills across home and school environments.

Most importantly, we treat emotional intelligence as a foundational investment in a child's future‚Äîenhancing not only academic and social success but also leadership potential and lifelong mental health. This long-term, integrated vision sets our approach apart in both philosophy and practice.

column20: Xs-Parking Solution app offers a smart , digital solution to locate , book and pay for parking spots.
column29: Parking in busy cities and popular destinations has become a daily struggle, causing frustration, wasted time, and unnecessary fuel consumption. Drivers often circle around in search of a spot, only to end up parking far from their destination, leading to delays and added stress. Our parking app addresses these issues by providing a seamless digital solution that allows users to pre-book parking spaces, view real-time availability, and make secure digital payments.
column30: Parking lot owners face challenges in managing their spaces efficiently, losing potential revenue due to lack of visibility, poor occupancy management, and limited payment options. This will help owners optimize space utilization, attract more customers, and standardize operations. By bridging this gap, we are not just solving a daily inconvenience but also contributing to smoother urban mobility and a smarter, more efficient parking ecosystem.
column31: Our startup introduces a tech-enabled solution to address the persistent issue of urban parking inefficiency. Through our mobile application, users can discover and pre-book available parking spaces in real-time, ensuring hassle-free and time-saving parking experiences. What makes our innovation unique is its ability to digitize and optimize underutilized parking spots ‚Äî including those in residential, commercial, and institutional areas ‚Äî turning idle spaces into shared public assets. This system not only reduces traffic congestion and vehicular emissions caused by circling for parking, but also supports smart city objectives by integrating location tracking, digital payments, and real-time availability updates. Our approach aligns with government goals around urban planning, environmental sustainability, and digital public infrastructure, making it a scalable, citizen-centric innovation with direct social and economic impact.
column32: Our solution has wide-ranging applications across multiple sectors: 1.Religious Places Temples: Helps manage high parking demand during peak hours and weekends by offering pre-booking and organized space allocation. 2.Urban Mobility Smart Cities: Ideal for municipal bodies aiming to digitize parking infrastructure and reduce congestion as part of smart city initiatives. 3.Commercial Complexes Malls: Helps businesses manage visitor parking efficiently while generating additional revenue. 4.Residential Societies Gated Communities: Enables residents to manage guest parking and lease unused spaces. 5.Transportation Hubs (Airports, Railway Stations): Streamlines parking for high-footfall areas by reducing wait times and improving traffic flow. 6.Corporate IT Parks: Assists facility managers in organizing employee and visitor parking using real-time data.
column40: Designed and developed a full-stack healthcare application that enables users to purchase medicines, schedule doctor appointments, and access various healthcare services. Built RESTful APIs for secure data exchange, implemented database schemas for scalable storage, and integrated payment gateways for seamless transactions. Developed a dedicated admin panel for managing inventory, approving doctor listings, monitoring orders, and analyzing platform performance. Implemented user authentication with role-based access control, data encryption, and compliance with healthcare data privacy standards. Optimized front-end performance and ensured system reliability, fault tolerance, and scalability.
column41: We see parking as an unorganized ecosystem‚Äînot just an inconvenience. Most players focus only on the driver‚Äôs side, but we recognize the dual challenge: for consumers, it means wasted time, stress, and inefficiency, while for owners it results in underutilized space, lost revenue, and lack of digital tools, for this we have developed two separate apps. We see a massive untapped opportunity in Tier-2 markets, high-footfall tourist spots, and devotional hubs where the pain is more severe. We also treat parking as a standardized, scalable asset class‚Äîintroducing uniform layouts, digital payments, and trusted operations. By catering to India‚Äôs mix of cash and digital preferences, we are not only solving today‚Äôs inconvenience but also building the foundation for the future of mobility and smarter cities.

column10: Amity School of Engineering & Technology (AMITY), Noida
column20: Digital health vault for reports & AI insights, simplifying healthcare with easy storage, analysis, and ABDM-ready integration for all.
column29:
Healthcare in India is still heavily dependent on paper-based reports and fragmented systems. Patients often struggle to keep track of their past medical history, lab results, and prescriptions, while doctors waste valuable consultation time trying to piece together incomplete information. This creates inefficiencies, delays in treatment, and in many cases, serious gaps in continuity of care.

Labs and clinics also face challenges in engaging patients beyond a single visit, since there is no simple way to offer digital access to reports or build long-term trust. On top of this, the lack of standardization and integration with national frameworks like ABDM makes it harder to move towards a fully digital ecosystem.

VDocs solves this by providing a secure digital health vault where patients can store, access, and share their reports anytime. Our AI layer helps them track key vitals, identify trends, and get preventive insights without replacing doctors. Clinics and labs benefit from offering patients a modern digital experience, strengthening retention and enabling ABDM-compliant data flows.

By eliminating paperwork, ensuring secure continuity of care, and making health data truly patient-centric, we bridge the gap between patients, doctors, and healthcare providers in a simple, accessible way.

By eliminating paperwork, ensuring secure continuity of care, and making health data truly patient-centric, we bridge the gap between patients, doctors, and healthcare providers in a simple, accessible way.
column31:
Our unique solution is a digital health vault built for the Indian healthcare ecosystem, designed to be simple for patients and seamlessly integrable for clinics and labs. Unlike generic health apps, VDocs focuses on solving the core problem of paper-based, fragmented medical records.

Patients can securely store, access, and share all their health reports in one place, with AI-powered insights that track vitals, highlight trends, and encourage preventive action. This gives them continuity of care and empowers them to actively manage their health.

For clinics and labs, VDocs offers an easy plug-and-play platform to deliver digital reports, manage appointments, and build stronger engagement with patients. Our solution is ABDM-ready, ensuring future-proof integration with national health frameworks while maintaining high standards of privacy and security.

By combining accessibility, AI-driven insights, and ecosystem integration, VDocs creates a single, patient-centric interface for healthcare in India.

column40: We've previously built a Relief App for an NGO during the pandemic. The app streamlined donation management and resource distribution by connecting volunteers, NGOs, and beneficiaries in real time. This project gave us first-hand experience in building scalable, impact-driven digital solutions for low-resource settings, which directly informs how we‚Äôre designing VDocs to be simple, accessible, and user-friendly for patients and healthcare providers.
column41: Most healthtech players focus on digitizing in silos‚ÄîEMRs, telemedicine, or lab aggregation‚Äîwhile missing that the patient must sit at the center for true continuity of care. What we understand is that adoption in India depends less on advanced tech and more on trust, simplicity, and seamless fit into existing clinic workflows. VDocs is built as a patient-centric digital vault, distributed through clinics and labs where trust already exists, making it both adoptable today and scalable tomorrow. Our unique insight is that the real moat is not just AI or storage, but becoming the default interface for every patient‚Äôs health journey, aligned with ABDM standards and usable even in low-tech settings.

column20: A wearable logger for voice, biometrics & context.
column29: Users seeking to log their life for productivity, self-reflection, or memory augmentation face a fragmented market. They are forced to choose between audio recorders (like PLAUD, Omni) that lack biometric context, and wellness trackers (like Oura, Whoop) that lack audio capture. Existing solutions are often cloud-dependent, compromising privacy and offline usability. There is no single, discreet wearable that holistically captures and integrates voice, biometrics, and environmental context with a privacy-first, local storage model.
column30: Users seeking to log their life for productivity, self-reflection, or memory augmentation face a fragmented market. They are forced to choose between audio recorders (like PLAUD, Omni) that lack biometric context, and wellness trackers (like Oura, Whoop) that lack audio capture. Existing solutions are often cloud-dependent, compromising privacy and offline usability. There is no single, discreet wearable that holistically captures and integrates voice, biometrics, and environmental context with a privacy-first, local storage model.
column31: We have designed a three-tiered line of wearable devices (Basic, Plus, Pro) that uniquely integrate high-fidelity audio capture using MEMS microphones with biometric sensors in a discreet, pendant-sized form factor. Unlike competitors, our core value proposition is user control and privacy, enabled by significant onboard microSD storage (4GB to 32GB) that eliminates dependency on a constant cloud connection. This hardware is complemented by a flexible SaaS platform that offers optional, powerful AI transcription and analysis, allowing users to choose their level of connectivity and data processing.
column32: Our primary customers are knowledge workers, founders, researchers, creators, and individuals within the neurodivergent (ADHD) and quantified-self communities. Our insight is that these users are not just buying a gadget; they seek a frictionless "memory amplifier" to capture thoughts and contextual data. They are frustrated with juggling multiple devices and apps and are increasingly privacy-conscious. We cater to their need for an integrated, reliable, and private logging system that respects their data ownership.
column40: MediEase 360 was an all-in-one medical platform, integrating features of TATA 1MG and PharmEasy. It enabled patients to track prescriptions, manage records like MRIs, and procure medication. Doctors could securely share records and recommend cost-effective generic medicines. This holistic system was recognized as a top finalist in startup and incubation competitions at premier institutes including IIT Guwahati, IIM Bombay, and IIT Madras, and was selected for a startup display at IIT Roorkee.
column41: We understand that competitors force users into a false trade-off: choose convenience (wearable form factor), audio fidelity, or privacy (local storage) but never all three. Our core insight is that the target user, a "prosumer" focused on self-improvement and productivity, demands an integrated solution without compromise. They want the ease of a wearable, the clarity of a dedicated recorder, and the security of local data ownership. Our hybrid hardware-SaaS model is architected around this principle of user control, a dimension that current market players, focused on locked cloud ecosystems, consistently undervalue.

column20: Ember is an innovative healthcare startup specializing in scientifically validated Ayurvedic burn care solutions. Our flagship product, A herbal ointment Burnicol, protected as a trade secret, offers rapid healing and infection prevention for burn injuries. We combine traditional wisdom with modern research, delivering safe, affordable, and accessible products tailored for underserved communities.
column29: Ember is addressing the urgent and widespread problem of inadequate burn care in India, where over two million people suffer burn injuries each year. Most victims‚Äîespecially in rural and low-resource regions‚Äîlack access to affordable, effective, and home-use treatments. Existing options are often costly, slow, invasive, and result in prolonged healing, high infection risk, and permanent scarring. This leaves a majority of patients underserved, leading to lifelong disabilities, emotional trauma, and severe financial hardship. Ember‚Äôs mission is to close this gap by offering innovative, accessible burn care solutions that enable faster, safer, and more affordable recovery for all.
column30: Ember is tackling a massive unmet need in the $3B+ global burn care market. India alone reports over 7 million burn injuries annually, with second- and third-degree burns leading to 140,000 deaths and 240,000 disfigurements each year. Current treatments are expensive, invasive, and hospital-dependent‚Äîfailing to serve the majority of patients in rural and low-resource areas. This leaves millions without affordable, effective, or convenient care, creating a vast underserved market. By offering a safe, non-invasive, home-use alternative that accelerates healing and prevents complications, Ember is positioned to disrupt a stagnant sector and capture significant share in both domestic and global markets.
column31: Our solution is validated by over 20,000 customers, all-natural Ayurvedic ointment designed for rapid and effective treatment of first, second, and third-degree burns. Formulated with a proprietary blend of herbal antibacterial and anti-inflammatory agents, it provides instant pain relief, robust infection prevention, and scar minimization‚Äîall without hospitalization or costly interventions. Safe, affordable, and easy to apply, it empowers convenient home-based recovery, making it especially impactful in underserved rural communities. With its formulation safeguarded as a trade secret, the product combines clinical credibility with competitive defensibility, positioning it as a scalable alternative to conventional burn care.
column32: Our target customers are individuals and families in need of effective, affordable, and convenient burn care‚Äîparticularly in communities with limited access to quality medical facilities. We are addressing both direct consumers (burn injury patients and caregivers) and distribution partners (local clinics, pharmacies, and AYUSH healthcare providers) who seek safe, natural, and easy-to-use alternatives for treating first, second, and third-degree burns. This dual focus ensures both broad household adoption and strong integration within existing healthcare channels, driving scalable reach across urban and rural markets.

column20: Measure your mental health with AI
column29: Mental health crises are skyrocketing, yet therapy is expensive, time-consuming, and stigmatized. People hesitate to seek help because they fear judgment, lack access to quality specialists, or can‚Äôt afford recurring sessions. Current apps only provide generic ‚Äúwellness tips‚Äù instead of meaningful insights about an individual‚Äôs actual cognitive or developmental state. Psychometric tools exist, but they are slow, manual, and inaccessible at scale. This leaves a massive gap: no reliable, affordable, anonymous way to measure one‚Äôs mental health early before problems escalate.
column30: Mental health crises are skyrocketing, yet therapy is expensive, time-consuming, and stigmatized. People hesitate to seek help because they fear judgment, lack access to quality specialists, or can‚Äôt afford recurring sessions. Current apps only provide generic ‚Äúwellness tips‚Äù instead of meaningful insights about an individual‚Äôs actual cognitive or developmental state. Psychometric tools exist, but they are slow, manual, and inaccessible at scale. This leaves a massive gap: no reliable, affordable, anonymous way to measure one‚Äôs mental health early before problems escalate.
column31:
PsychHelpAI is building an AI-powered framework that transforms everyday behavioral and voice data into actionable mental health insights. Unlike symptom checker apps, our system uses validated psychological logic encoded in low-code automation (N8N) to flag early cognitive distress and suggest when professional help is necessary. The platform is:
Anonymous ‚Äì Users share data without fear of judgment.
Affordable ‚Äì AI-based assessment costs far less than clinical screening.
Action-oriented ‚Äì Encourages users to approach therapists with clearer self-understanding.
By bridging the gap between ‚Äúno help‚Äù and ‚Äúclinical therapy,‚Äù we give people an accessible starting point to take control of their mental health.
column32: Our initial focus is on college students, young professionals, and highstress workforces  groups experiencing burnout, anxiety, and decision fatigue. These users need private, low cost, on-demand self-assessments to understand if they require further intervention. Over time, our solution can be licensed to colleges, corporates, and HR teams to proactively monitor well being at scale. Unlike competitors, we provide quantifiable mental health indicators, not just mood tracking, giving institutions actionable data while preserving individual privacy.

column20: SmartChainERP is a simple, distributor-first ERP platform designed for MSMEs. It streamlines orders, stock, shipments, and billing with role-based dashboards, IoT-driven real-time tracking, blockchain-backed product authentication, and AI-powered insights. Affordable and scalable, SmartChainERP helps manufacturers, distributors, and retailers manage supply chains transparently and efficiently, bridging the gap between enterprise systems and small businesses.
column29: MSMEs contribute nearly 30% to India‚Äôs GDP, yet their supply chain operations remain manual, fragmented, and inefficient. Existing ERP solutions are either too complex and expensive (like SAP), require heavy customization and developer support (like Odoo), or cover only partial workflows (like Tally or Zoho, which focus mainly on finance). This leads to overstocking or stockouts, lack of transparency between manufacturers, distributors, and retailers, counterfeit products eroding trust, and poor visibility that delays decision-making. Moreover, the unique workflows of distributors managing warehouses, extending credit, and ensuring rapid deliveries are not addressed by current systems. SmartChainERP solves these challenges with a simple, affordable, and scalable ERP designed specifically for MSMEs. It provides real-time inventory tracking via IoT, authenticity verification with blockchain-backed QR codes, and AI-powered insights for smarter decisions. By digitizing the entire workflow from manufacturer to distributor to retailer SmartChainERP creates transparent, trustworthy, and efficient supply chains, empowering MSMEs to operate with the efficiency and reliability of large enterprises.

column31: SmartChainERP is a simple, distributor-first ERP platform built specifically for MSMEs, addressing gaps that traditional ERP systems fail to cover. Unlike existing solutions that are complex, costly, or limited to finance modules, SmartChainERP digitizes the entire supply chain from manufacturer to distributor to retailer in one seamless platform. It uniquely integrates the distributor layer, enabling easy management of local warehouses, sales representatives, short-term credit, and rapid deliveries, which most ERPs overlook. With IoT-driven real-time inventory tracking, businesses can maintain accurate stock levels and prevent overstocking or stockouts. Blockchain-backed one-time QR codes ensure product authenticity, eliminating counterfeit risks and building trust across the supply chain. Powered by AI insights, SmartChainERP forecasts demand, automates workflows, and supports smarter decision-making for every stakeholder. Its role-based dashboards simplify operations for manufacturers, distributors, and retailers, making the system intuitive and easy to adopt. Delivered through an affordable, scalable SaaS model, SmartChainERP empowers MSMEs to operate with the transparency, efficiency, and agility of large enterprises while remaining budget-friendly. By bridging this critical technology gap, Vendor transforms fragmented supply chains into streamlined, intelligent networks, helping businesses grow faster and compete more effectively in a modern, fast-paced market.
column32: SmartChainERP is built for MSMEs across industries that struggle with manual, fragmented, and inefficient supply chains. Our primary customers are manufacturers in sectors like FMCG, pharmaceuticals, and agriculture that need real-time stock visibility, authenticity verification, and smarter order management. We also cater to distributors and wholesalers who manage local warehouses, sales reps, short-term credit, and rapid deliveries but lack affordable, digital tools to streamline these workflows. On the retail side, kirana shops, supermarkets, and D2C businesses benefit from transparent inventory, simplified billing, and reliable supply management. Unlike complex and expensive enterprise ERPs, SmartChainERP provides these businesses with a simple, scalable, and affordable platform to digitize their operations while addressing their specific needs. By empowering these manufacturers, distributors, and retailers to collaborate seamlessly, SmartChainERP enables MSMEs to build transparent, efficient, and trust-driven supply chains, helping them save time, reduce errors, and compete more effectively in today‚Äôs fast-paced market.

column41: We understand that most ERP solutions fail small and medium enterprises because they focus on complexity, feature overload, and rigid processes. By addressing these pain points with modular design, language support, and AI-powered automation, we bridge the gap between big ERP functionality and SME realities.
